translated: come to enjoy the maidens with us.

original: ayaṃ somaḥ kapardine ghṛtaṃ na pavate madhu
analyzed: ayam somaḥ kapardine ghṛtam na pavate madhu
translated: This Soma flows like ghee and honey to the curly-headed one.

original: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
analyzed: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
translated: May he come to enjoy the maidens with us.

original: ayaṃ ta āghṛṇe suto ghṛtaṃ na pavate śuci
analyzed: ayam te āghṛṇe sutaḥ ghṛtam na pavate śuci
translated: This Soma, O Āghṛṇi, pressed for you, flows like pure ghee.

original: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
analyzed: ā bhakṣat kanyāsu naḥ
translated: May he come to enjoy the maidens with us.

original: vāco jantuḥ kavīnāṃ pavasva soma dhārayā
analyzed: vācaḥ jantuḥ kavīnām pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: O Soma, flow as the essence of the words of the sages in a stream,

original: deveṣu ratnadhā asi
analyzed: deveṣu ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: for you are the bestower of treasures among the gods.

original: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyeno varma vi gāhate
analyzed: ā kalaśeṣu dhāvati śyenaḥ varma vi gāhate
translated: He rushes into the jars, the hawk dives into his covering,

original: abhi droṇā kanikradat
analyzed: abhi droṇā kanikradat
translated: roaring over the vats.

original: pari pra soma te raso 'sarji kalaśe sutaḥ
analyzed: pari pra soma te rasaḥ sarji kalaśe sutaḥ
translated: Your juice, O Soma, has been poured into the jars, pressed out.

original: śyeno na taktoarṣati
analyzed: śyenaḥ na taktaḥ ṛṣati
translated: He flows like a hawk let loose.

original: pavasva soma mandayannindrāya madhumattamaḥ
analyzed: pavasva soma mandayan indrāya madhumattamaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, gladdening, most rich in meath, for Indra.

original: asṛgran devavītaye vājayanto rathā iva
analyzed: asṛgran deva vītaye vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva
translated: They have been poured forth for the feast of the gods, like chariots urged to speed.

original: te sutāso madintamāḥ śukrā vāyumasṛkṣata
analyzed: te sutāsaḥ madintamāḥ śukrāḥ vāyum asṛkṣata
translated: These pressed juices, most gladdening, bright, have flowed to Vayu.

original: grāvṇā tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitraṃ soma gachasi
analyzed: grāvṇā tunnaḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitram soma gacchasi
translated: Cut with the stone, praised, O Soma, thou goest to the purifying sieve,

original: dadhat stotre suvīryam
analyzed: dadhat stotre su vīryam
translated: bearing heroic strength in the praise.

original: eṣa tunno abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitramati gāhate
analyzed: eṣa tunnaḥ abhiṣṭutaḥ pavitram ati gāhate
translated: Cut, praised, he goes through the purifying sieve,

original: rakṣohā vāramavyayam
analyzed: rakṣaḥ hā vāram avyayam
translated: the Rakshas-slayer, the sieve that never fails.

original: yadanti yacca dūrake bhayaṃ vindati māmiha
analyzed: yat anti yat ca dūrake bhayam vindati mām iha
translated: Whatever fear there is near or far away, whatever danger threatens me here,

original: pavamānavi tajjahi
analyzed: pavamānavi tat jahi
translated: O Pavamâna, drive that far away.

original: pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: pavamānaḥ saḥ adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: May Pavamâna, with his purifying power, most active,

original: yaḥ potāsa punātu naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ potā āsa punātu naḥ
translated: he who is our purifier, purify us.

original: yat te pavitramarciṣyagne vitatamantarā
analyzed: yat te pavitram arciṣi agne vitatam antarā
translated: That purifying flame of thine, O Agni, which is spread between,

original: brahma tena punīhi naḥ
analyzed: brahma tena punīhi naḥ
translated: with that purify thou us.

original: yat te pavitramarcivadagne tena punīhi naḥ
analyzed: yat te pavitram arcivat agne tena punīhi naḥ
translated: With that purifying flame of thine, O Agni, purify thou us.

original: brahmasavaiḥ punīhi naḥ
analyzed: brahma savaiḥ punīhi naḥ
translated: Purify us with the Savanas of prayer.

original: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca
analyzed: ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca
translated: With both, O God Savitar, with the purifying and the Savana,

original: māṃ punīhi viśvataḥ
analyzed: mām punīhi viśvatas
translated: purify thou me on every side.

original: tribhiṣ ṭvaṃ deva savitarvarṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ
analyzed: tribhiḥ tvam deva savitar varṣiṣṭhaiḥ soma dhāmabhiḥ
translated: With three, O God Savitar, with the most excellent, O Soma, with the powers,

original: agne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ🔽punantu māṃ devajanāḥ punantu vasavo dhiyā
analyzed: agne dakṣaiḥ punīhi naḥ  punantu mām deva janāḥ punantu vasavaḥ dhiyā
translated: with the powers, O Agni, purify thou us.🔽May the divine folk purify me, may the Vasus purify me with the thought.

original: viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā
analyzed: viśve devāḥ punīta mā jātavedaḥ punīhi mā
translated: Purify me, O Viçvedevas, purify me, O Jâtavedas.

original: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhiraṃśubhiḥ
analyzed: pra pyāyasva pra syandasva soma viśvebhiḥ aṃśubhiḥ
translated: Grow thou, flow thou, O Soma, with all thy rays,

original: devebhya uttamaṃ haviḥ
analyzed: devebhyaḥ uttamam haviḥ
translated: the best oblation for the Gods.

original: upa priyaṃ panipnataṃ yuvānamāhutīvṛdham
analyzed: upa priyam panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham
translated: To the dear, the young, the bountiful have they come,🔽bearing homage to him who waxes great by offerings.

original: aganma bibhratonamaḥ
analyzed: aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ
translated: We have come to him who bears homage.

original: alāyyasya paraśurnanāśa tamā pavasva deva soma
analyzed: alāyyasya paraśuḥ nanāśa tamā pavasva deva soma
translated: The axe of the son of Alâyu was lost; find it for him, O divine Soma.

original: ākhuṃ cideva deva soma
analyzed: ākhum cit eva deva soma
translated: Even the mouse, O divine Soma.

original: yaḥ pāvamānīradhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam
analyzed: yaḥ pāvamānīḥ adhyeti ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtam rasam
translated: He who recites the purifying hymns, the essence collected by the Rishis,

original: sarvaṃsa pūtamaśnāti svaditaṃ mātariśvanā🔽pāvamānīryo adhyety ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtaṃ rasam
analyzed: sarvam sa pūtam aśnāti svaditam mātariśvanā  pāvamānīḥ yaḥ adhyeti ṛṣibhiḥ sambhṛtam rasam
translated: He eats all that is pure, well-cooked by the wind.🔽He who recites the purifying hymns, the essence collected by the seers,

original: tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīraṃ sarpirmadhūdakam
analyzed: tasmai sarasvatī duhe kṣīram sarpiḥ madhu udakam
translated: To him Sarasvati milks milk, ghee, honey and water.

original: pra devamachā madhumanta indavo 'siṣyadanta gāva ā na dhenavaḥ
analyzed: pra deva machāḥ madhumantaḥ indavaḥ siṣyadanta gāvaḥ ā na dhenavaḥ
translated: The sweet juices have flowed forth to the god, the cows and the milch-cows have been pressed.

original: barhiṣado vacanāvanta ūdhabhiḥ parisrutamusriyānirṇijaṃ dhire🔽sa roruvadabhi pūrvā acikradadupāruhaḥ śrathayan svādatehariḥ
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ vacanāvantaḥ ūdhabhiḥ parisrutam usriyā nirṇijam dhire  sa roruvat abhi pūrvāḥ acikradat upāruhaḥ śrathayan svādatehariḥ
translated: The grass-sitters, the eloquent ones, with their udders, have supported the overflowing, the garment-like stream.🔽He roars, he has thundered to the east, tearing the clouds, the tawny one licks.

original: tiraḥ pavitramapriyannuru jrayo ni śaryāṇi dadhate deva ā varam
analyzed: tiras pavitram apriyan uru jrayaḥ ni śaryāṇi dadhate devaḥ ā varam
translated: He, rejoicing through the filter, bestows great strength, the god, the prize.

original: vi yo mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinvadakṣitā
analyzed: vi yaḥ mame yamyā saṃyatī madaḥ sākaṃvṛdhā payasā pinva dakṣitā
translated: The intoxicating drink which is shared by the twins, increasing together, swells with milk.

original: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidadabhivrajannakṣitaṃ pāja ā dade
analyzed: mahī apāre rajasī vivevidat abhivrajan akṣitam pājaḥ ā dade
translated: He has spread out the vast, boundless expanses, going forth, he has taken the imperishable light.

original: sa mātarā vicaran vājayannapaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam
analyzed: sa mātarā vicaran vājayan apaḥ pra medhiraḥ svadhayā pinvate padam
translated: He, moving with the mothers, urging the waters, the wise one, swells his place with his own nature.

original: aṃśuryavena pipiśe yato nṛbhiḥ saṃ jāmibhirnasate rakṣate śiraḥ
analyzed: aṃśuḥ yavena pipiśe yataḥ nṛbhiḥ sam jāmibhiḥ nasate rakṣate śiraḥ
translated: The ray is smeared with the juice, from which, by men, he is led with kinsmen, he guards the head.

original: saṃ dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kavirṛtasya garbho nihito yamā paraḥ
analyzed: sam dakṣeṇa manasā jāyate kaviḥ ṛtasya garbhaḥ nihitaḥ yamā paras
translated: The wise one is born with the skillful mind, the embryo of truth, placed by the twins.

original: yūnā ha santā prathamaṃ vi jajñaturguhā hitaṃ janima nemamudyatam
analyzed: yūnā ha santā prathamam vi jajñatuḥ guhā hitam janima nemam udyatam
translated: The young ones first were born from him, from the secret place, from the womb, from the hidden source

original: mandrasya rūpaṃ vividurmanīṣiṇaḥ śyeno yadandho abharat parāvataḥ
analyzed: mandrasya rūpam vividuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ śyenaḥ yat andhaḥ abharat parāvataḥ
translated: The wise have recognized the form of the joyful one, when the falcon brought it from afar

original: taṃ marjayanta suvṛdhaṃ nadīṣvā uśantamaṃśuṃ pariyantam ṛgmiyam
analyzed: tam marjayanta suvṛdham nadīṣvāḥ uśantam aṃśum pariyantam ṛgmiyam
translated: They adorn him, the prosperous one, in the rivers, the joyful one, the wave, the worthy one, the one who goes around

original: tvāṃ mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutaṃ soma ṛṣibhirmatibhirdhītibhirhitam
analyzed: tvām mṛjanti daśa yoṣaṇaḥ sutam soma ṛṣibhiḥ matibhiḥ dhītibhiḥ hitam
translated: The ten maidens cleanse you, the pressed Soma, O Soma, favored by the sages, by the thoughts, by the hymns

original: avyo vārebhiruta devahūtibhirnṛbhiryatovājamā darṣi sātaye
analyzed: avyaḥ vārebhiḥ uta deva hūtibhiḥ nṛbhiḥ yatovājamā darṣi sātaye
translated: You, whom the people invoke with the calls of the gods and the vessels, have been seen for the sake of obtaining strength

original: pariprayantaṃ vayyaṃ suṣaṃsadaṃ somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ
analyzed: pariprayantam vayyam suṣaṃsadam somam manīṣāḥ abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ
translated: The praises have followed the youthful one, the well-seated one, the Soma who is moving around

original: yo dhārayā madhumānūrmiṇā diva iyarti vācaṃ rayiṣāḷ amartyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ dhārayā madhumān ūrmiṇā divaḥ iyarti vācam rayiṣāh amartyaḥ
translated: He who with a stream, with honey, with a wave, from the sky, sends forth speech, immortal, for the sake of wealth

original: ayaṃ diva iyarti viśvamā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
analyzed: ayam divaḥ iyarti viśvam ā rajaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: He moves around this entire realm of the sky, the Soma, being purified, sits in the jars

original: adbhirgobhirmṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punāna indurvarivo vidat priyam
analyzed: adbhiḥ gobhiḥ mṛjyate adribhiḥ sutaḥ punānaḥ induḥ varivaḥ vidat priyam
translated: Being pressed with the waters, with the cows, with the stones, being purified, the Indu finds the agreeable favor

original: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāno vayo dadhaccitratamaṃ pavasva
analyzed: eva naḥ soma pariṣicyamānaḥ vayaḥ dadhat citratamam pavasva
translated: O Soma, being sprinkled, bestow upon us the most wonderful life, flow on

original: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram
analyzed: a dveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devāḥ dhatta rayim asme su vīram
translated: Let us invoke heaven and earth in a friendly way. O gods, grant us wealth with good heroes.

original: iṣurna dhanvan prati dhīyate matirvatso na māturupa sarjyūdhani
analyzed: iṣuḥ na dhanvan prati dhīyate matiḥ vatsaḥ na mātuḥ upa sarji ūdhani
translated: The thought is set in the bow like an arrow, the calf is sent forth to the udder of its mother

original: urudhāreva duhe agra āyatyasya vrateṣvapi soma iṣyate
analyzed: uru dhārā iva duhe agre āyatī asya vrateṣu api somaḥ iṣyate
translated: Like a cow with wide streams it milks the foremost, in his ordinances Soma is impelled

original: upo matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani
analyzed: upa u matiḥ pṛcyate sicyate madhu mandrājanī codate antarāsani
translated: The thought is mixed, the honey is poured, the gladdening one urges on between the two (worlds)

original: pavamānaḥ santaniḥ praghnatāmiva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāramarṣati🔽avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīraditerṛtaṃ yate
analyzed: pavamānaḥ santaniḥ praghnatām iva madhumān drapsaḥ pari vāram arṣati  avye vadhūyuḥ pavate pari tvaci śrathnīte naptīḥ aditeḥ ṛtam yate
translated: Pavamana is like a slayer of the violent, the honey-rich drop flows along the enclosing sticks🔽The bridegroom of the raw cow is purified in the skin, he is made ready for the grandson of Aditi, for truth

original: harirakrān yajataḥ saṃyato mado nṛmṇā śiśāno mahiṣo na śobhate
analyzed: yajataḥ saṃyataḥ madaḥ nṛmṇā śiśānaḥ mahiṣaḥ na śobhate
translated: The tawny, measured rapture of the worshipper is extended, the strong one shines like a bull in his strength

original: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavo devasya devīrupa yanti niṣkṛtam🔽atyakramīdarjunaṃ vāramavyayamatkaṃ na niktampari somo avyata
analyzed: ukṣā mimāti prati yanti dhenavaḥ devasya devīḥ upa yanti niṣkṛtam  atyakramīt arjunam vāram avyayam atkam na niktam pari somaḥ avyata
translated: The bull moves along, the cows go forth to meet him, the divine ones of the god go to the accomplishment (of the sacrifice)🔽He has passed over the raw, the uneaten food, Soma has clothed himself in the cleansed (cow)

original: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariramartyo nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata
analyzed: amṛktena ruśatā vāsasā hariḥ amartyaḥ nirṇijānaḥ pari vyata
translated: The tawny one, immortal, with the uninjured, ruddy garment, the purifier, has clothed himself

original: divas pṛṣṭhaṃ barhaṇā nirṇije kṛtopastaraṇaṃ camvornabhasmayam
analyzed: divaḥ pṛṣṭham barhaṇā nirṇije kṛta upastaraṇam camvoḥ nabhasmayam
translated: On the back of the sky, in the lofty cleansing, the sky-like one is spread out as a covering for the bowls

original: sūryasyeva raśmayo drāvayitnavo matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākamīrate
analyzed: sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ drāvayitnavaḥ matsarāsaḥ prasupaḥ sākam īrate
translated: Like the rays of the sun, the impetuous ones, the greedy ones, the sleepy ones, go forth together

original: tantuṃ tataṃ pari sargāsa āśavo nendrād ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana
analyzed: tantum tatam pari sargāsaḥ āśavaḥ na indrāt ṛte pavate dhāma kim cana
translated: The swift ones have spread out the woven thread of the creation; nothing moves apart from Indra.

original: sindhoriva pravaṇe nimna āśavo vṛṣacyutā madāso gātumāśata
analyzed: sindhoḥ iva pravaṇe nimne āśavaḥ vṛṣa cyutāḥ madāsaḥ gātum āśata
translated: Like swift waters on a slope, the exhilarating juices released by the bull have come to move.

original: śaṃ no niveśe dvipade catuṣpade 'sme vājaḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ niveśe dvipade catuṣpade sme vājaḥ soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to our dwelling, to our two-footed and four-footed [creatures], O Soma; let the harvests remain with us.

original: ā naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavadaśvāvad gomad yavamat suvīryam
analyzed: ā naḥ pavasva vasumat hiraṇyavat aśvāvat gomat yavamat su vīryam
translated: Flow to us with wealth in gold, with horses, with cattle, with barley, and with good strength.

original: yūyaṃ hi soma pitaro mama sthana divo mūrdhānaḥprasthitā vayaskṛtaḥ
analyzed: yūyam hi soma pitaraḥ mama sthana divaḥ mūrdhānaḥ prasthitāḥ vayaskṛtaḥ
translated: For you, O Soma, are my fathers, the heads of heaven, established, having made the young ones [of the sacrifice].

original: ete somāḥ pavamānāsa indraṃ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sātimacha
analyzed: ete somāḥ pavamānāsaḥ indram rathāḥ iva pra yayuḥ sātimacha
translated: These Soma juices, being purified, have gone to Indra, like chariots, to the winning [of booty].

original: sutāḥ pavitramati yantyavyaṃ hitvī vavriṃ haritovṛṣtimacha
analyzed: sutāḥ pavitram ati yanti avyam hitvī vavrim haritovṛṣtim acha
translated: The pressed [juices] go over the filter to the sky, having left the covering, the green [stalks], to the rain.

original: indavindrāya bṛhate pavasva sumṛḷīko anavadyo riśādāḥ
analyzed: indo indrāya bṛhate pavasva su mṛḍīkaḥ anavadyaḥ riśādāḥ
translated: O Indu, flow for Indra, the great one, well-disposed, irreproachable, the destroyer of enemies.

original: bharā candrāṇi gṛṇate vasūni devairdyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ
analyzed: bhara candrāṇi gṛṇate vasūni devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ
translated: Bring the bright things to the singer; O heaven and earth, with the gods, protect us.

original: trirasmai sapta dhenavo duduhre satyāmāśiraṃ pūrvye vyomani
analyzed: tris asmai sapta dhenavaḥ duduhre satyām āśiram pūrvye vyomani
translated: Three times seven milch cows have yielded him the true blessing in the ancient vault.

original: catvāryanyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yad ṛtairavardhata
analyzed: catvāri anyā bhuvanāni nirṇije cārūṇi cakre yat ṛtaiḥ avardhata
translated: Four other beautiful worlds he has made in the cleansing sieve, when he was exalted by the holy truths.

original: sa bhikṣamāṇo amṛtasya cāruṇa ubhe dyāvā kāvyenā vi śaśrathe
analyzed: sa bhikṣamāṇaḥ amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ ubhe dyāvā kāvyena vi śaśrathe
translated: Seeking the lovely nectar, he with his wisdom cleft asunder both the heavens

original: tejiṣṭhā apo maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sado viduḥ
analyzed: tejiṣṭhāḥ apaḥ maṃhanā pari vyata yadī devasya śravasā sadaḥ viduḥ
translated: The most radiant waters he encompassed with his might when they found the abode of the god through his glory

original: te asya santu ketavo 'mṛtyavo 'dābhyāso januṣī ubhe anu
analyzed: te asya santu ketavaḥ mṛtyavaḥ dābhyāsaḥ januṣī ubhe anu
translated: Let these be his ensigns, immortal, infallible, following both generations

original: yebhirnṛmṇā ca devyā ca punata ādid rājānaṃ mananā agṛbhṇata
analyzed: yebhiḥ nṛmṇā ca devyā ca punate ādit rājānam mananāḥ agṛbhṇata
translated: By which they purify themselves for hero strength and the godhead, they have taken the king to mind

original: sa mṛjyamāno daśabhiḥ sukarmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣuprame sacā
analyzed: sa mṛjyamānaḥ daśabhiḥ su karmabhiḥ pra madhyamāsu mātṛṣuprame sacā
translated: He, being cleansed by the ten skilful ones, is measured with the middle mothers

original: vratāni pāno amṛtasva cāruṇa ubhe nṛcakṣāanu paśyate viśau
analyzed: vratāni pānaḥ cāruṇaḥ ubhe nṛ cakṣāḥ anu paśyate viśau
translated: The laws, the drink, the lovely immortal one, the two peoples the seer looks on

original: sa marmṛjāna indriyāya dhāyasa obhe antā rodasī harṣate hitaḥ🔽vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīrādediśānaḥ śaryaheva śurudhaḥ
analyzed: sa marmṛjānaḥ indriyāya dhāyase ā ubhe antar rodasī harṣate hitaḥ  vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa bādhate vi durmatīḥ ādediśānaḥ śaryahā iva śurudhaḥ
translated: He, being anointed, for power and support, delights the two ends of the earth, being placed🔽The bull with his strength repels the evil thoughts, the one who gives away, like a swift arrow, the riches

original: sa mātarā na dadṛśāna usriyo nānadadeti marutāmiva svanaḥ
analyzed: sa mātarā na dadṛśānaḥ usriyaḥ nānadat eti marutām iva svanaḥ
translated: He is seen like a strong bull, like the sound of the Maruts his roar goes forth

original: jānannṛtaṃ prathamaṃ yat svarṇaraṃ praśastaye kamavṛṇīta sukratuḥ
analyzed: jānan ṛtam prathamam yat svarṇaram praśastaye kam avṛṇīta su kratuḥ
translated: Knowing the first truth, the golden one, the wise one has chosen it for praise

original: ruvati bhīmo vṛṣabhastaviṣyayā śṛṅge śiśāno hariṇīvicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: ruvati bhīmaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ taviṣyayā śṛṅge śiśānaḥ hariṇī vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The terrible bull roars with his might, sharpening his horns, the tawny one, the discerning one

original: ā yoniṃ somaḥ sukṛtaṃ ni ṣīdati gavyayītvag bhavati nirṇigavyayī
analyzed: ā yonim somaḥ su kṛtam ni sīdati gavyayī tvac bhavati nirṇij avyayī
translated: Soma sits down in the well-made womb, he becomes the skin of the cow, he is freed from the cow's hide.

original: śuciḥ punānastanvamarepasamavye harirnyadhāviṣṭa sānavi
analyzed: śuciḥ punānaḥ tanvam arepasam avye hariḥ nyadhāviṣṭa sānavi
translated: Pure, purifying, he makes his body free from blemish, the tawny one has flowed into the trough on the back.

original: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tridhātu madhu kriyate sukarmabhiḥ
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave tri dhātu madhu kriyate su karmabhiḥ
translated: Approved for Mitra, Varuna, and Vayu, the three-formed honey is made by the skillful ones.

original: pavasva soma devavītaye vṛṣendrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa
analyzed: pavasva soma deva vītaye vṛṣā indrasya hārdi soma dhānamā viśa
translated: Flow on, O Soma, for the feast of the gods, enter the heart of the bull, the Soma-receptacle of Indra.

original: purā no bādhād duritāti pāraya kṣetravid dhi diśa āhā vipṛchate
analyzed: purā naḥ bādhāt duritā ati pāraya kṣetra vid hi diśaḥ āha ā vipṛcchate
translated: Carry us over all evil before it overtakes us, for thou knowest the fields and tellest the inquirer the directions.

original: hito na saptirabhi vājamarṣendrasyendo jaṭharamā pavasva
analyzed: hitaḥ na saptiḥ abhi vājam arṣa indrasya indo jaṭharam ā pavasva
translated: Go forth, O steed, to the booty, flow on, O Indu, into the belly of Indra.

original: nāvā na sindhumati parṣi vidvāñchūro na yudhyannava no nida spaḥ
analyzed: nāvā na sindhumati parṣi vidvān śūraḥ na yudhyan ava naḥ nidaḥ spaḥ
translated: Like a boat, O thou that knowest the ford, carry us over the river; be a hero in battle, do not deceive us.

original: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmyāsadaṃ veti druho rakṣasaḥ pāti jāgṛviḥ🔽hariropaśaṃ kṛṇute nabhas paya upastire camvorbrahma nirṇije
analyzed: ā dakṣiṇā sṛjyate śuṣmyā āsadam veti druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ pāti jāgṛviḥ  hariropaśam kṛṇute nabhaḥ payaḥ upastire camvoḥ brahma nirṇije
translated: The swift one is let loose to the place of strength, he goes to the foe, the Rakshas, the watchful one protects.🔽The tawny one makes the sky's milk peaceful, in the trough and the bowls the Brahman is the purifier.

original: pra kriṣṭiheva śūṣa eti roruvadasuryaṃ varṇaṃ ni riṇīte asya tam
analyzed: pra kriṣṭi hā iva śūṣaḥ eti roruvat asuryam varṇam ni riṇīte asya tam
translated: He goes forth roaring like one who is to be fed, he takes away his Asura-like appearance.

original: jahāti vavriṃ pitureti niṣkṛtamupaprutaṃ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ tanā
analyzed: jahāti vavrim pituḥ eti niṣkṛtam upaprutam kṛṇute nirṇijam tanā
translated: He leaves the covering, he comes forth from the womb, he makes the garment that is to be worn the purifier.

original: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate gabhastyorvṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī
analyzed: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavate gabhastyoḥ vṛṣāyate nabhasā vepate matī
translated: Pressed out by the stones, he flows in the arms of the (sacrificer's) wife. He becomes a bull, he trembles with the wind in his mind.

original: sa modate nasate sādhate girā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi
analyzed: sa modate nasate sādhate girā nenikte apsu yajate parīmaṇi
translated: He rejoices, he moves, he is perfected by the song. He is anointed in the waters, he sacrifices in the enclosing sticks.

original: pari dyukṣaṃ sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdhaṃ madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim
analyzed: pari dyukṣam sahasaḥ parvatāvṛdham madhvaḥ siñcanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim
translated: They sprinkle the heaven-kissing (Soma) who strengthens the mountains, the guest of the house, with the sweet (juice).

original: ā yasmin gāvaḥ suhutāda ūdhani mūrdhaṃchrīṇantyagriyaṃ varīmabhiḥ
analyzed: ā yasmin gāvaḥ su hutāde ūdhani mūrdhan śrīṇanti agriyam varīmabhiḥ
translated: In whom the cows, in the well-offered (sacrifice), on the udder, extend their highest form with rich gifts.

original: samī rathaṃ na bhurijoraheṣata daśa svasāro aditerupastha ā
analyzed: samī ratham na bhurijoḥ aheṣata daśa svasāraḥ aditeḥ upasthe ā
translated: He has urged the chariot on like a strong horse to the lap of the ten sisters, Aditi.

original: jigādupa jrayati gorapīcyaṃ padaṃ yadasya matuthā ajījanan
analyzed: jigāt upa jrayati goḥ apīcyam padam yat asya matuthāḥ ajījanan
translated: He has gone to the place of the cow, the dear place which his wondrous ones have produced.

original: śyeno na yoniṃ sadanaṃ dhiyā kṛtaṃ hiraṇyayamāsadaṃ deva eṣati
analyzed: śyenaḥ na yonim sadanam dhiyā kṛtam hiraṇyayam āsadam devaḥ eṣati
translated: The bird seeks the golden seat, the place made by thought, the seat of the god.

original: e riṇanti barhiṣi priyaṃ girāśvo na devānapyeti yajñiyaḥ
analyzed: ā riṇanti barhiṣi priyam girā aśvaḥ na devān apyeti yajñiyaḥ
translated: They carry him dear by song on the sacred grass. The sacrificial horse goes to the gods.

original: parā vyakto aruṣo divaḥ kavirvṛṣā tripṛṣṭho anaviṣṭagā abhi
analyzed: parā vyaktaḥ aruṣaḥ divaḥ kaviḥ vṛṣā tri pṛṣṭhaḥ an aviṣṭa gāḥ abhi
translated: The ruddy bird of the sky, the sage, the bull with three backs, has gone to the waters.

original: sahasraṇītiryatiḥ parāyatī rebho na pūrvīruṣaso vi rājati
analyzed: sahasraṇītiḥ yatiḥ parāyatī rebhaḥ na pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ vi rājati
translated: The guest who goes far away, who goes a thousand steps, shines forth with many dawns like a singer.

original: tveṣaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute varṇo asya sa yatrāśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ
analyzed: tveṣam rūpam kṛṇute varṇaḥ asya sa yatra aśayat samṛtā sedhati sridhaḥ
translated: He assumes a wonderful form, his colour. Where he has sat down he repels the enemies of the well-ordered (sacrifice).

original: apsā yāti svadhayā daivyaṃ janaṃ saṃ suṣṭutī nasate saṃ goagrayā
analyzed: ap sāḥ yāti svadhayā daivyam janam sam suṣṭutī nasate sam go agrayā
translated: The water-flooded one goes by his own nature to the divine people, he comes with good praises and with the foremost of cows

original: ukṣeva yūthā pariyannarāvīdadhi tviṣīradhita sūryasya🔽divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣata kṣāṃ somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ
analyzed: ukṣā iva yūthā pariyan arāvīt adhi tviṣīḥ adhita sūryasya  divyaḥ suparṇaḥ va cakṣata kṣām somaḥ pari kratunā paśyate jāḥ
translated: He has roared, surrounding like a bull his own people, he has set the flames of the sun on high🔽The divine bird has looked down upon the earth, Soma, by his wisdom, looks upon the people

original: hariṃ mṛjantyaruṣo na yujyate saṃ dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somo ajyate
analyzed: harim mṛjanti aruṣaḥ na yujyate sam dhenubhiḥ kalaśe somaḥ ajyate
translated: They cleanse the tawny one, he is yoked like a red (bull), Soma is anointed in the trough together with the milch cows

original: ud vācamīrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati citparipriyaḥ
analyzed: ud vācam īrayati hinvate matī puruṣṭutasya kati cit paripriyaḥ
translated: He sends forth his voice, he impels his thoughts, some of the much-praised one's dear (cows)

original: sākaṃ vadanti bahavo manīṣiṇa indrasya somaṃ jaṭhare yadāduhuḥ
analyzed: sākam vadanti bahavaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ indrasya somam jaṭhare yadā aduhuḥ
translated: Many wise ones speak together, when they have milked Indra's Soma into his belly

original: yadī mṛjanti sugabhastayo naraḥ sanīḷābhirdaśabhiḥ kāmyaṃ madhu
analyzed: yadī mṛjanti su gabhastayaḥ naraḥ sanīḍābhiḥ daśabhiḥ kāmyam madhu
translated: When the men with ten fingers, with good hands, cleanse the dear (Soma) with the pressing-stones, the sweet (drink)

original: aramamāṇo atyeti gā abhi sūryasya priyaṃ duhitustiro ravam
analyzed: a ramamāṇaḥ atyeti gāḥ abhi sūryasya priyam duhituḥ tiras ravam
translated: He goes along, not stopping, to the cows, to the dear light of the sun, to the daughter's (rays)

original: anvasmai joṣamabharad vinaṃgṛsaḥ saṃ dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ🔽nṛdhūto adriṣuto barhiṣi priyaḥ patirgavāṃ pradiva indurṛtviyaḥ
analyzed: anu asmai joṣam abharat vinaṃgṛsaḥ sam dvayībhiḥ svasṛbhiḥ kṣeti jāmibhiḥ  nṛ dhūtaḥ adri sutaḥ barhiṣi priyaḥ patiḥ gavām pradivaḥ induḥ ṛtviyaḥ
translated: Vinangrisa has brought him his portion, he rests with the two sets of his sisters, the kinswomen🔽The man-pressed, stone-pressed, dear (Soma) on the sacrificial grass, the lord of the cows, the moon, the timely (drink)

original: purandhivān manuṣo yajñasādhanaḥ śucirdhiyāpavate soma indra te
analyzed: purandhivān manuṣaḥ yajña sādhanaḥ śuciḥ dhiyā āpavate somaḥ indra te
translated: The Soma, accompanied by the maidens, the accomplisher of man's sacrifice, is purified by the thought for thee, O Indra

original: nṛbāhubhyāṃ codito dhārayā suto 'nuṣvadhaṃ pavate soma indra te
analyzed: nṛ bāhubhyām coditaḥ dhārayā sutaḥ nuṣvadham pavate somaḥ indra te
translated: Urged by the arms of men, the pressed-out juice flows onward in a stream, Soma, O Indra, to thee.

original: āprāḥ kratūn samajairadhvare matīrverna druṣaccamvorāsadad dhariḥ🔽aṃśuṃ duhanti stanayantamakṣitaṃ kaviṃ kavayo 'paso manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: āprāḥ kratūn samajaiḥ adhvare matīḥ veḥ na druṣat camvoḥ āsadat hariḥ  aṃśum duhanti stanayantam akṣitam kavim kavayaḥ pasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: He hath attained the rites, hath gained the thoughts in the sacrifice. The tawny one hath sat down in the bowls, not to be deceived.🔽The wise, the skilful, the thoughtful ones milk the undecaying cloud, the sage, the shoot.

original: samī gāvo matayo yanti saṃyata ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ
analyzed: samī gāvaḥ matayaḥ yanti saṃyataḥ ṛtasya yonā sadane punarbhuvaḥ
translated: The songs of praise go together, the thoughts go together, to the place of sacrifice, to the seat of the ever-new.

original: nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divo 'pāmūrmau sindhuṣvantarukṣitaḥ
analyzed: nābhā pṛthivyāḥ dharuṇaḥ mahaḥ divaḥ pām ūrmau sindhuṣu antar ukṣitaḥ
translated: The navel of the earth, the prop of the great heaven, in the wave of the waters, in the rivers, is he who is set apart.

original: indrasya vajro vṛṣabho vibhūvasuḥ somo hṛdepavate cāru matsaraḥ
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vibhūvasuḥ somaḥ hṛdepavate cāru matsaraḥ
translated: The bull, the thunderbolt of Indra, of abundant wealth, Soma, the gladdener, flows to the heart.

original: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ raja stotre śikṣannādhūnvate ca sukrato
analyzed: sa tu pavasva pari pārthivam rajaḥ stotre śikṣan ādhūnvate ca su krato
translated: Flow thou around, O Indu, the earthly realm, instructing in the praise, and to the presser, O very wise one.

original: mā no nirbhāg vasunaḥ sādanaspṛśo rayiṃ piśaṅgaṃ bahulaṃ vasīmahi
analyzed: mā naḥ nirbhāj vasunaḥ sādana spṛśaḥ rayim piśaṅgam bahulam vasīmahi
translated: Do not thou forsake us, who long for the seat of wealth, may we obtain yellow, abundant riches.

original: ā tū na indo śatadātvaśvyaṃ sahasradātu paśumad dhiraṇyavat
analyzed: ā tu naḥ indo śata dātu aśvyam sahasra dātu paśumat hiraṇyavat
translated: O Indu, give us a hundredfold in horses, a thousandfold in cattle, and in gold.

original: upa māsva bṛhatī revatīriṣo 'dhi stotrasya pavamāna no gahi
analyzed: upa māsva bṛhatīḥ revatīḥ iṣaḥ dhi stotrasya pavamāna naḥ gahi
translated: Enjoy, O Pavamâna, the great, the rich food, come to our praise.

original: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ samasvarannṛtasya yonā samarantanābhayaḥ
analyzed: srakve drapsasya dhamataḥ samasvaran ṛtasya yonā samarantana abhayaḥ
translated: In the sieve the drops of the melted (butter) have resounded together, in the place of the sacrifice the naves (of the wheel) have met together.

original: trīn sa mūrdhno asuraścakra ārabhe satyasyanāvaḥ sukṛtamapīparan
analyzed: trīn sa mūrdhnaḥ asuraḥ cakre ārabhe satyasya nāvaḥ sukṛtam apīparan
translated: The Asura has taken hold of three heads; the ship of truth has brought the well-made (sacrificial implements) across.

original: samyak samyañco mahiṣā aheṣata sindhorūrmāvadhi venā avīvipan
analyzed: samyak samyañcaḥ mahiṣāḥ aheṣata sindhoḥ ūrmau adhi venāḥ avīvipan
translated: The bulls have roared together, the well-disposed ones; in the wave of the river the desirous ones have moved.

original: madhordhārābhirjanayanto arkamit priyāmindrasya tanvamavīvṛdhan
analyzed: madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ janayantaḥ arkam id priyām indrasya tanvam avīvṛdhan
translated: Begetting the hymn with the streams of honey, they have increased the dear body of Indra.

original: pavitravantaḥ pari vācamāsate pitaiṣāṃ pratno abhi rakṣati vratam
analyzed: pavitravantaḥ pari vācam āsate pitā eṣām pratnaḥ abhi rakṣati vratam
translated: With the purifying (implements) they sit around the speech; their ancient father guards their vow.

original: mahaḥ samudraṃ varuṇastiro dadhe dhīrā icchekurdharuṇeṣvārabham
analyzed: mahaḥ samudram varuṇaḥ tiras dadhe dhīrāḥ id śekuḥ dharuṇeṣu ārabham
translated: Varuṇa has placed the great ocean in the distance; the wise ones have been able to grasp the support in the bonds.

original: sahasradhāre 'va te samasvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāre vai te samasvaran divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ
translated: In the thousand-streamed (ocean) they have resounded together for thee; in the vault of the sky, the immortal ones with honey for their tongues.

original: asya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ padepade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ
analyzed: asya spaśaḥ na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade pade pāśinaḥ santi setavaḥ
translated: The swift ones of this (god) do not wink; in every place there are the snares, the bonds.

original: piturmāturadhyā ye samasvarannṛcā śocantaḥ sandahanto avratān
analyzed: pituḥ mātuḥ adhyā ye samasvaran ṛcā śocantaḥ sandahantaḥ avratān
translated: Those who have resounded together in the father and mother, the Rsis, burning with the Rc, have consumed the godless.

original: indradviṣṭāmapa dhamanti māyayā tvacamasiknīṃ bhūmano divas pari
analyzed: indra dviṣṭām apa dhamanti māyayā tvacam asiknīm bhūmanaḥ divaḥ pari
translated: With magic power they blow away the skin of him who hates Indra, from the earth and from the sky.

original: pratnān mānādadhyā ye samasvarañchlokayantrāso rabhasasya mantavaḥ
analyzed: pratnān mānādadhyāḥ ye samasvaran śloka yantrāsaḥ rabhasasya mantavaḥ
translated: Those who have sung the ancient hymns in unison, the swift-moving thoughts of the impetuous one,

original: apānakṣāso badhirā ahāsata ṛtasya panthāṃ na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: apāna kṣāsaḥ badhirāḥ ahāsata ṛtasya panthām na taranti duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The out-breathings, the deaf ones have not laughed; the evildoers do not cross the path of truth.

original: sahasradhāre vitate pavitra ā vācaṃ punanti kavayo manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāre vitate pavitre ā vācam punanti kavayaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: On the strainer with a thousand streams, spread out, the wise ones, the thinkers purify the speech.

original: rudrāsa eṣāmiṣirāso adruha spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśo nṛcakṣasaḥ🔽ṛtasya gopā na dabhāya sukratustrī ṣa pavitrā hṛdyantarā dadhe
analyzed: rudrāsaḥ eṣām iṣirāsaḥ adruhaḥ spaśaḥ svañcaḥ sudṛśaḥ nṛ cakṣasaḥ  ṛtasya gopāḥ na dabhāya su kratuḥ trī sa pavitrā hṛdi antarā dadhe
translated: The Rudras of these are powerful, not deceitful, the swift ones, the self-moving, the well-seeing ones, the ones who see men.🔽The guardian of truth, of good resolve, has placed within his heart three purifying things.

original: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paśyatyavājuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān
analyzed: vidvān sa viśvā bhuvanā abhi paśyati ava ajuṣṭān vidhyati karte avratān
translated: The wise one sees all the worlds; he pierces those who are not to be approached, those who are not devoted to the rite.

original: ṛtasya tanturvitataḥ pavitra ā jihvāyā agre varuṇasya māyayā
analyzed: ṛtasya tantuḥ vitataḥ pavitraḥ ā jihvāyāḥ agre varuṇasya māyayā
translated: The thread of truth, spread out as a strainer, is in front of the tongue, by the magic of Varuna.

original: dhīrāścit tat saminakṣanta āśatātrā kartamava padātyaprabhuh🔽śiśurna jāto 'va cakradad vane svaryad vājyaruṣaḥ siṣāsati🔽divo retasā sacate payovṛdhā tamīmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ
analyzed: dhīrāḥ cit tat saminakṣantaḥ āśata atrā kartamava padātya prabhuh  śiśuḥ na jātaḥ vaḥ cakradat vane svar yat vājī aruṣaḥ siṣāsati  divaḥ retasā sacate payaḥ vṛdhā tam īmahe sumatī śarma saprathaḥ
translated: Even the wise ones seek that out; the powerful one has gone beyond the work of the one who is here for a hundred years.🔽The child, not born, has roared in the forest; the ruddy steed, longing for glory, thirsts.🔽He goes along with the seed of heaven, the one who increases the milk; we seek him, the one with good thoughts, the shelter that is wide.

original: divo ya skambho dharuṇaḥ svātata āpūrṇo aṃśuḥ paryetiviśvataḥ
analyzed: divaḥ yaḥ skambhaḥ dharuṇaḥ su ātataḥ āpūrṇaḥ aṃśuḥ paryeti viśvatas
translated: The prop of heaven, the support, stretched out, the ray is filled, goes around from all sides.

original: seme mahī rodasī yakṣadāvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra samiṣaḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: sa ime mahī rodasī yakṣadā āvṛtā samīcīne dādhāra samiṣaḥ kaviḥ
translated: These two great worlds, heaven and earth, filled with treasures, the wise one supports, the two that move together, with food.

original: mahi psaraḥ sukṛtaṃ somyaṃ madhūrvī gavyūtiraditerṛtaṃ yate
analyzed: mahi psaraḥ su kṛtam somyam madhu urvī gavyūtiḥ aditeḥ ṛtam yate
translated: The great abode, well-made, like Soma, sweet, the cow-pasture, the truth of Aditi, is for him.

original: īśe yo vṛṣṭerita usriyo vṛṣāpāṃ netā ya itaūtirṛgmiyaḥ
analyzed: īśe yaḥ vṛṣṭeḥ itas usriyaḥ vṛṣā apām netā yaḥ itaūtiḥ ṛgmiyaḥ
translated: He who is the lord of rain, the strong bull, the leader of waters, who is to be praised, who comes hither.

original: ātmanvan nabho duhyate ghṛtaṃ paya ṛtasya nābhiramṛtaṃ vijāyate
analyzed: ātmanvat nabhaḥ duhyate ghṛtam payaḥ ṛtasya nābhiḥ amṛtam vijāyate
translated: The self-existent sky is milked for ghee and milk; from the navel of truth, immortality is born.

original: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti taṃ naro hitamava mehanti peravaḥ
analyzed: samīcīnāḥ sudānavaḥ prīṇanti tam naraḥ hitam ava mehanti peravaḥ
translated: The well-giving ones, moving together, delight him; the men, the widely-moving ones, pour down what is placed.

original: arāvīdaṃśuḥ sacamāna ūrmiṇā devāvyaṃ manuṣe pinvatitvacam
analyzed: arāvīt aṃśuḥ sacamānaḥ ūrmiṇā devāvyam manuṣe pinvatitvacam
translated: The ray has roared, moving with the wave; for the man, it swells the skin of the god-appointed.

original: dadhāti garbhamaditerupastha ā yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe
analyzed: dadhāti garbham aditeḥ upasthe ā yena tokam ca tanayam ca dhāmahe
translated: He places the embryo in Aditi's lap, by whom we may obtain offspring and progeny.

original: sahasradhāre 'va tā asaścatastṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāre vai tāḥ asaḥ catas tṛtīye santu rajasi prajāvatīḥ
translated: They have flowed into the third region, possessing a thousand streams, may they be rich in offspring.

original: catasro nābho nihitā avo divo havirbharantyamṛtaṃ ghṛtaścutaḥ🔽śvetaṃ rūpaṃ kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somo mīḍhvānasuro veda bhūmanaḥ
analyzed: catasraḥ nābhaḥ nihitāḥ avas divaḥ haviḥ bharanti amṛtam ghṛtaścutaḥ  śvetam rūpam kṛṇute yat siṣāsati somaḥ mīḍhvān asuraḥ veda bhūmanaḥ
translated: Four are placed in the navel of the sky, bearing oblation, immortal, dripping ghee.🔽When he desires, he assumes a white form; Soma, the bountiful, knows the mind of the Asura.

original: dhiyā śamī sacate semabhi pravad divas kavandhamava darṣadudriṇam
analyzed: dhiyā śamī sacate semabhi pravat divaḥ kavandhamava darṣadudriṇam
translated: By thought he follows the Shami tree with the moving ones; from the sky he has burst open the hollow trunk.

original: adha śvetaṃ kalaśaṃ gobhiraktaṃ kārṣmannā vājyakramīt sasavān
analyzed: adha śvetam kalaśam gobhiḥ aktam kārṣmannā vājī akramīt sasavān
translated: Now the white vessel filled with milk has been made ready, the strong steed has stepped on the grass, accompanied by the sacrificer's wife

original: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śatahimāya gonām
analyzed: ā hinvire manasā devayantaḥ kakṣīvate śata himāya gonām
translated: The god-fearing ones urge him with their minds, for the sake of the hundred-wintered Kakshivan's cattle

original: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te raso 'vyo vāraṃ vi pavamāna dhāvati
analyzed: adbhiḥ soma papṛcānasya te rasaḥ vyaḥ vāram vi pavamāna dhāvati
translated: O Soma, the juice of him who is sprinkled with water flows, O Pavamana, through the woolen filter

original: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhirmadintama svadasvendrāya pavamāna pītaye
analyzed: sa mṛjyamānaḥ kavibhiḥ madintama svadasva indrāya pavamāna pītaye
translated: When cleansed by the sages, most exhilarating, be sweet, O Pavamana, for Indra to drink

original: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohito nāmāni yahvo adhi yeṣu vardhate
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi pavate canohitaḥ nāmāni yahvaḥ adhi yeṣu vardhate
translated: He flows on to the dear names, well-disposed, on which the young one grows

original: ā sūryasya bṛhato bṛhannadhi rathaṃ viṣvañcamaruhad vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: ā sūryasya bṛhataḥ bṛhan adhi ratham viṣvañcam aruhat vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The all-seeing one has mounted the spacious chariot of the great sun, in the sky

original: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyaṃ vaktā patirdhiyo asyā adābhyaḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya jihvā pavate madhu priyam vaktā patiḥ dhiyaḥ asyāḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The tongue of truth flows, sweet and dear, the speaker, the lord of these thoughts, is infallible

original: dadhāti putraḥ pitrorapīcyaṃ nāma tṛtīyamadhi rocane divaḥ
analyzed: dadhāti putraḥ pitroḥ apīcyam nāma tṛtīyam adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: The son places the third, the most attractive, name above the light of the sky

original: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśānacikradan nṛbhiryemānaḥ kośa ā hiraṇyaye🔽abhīm ṛtasya dohanā anūṣatādhi tripṛṣṭha uṣaso vi rājati
analyzed: ava dyutānaḥ kalaśān acikradat nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ kośe ā hiraṇyaye  abhi īm ṛtasya dohanāḥ anūṣata adhi tri pṛṣṭhaḥ uṣasaḥ vi rājati
translated: The roaring one has roared at the jars, urged by the men in the golden vessel🔽The milkings of truth have sung to him; on the three-backed one the dawns shine forth

original: adribhiḥ suto matibhiścanohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarāśuciḥ
analyzed: adribhiḥ sutaḥ matibhiḥ canohitaḥ prarocayan rodasī mātarā aśuciḥ
translated: Pressed out with stones and made agreeable with thoughts, illuminating the two mothers, heaven and earth, with his light

original: romāṇyavyā samayā vi dhāvati madhordhārā pinvamānā divedive
analyzed: romāṇyavyā samayā vi dhāvati madhordhārā pinvamānā dive dive
translated: The hair, in due order, flows along with the stream, the stream of honey swelling day by day

original: pari soma pra dhanvā svastaye nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vāsayāśiram
analyzed: pari soma pra dhanva svastaye nṛbhiḥ punānaḥ abhi vāsaya āśiram
translated: Soma, flow onward, as a steed, to the beaker, purified by the men, to the woollen filter, for our well-being

original: ye te madā āhanaso vihāyasastebhirindraṃ codaya dātave magham
analyzed: ye te madāḥ āhanasaḥ vihāyasaḥ tebhiḥ indram codaya dātave magham
translated: With those gladdening juices of thine, O Impetuous One, urge thou Indra to bestow his bounty

original: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso dakṣo devānāmanumādyo nṛbhiḥ🔽hariḥ sṛjāno atyo na satvabhirvṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣvā
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ dakṣaḥ devānām anumādyaḥ nṛbhiḥ  hariḥ sṛjānaḥ atyaḥ na satvabhiḥ vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣvā
translated: The purifying juice flows on, the supporter of the sky, the strength of the Gods, to be extolled by men🔽The tawny one, as he is let loose, like a strong horse, strews his rays in vain over the rivers

original: śūro na dhatta āyudhā gabhastyoḥ svaḥ siṣāsan rathiro gaviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: śūraḥ na dhatte āyudhā gabhastyoḥ svar siṣāsan rathiraḥ gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: The hero hath laid his weapons in his arms, longing for light, the charioteer in the contests for the spoil

original: indrasya śuṣmamīrayannapasyubhirindurhinvāno ajyate manīṣibhiḥ
analyzed: indrasya śuṣmam īrayan apasyubhiḥ induḥ hinvānaḥ ajyate manīṣibhiḥ
translated: Stirring Indra's strength with the Apsayus (waters), Indu, urged on, is anointed by the wise

original: indrasya soma pavamāna ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇo jaṭhareṣvāviśa
analyzed: indrasya soma pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā taviṣyamāṇaḥ jaṭhareṣu āviśa
translated: O Soma Pavamâna, with thy wave, being magnified, enter the bellies (of the waters)

original: pra ṇaḥ pinva vidyudabhreva rodasī dhiyā na vājānupa māsi śaśvataḥ
analyzed: pra naḥ pinva vidyut abhrā iva rodasī dhiyā na vājān upa māsi śaśvataḥ
translated: Cause to swell us, as the lightning the clouds, O thou who art to be sought by prayer, with food evermore

original: viśvasya rājā pavate svardṛśa ṛtasya dhītim ṛṣiṣāḷ avīvaśat
analyzed: viśvasya rājā pavate svar dṛśaḥ ṛtasya dhītim ṛṣiṣāh avīvaśat
translated: The King of all, he flows on, beholding the light, and hath filled the thought of holy order, the R̥ishi's wish

original: yaḥ sūryasyāsireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnāmasamaṣṭakāvyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sūryasya asireṇa mṛjyate pitā matīnām a samaṣṭa kāvyaḥ
translated: He who is cleansed by the razor of the sun, the Father of the hymns, whose wisdom is unequalled

original: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣasyapāmupasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat🔽sa indrāya pavase matsarintamo yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthā pari kośam arṣasi apām upasthe vṛṣabhaḥ kanikradat  saḥ indrāya pavase matsarintamaḥ yathā jeṣāma samithe tvotayaḥ
translated: Like a bull in the herd, he rushes to the vat, the bull bellowing in the lap of the waters.🔽He flows for Indra, most gladdening, that we may conquer, O thou who art invoked, in the conflict.

original: eṣa pra kośe madhumānacikradadindrasya vajro vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraḥ
analyzed: eṣa pra kośe madhumān acikradat indrasya vajraḥ vapuṣaḥ vapuṣṭaraḥ
translated: This one, rich in honey, has roared in the vat, Indra's thunderbolt, more beautiful than beautiful.

original: abhīm ṛtasya sudughā ghṛtaścuto vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ
analyzed: abhi īm ṛtasya su dughāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ vāśrāḥ arṣanti payasā iva dhenavaḥ
translated: The milch-cows of holy order, dropping ghee, flow to him with milk, as it were, with streams.

original: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yaṃ divas pari śyeno mathāyadiṣitastiro rajaḥ
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ pavate yam divaḥ pari śyenaḥ mathāyat iṣitaḥ tiras rajaḥ
translated: He, the ancient one, flows around whom from heaven the hawk, urged on, has passed through the mist.

original: sa madhva ā yuvate vevijāna it kṛśānorasturmanasāha bibhyuṣā
analyzed: sa madhvaḥ ā yuvate vevijānaḥ id kṛśānoḥ astuḥ manasā aha bibhyuṣā
translated: He, the sweet one, is carried along, trembling, by the mind of the swift one, fearing the heat.

original: te naḥ pūrvāsa uparāsa indavo mahe vājāya dhanvantu gomate
analyzed: te naḥ pūrvāsaḥ uparāsaḥ indavaḥ mahe vājāya dhanvantu gomate
translated: May the earlier and later drops of Soma flow to us for great strength, for wealth in cattle.

original: īkṣeṇyāso ahyo na cāravo brahmabrahma ye jujuṣurhavir haviḥ
analyzed: īkṣeṇyāsaḥ ahyaḥ na cāravaḥ brahma brahma ye jujuṣuḥ haviḥ haviḥ
translated: To be gazed upon, swift as birds, they, whom each prayer and each offering delights,

original: ayaṃ no vidvān vanavad vanuṣyata induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ🔽inasya yaḥ sadane garbhamādadhe gavāmurubjamabhyarṣati vrajam
analyzed: ayam naḥ vidvān vanavat vanuṣyate induḥ satrācā manasā puruṣṭutaḥ  inasya yaḥ sadane garbham ādadhe gavām urubjam abhyarṣati vrajam
translated: This wise one, knowing, will choose for us, the much-praised Soma, with his mind ever intent.🔽He who has placed the embryo in the abode of the cloud, flows to the stall of the cow, the great udder.

original: cakrirdivaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso mahānadabdho varuṇo hurugyate
analyzed: cakriḥ divaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ mahān adabdhaḥ varuṇaḥ hurugyate
translated: The all-creating juice flows from the wheel of the sky. Great Varuna, the irresistible one, moves swiftly.

original: asāvi mitro vṛjaneṣu yajñiyo 'tyo na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat
analyzed: asāvi mitraḥ vṛjaneṣu yajñiyaḥ tyaḥ na yūthe vṛṣayuḥ kanikradat
translated: Mitra, the worshipper, is pressed in the rites, like a bull bellowing in the herd, the strong one

original: pra rājā vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadadapo vasāno abhi gā iyakṣati
analyzed: pra rājā vācam janayan asiṣyadat apaḥ vasānaḥ abhi gāḥ iyakṣati
translated: The king, generating speech, has flowed forth, clothed in the waters, he will attack the cows

original: gṛbhṇāti ripramavirasya tānvā śuddho devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam
analyzed: gṛbhṇāti ripram aviḥ asya tān vā śuddhaḥ devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: He grasps the fault of the wicked one, pure, he approaches the right of the gods

original: indrāya soma pari ṣicyase nṛbhirnṛcakṣā ūrmiḥ kavirajyase vane
analyzed: indrāya soma pari sicyase nṛbhiḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ ūrmiḥ kaviḥ ajyase vane
translated: O Soma, you are poured forth for Indra by men, the wave, seeing men, is consecrated in the wood

original: pūrvīrhi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasramaśvā harayaścamūṣadaḥ
analyzed: pūrvīḥ hi te srutayaḥ santi yātave sahasram aśvāḥ harayaḥ camūṣadaḥ
translated: For you have many streams for your course, a thousand bay steeds who sit in the bowls

original: samudriyā apsaraso manīṣiṇamāsīnā antarabhi somamakṣaran
analyzed: samudriyāḥ apsarasaḥ manīṣiṇam āsīnāḥ antar abhi somam akṣaran
translated: The ocean-going Apsarases, the wise ones, seated within, have flowed to the Soma

original: tā īṃ hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇiṃ yācante sumnaṃ pavamānamakṣitam
analyzed: tāḥ īm hinvanti harmyasya sakṣaṇim yācante sumnam pavamānam akṣitam
translated: They impel him, the guardian of the abode, they ask for the bliss, the unfailing Pavamana

original: gojin naḥ somo rathajid dhiraṇyajit svarjidabjit pavate sahasrajit
analyzed: go jit naḥ somaḥ ratha jit hiraṇya jit svar jit abjit pavate sahasra jit
translated: Soma, the winner of cattle, the winner of chariots, the winner of gold, the winner of heaven, the winner of water, flows forth, the winner of a thousand

original: yaṃ devāsaścakrire pītaye madaṃ svādiṣṭhaṃ drapsamaruṇaṃ mayobhuvam
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ cakrire pītaye madam svādiṣṭham drapsam aruṇam mayobhuvam
translated: The gods have made him, the drop, most sweet to drink, the ruddy one, the bountiful one, for their rapture

original: etāni soma pavamāno asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇānyarṣasi
analyzed: etāni soma pavamānaḥ asmayuḥ satyāni kṛṇvan draviṇāni arṣasi
translated: O Soma Pavamana, making these true things, you flow on, making riches for us

original: jahi śatrumantike dūrake ca ya urvīṃ gavyūtimabhayaṃ ca nas kṛdhi
analyzed: jahi śatrum antike dūrake ca yaḥ urvīm gavyūtim abhayam ca naḥ kṛdhi
translated: Destroy the enemy near and far, and make for us wide pasture and security

original: acodaso no dhanvantvindavaḥ pra suvānāso bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ
analyzed: acodasaḥ naḥ dhanvantu indavaḥ pra suvānāsaḥ bṛhaddiveṣu harayaḥ
translated: Let the juices flow to us unbidden, O ye swift ones, the tawny ones, well pressed, in the great festivals.

original: vi ca naśan na iṣo arātayo 'ryo naśanta saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ🔽pra ṇo dhanvantvindavo madacyuto dhanā vā yebhirarvato junīmasi
analyzed: vi ca naśan naḥ iṣaḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naśanta saniṣanta naḥ dhiyaḥ  pra naḥ dhanvantu indavaḥ mada cyutaḥ dhanā vā yebhiḥ arvataḥ junīmasi
translated: Let the evil spirits turn away from us, and let our thoughts be successful, O ye to be worshipped.🔽Let the juices flow to us, O ye that are rich in wealth, with which we may yoke the swift horses, O ye that are rich in wealth.

original: tiro martasya kasya cit parihvṛtiṃ vayaṃ dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi
analyzed: tiras martasya kasya cit parihvṛtim vayam dhanāni viśvadhā bharemahi
translated: May we, in every way, O ye juices, carry off the wealth, beyond the reach of any mortal's envy.

original: uta svasyā arātyā arirhi ṣa utānyasyā arātyā vṛko hi ṣaḥ
analyzed: uta svasyāḥ arātyāḥ ariḥ hi sa uta anyasyāḥ arātyāḥ vṛkaḥ hi saḥ
translated: The wolf is indeed the enemy of our own cattle, and the enemy of other people's cattle.

original: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā samarīta tānabhi soma jahipavamāna durādhyaḥ🔽divi te nābhā paramo ya ādade pṛthivyāste ruruhuḥ sānavikṣipaḥ
analyzed: dhanvan na tṛṣṇā samarīta tān abhi soma jahi pavamāna durādhyaḥ  divi te nābhā paramaḥ yaḥ ādade pṛthivyāḥ te ruruhuḥ sāna vikṣipaḥ
translated: O Soma, drive away from us, O thou that art purified, the thirst that is in the desert, the evil spirits.🔽Thy navel is in the sky, which hath taken away the highest (waters); thy waves have risen up from the earth.

original: adrayastvā bapsati goradhi tvacyapsu tvā hastairduduhurmanīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: adrayaḥ tvā bapsati goḥ adhi tvaci apsu tvā hastaiḥ duduhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The pressing-stones press thee out upon the skin of the cow; the wise ones have milked thee with their hands in the waters.

original: evā ta indo subhvaṃ supeśasaṃ rasaṃ tuñjanti prathamā abhiśriyaḥ
analyzed: eva te indo su bhvam supeśasam rasam tuñjanti prathamāḥ abhiśriyaḥ
translated: Thus, O Indu, they urge thy juice, which is rich in milk, and beautiful, in the first abodes.

original: nidaṃnidaṃ pavamāna ni tāriṣa āviste śuṣmo bhavatu priyo madaḥ
analyzed: nidaṃnidam pavamāna ni tāriṣaḥ āvis te śuṣmaḥ bhavatu priyaḥ madaḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, do thou carry over this and this; let thy strength be great, and thy gladdening juice dear (to thee).

original: somasya dhārā pavate nṛcakṣasa ṛtena devān havate divas pari
analyzed: somasya dhārā pavate nṛ cakṣasaḥ ṛtena devān havate divaḥ pari
translated: The stream of Soma flows, having the eyes of men; with the holy power it invokes the gods around the sky.

original: bṛhaspate ravathenā vi didyute samudrāso na savanāni vivyacuḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspate ravathena vi didyute samudrāsaḥ na savanāni vivyacuḥ
translated: Brihaspati shines with his radiance, the oceans have opened for the libations.

original: yaṃ tvā vājinnaghnyā abhyanūṣatāyohataṃ yonimā rohasi dyumān🔽maghonāmāyuḥ pratiran mahi śrava indrāya somapavase vṛṣā madaḥ
analyzed: yam tvā vājin aghnyāḥ abhyanūṣata ayaḥ hatam yonim ā rohasi dyumān  maghonām āyuḥ pratirat mahi śravaḥ indrāya soma pavase vṛṣā madaḥ
translated: O strong one, when the cows have sung to you, you ascend your radiant birthplace, struck.🔽Extending the life of the generous ones, great fame, as a bull, the rapture, you flow for Indra, O Soma.

original: endrasya kukṣā pavate madintama ūrjaṃ vasānaḥ śravase sumaṅgalaḥ
analyzed: ā indrasya kukṣā pavate madintamaḥ ūrjam vasānaḥ śravase su maṅgalaḥ
translated: The most intoxicating flows into Indra's belly, clothed in strength, auspicious for fame.

original: pratyaṃ sa viśvā bhuvanābhi paprathe krīḷan hariratyaḥ syandate vṛṣā
analyzed: pratyam sa viśvā bhuvanā abhi paprathe krīḍan hariratyaḥ syandate vṛṣā
translated: He has spread out over all the worlds, the tawny one, sporting, flows as a bull.

original: taṃ tvā devebhyo madhumattamaṃ naraḥ sahasradhāraṃ duhate daśa kṣipaḥ
analyzed: tam tvā devebhyaḥ madhumattamam naraḥ sahasra dhāram duhate daśa kṣipaḥ
translated: Men milk you, the most sweet for the gods, the one with a thousand streams, with ten fingers.

original: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyuto grāvabhiḥ suto viśvāndevānā pavasvā sahasrajit
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ soma pracyutaḥ grāvabhiḥ sutaḥ viśvān devān ā pavasva sahasra jit
translated: O Soma, having been pressed by men, having been pressed by the pressing stones, flow to all the gods, O winner of a thousand (spoils)!

original: taṃ tvā hastino madhumantamadribhirduhantyapsu vṛṣabhandaśa kṣipaḥ🔽indraṃ soma mādayan daivyaṃ janaṃ sindhorivormiḥ pavamāno arṣasi
analyzed: tam tvā hastinaḥ madhumantam adribhiḥ duhanti apsu vṛṣabhan daśa kṣipaḥ  indram soma mādayan daivyam janam sindhoḥ iva ūrmiḥ pavamānaḥ arṣasi
translated: The milkers, with stones, milk you, the most sweet, the bull, the one with ten fingers, in the waters.🔽O Soma, gladdening Indra, the divine people, you flow like a wave of the river, O Pavamana.

original: pra somasya pavamānasyormaya indrasya yanti jaṭharaṃ supeśasaḥ
analyzed: pra somasya pavamānasya ūrmayaḥ indrasya yanti jaṭharam supeśasaḥ
translated: The waves of Soma Pavamana, well-formed, go into Indra's belly.

original: dadhnā yadīmunnītā yaśasā gavāṃ dānāya śūramudamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ
analyzed: dadhnā yadi īm unnītāḥ yaśasā gavām dānāya śūram udamandiṣuḥ sutāḥ
translated: When they have raised her with curds, the drops of Soma, for the sake of giving, have been gladdened by the fame of the cows

original: achā hi somaḥ kalaśānasiṣyadadatyo na voḷhā raghuvartanirvṛṣā
analyzed: achā hi somaḥ kalaśān asiṣyat adatyaḥ na voḍhā raghu varta nirvṛṣā
translated: For the Soma has flowed into the jars, like a strong bull with swift course, swollen

original: athā devānāmubhayasya janmano vidvānaśnotyamuta itaśca yat
analyzed: athā devānām ubhayasya janmanaḥ vidvān aśnoti amutas itas ca yat
translated: Then, knowing both births of the gods, he eats what is here and what is yonder

original: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kirā vasvindo bhava maghavā rādhaso mahaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ soma pavamānaḥ kira vasu indo bhava maghavā rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: O Soma Pavamana, bring us wealth, O Indu, be a great lord of bounty

original: śikṣā vayodho vasave su cetunā mā no gayamāre asmat parā sicaḥ
analyzed: śikṣa vayodhaḥ vasave su cetunā mā naḥ gayamāre asmat parā sicaḥ
translated: Teach us, O seeker of wealth, to win by good choice; do not lead our song away from us

original: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ surātayo mitro gachantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ pūṣā pavamānaḥ su rātayaḥ mitraḥ gacchantu varuṇaḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: May Pusan, Pavamana, with good favours, Mitra, Varuna, come to us with the same mind

original: bṛhaspatirmaruto vāyuraśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā suyamā sarasvatī
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ marutaḥ vāyuḥ aśvinā tvaṣṭā savitā su yamā sarasvatī
translated: Brihaspati, the Maruts, Vayu, the two Asvins, Tvashtar, Savitar, the well-ruling Sarasvati

original: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devo aditirvidhātā
analyzed: ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaminve aryamā devaḥ aditiḥ vidhātā
translated: Both heaven and earth, all-impelling, Aryaman, the god, Aditi, the ordainer

original: bhago nṛśaṃsa urvantarikṣaṃ viśve devāḥ pavamānaṃjuṣanta
analyzed: bhagaḥ nṛśaṃsaḥ uru antarikṣam viśve devāḥ pavamānam juṣanta
translated: Bhaga, the lord of men, the wide atmosphere, all the gods delight in Pavamana

original: asāvi somo aruṣo vṛṣā harī rājeva dasmo abhi gā acikradat
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ aruṣaḥ vṛṣā hariḥ rājā iva dasmaḥ abhi gāḥ acikradat
translated: The red, strong Soma has flowed, the tawny one has roared to the cows like a king

original: punāno vāraṃ paryetyavyayaṃ śyeno na yoniṃ ghṛtavantamāsadam
analyzed: punānaḥ vāram paryeti avyayam śyenaḥ na yonim ghṛtavantam āsadam
translated: Purified, he has gone round the fleece, the unchanging one, like a hawk to his nest, rich in ghee

original: kavirvedhasyā paryeṣi māhinamatyo na mṛṣṭo abhi vājamarṣasi
analyzed: kaviḥ vedhasyā paryeṣi māhina matyaḥ na mṛṣṭaḥ abhi vājam arṣasi
translated: The wise one, by the impulse of the creator, seekest the great, like a horse when groomed thou speedest to the prize

original: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḷaya ghṛtaṃ vasānaḥ pariyāsi nirṇijam🔽parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇino nābhā pṛthivyā giriṣukṣayaṃ dadhe
analyzed: apasedhan duritā soma mṛḍaya ghṛtam vasānaḥ pariyāsi nirṇijam  parjanyaḥ pitā mahiṣasya parṇinaḥ nābhā pṛthivyāḥ giriṣu kṣayam dadhe
translated: Driving away evils, O Soma, be propitious, clothed in ghee thou goest to the cleansing sieve🔽Parjanya is the father of the mighty cloud, he hath placed his abode in the mountains, in the navel of the earth

original: svasāra āpo abhi gā utāsaran saṃ grāvabhirnasate vīte adhvare
analyzed: svasāraḥ āpaḥ abhi gāḥ uta asaran sam grāvabhiḥ nasate vīte adhvare
translated: The sisters, the waters, have come to the cows, he is joined with the pressing-stones in the completed sacrifice

original: jāyeva patyāvadhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyā garbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te
analyzed: jāyā iva patyau adhi śeva maṃhase pajrāyāḥ garbha śṛṇuhi bravīmi te
translated: As a wife delights in her husband, so delight in me, O embryo of the womb, listen to what I say to thee

original: antarvāṇīṣu pra carā su jīvase 'nindyo vṛjane soma jāgṛhi
analyzed: antarvāṇīṣu pra cara su jīvase nindyaḥ vṛjane soma jāgṛhi
translated: Move among the people for the sake of good life, be irreproachable in the assembly, O Soma, be watchful

original: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śatasā amṛdhraḥ sahasrasāḥ paryayā vājamindo
analyzed: yathā pūrvebhyaḥ śata sāḥ amṛdhraḥ sahasra sāḥ paryayāḥ vājamindo
translated: As thou hast gone round for the sake of a hundred and a thousand, O Indu, unhindered for the earlier ones,

original: evā pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratamanvāpaḥ sacante
analyzed: eva pavasva suvitāya navyase tava vratam anu āpaḥ sacante
translated: So flow for the sake of new prosperity, the waters follow thy ordinance

original: pavitraṃ te vitataṃ brahmaṇas pate prabhurgātrāṇi paryeṣiviśvataḥ
analyzed: pavitram te vitatam brahmaṇas pate prabhuḥ gātrāṇi paryeṣi viśvatas
translated: The filter is spread out for thee, O lord of holy power, thou art the lord, thou seekest the limbs from all sides

original: ataptatanūrna tadāmo aśnute śṛtāsa id vahantastat samāśata
analyzed: a tapta tanūḥ na tadā āmaḥ aśnute śṛtāsaḥ id vahantaḥ tat samāśata
translated: The unheated body does not reach it, the heated ones indeed carry it, they have attained it

original: tapoṣ pavitraṃ vitataṃ divas pade śocanto asya tantavo vyasthiran
analyzed: tapoḥ pavitram vitatam divaḥ pade śocantaḥ asya tantavaḥ vyasthiran
translated: The purifying heat is spread out in the place of heaven, the glowing threads have been set in order

original: avantyasya pavītāramāśavo divas pṛṣṭhamadhitiṣṭhanti cetasā🔽arūrucaduṣasaḥ pṛśniragriya ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ
analyzed: avanti asya pavītāram āśavaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭham adhitiṣṭhanti cetasā  arūrucat uṣasaḥ pṛśniḥ agriyaḥ ukṣā bibharti bhuvanāni vājayuḥ
translated: The swift ones occupy with their mind the back of the sky, the purifier of Avanti🔽The dappled bull, the first, shines forth at dawn, bearing the worlds, the winner of strength

original: māyāvino mamire asya māyayā nṛcakṣasaḥ pitaro garbhamā dadhuḥ
analyzed: māyāvinaḥ mamire asya māyayā nṛ cakṣasaḥ pitaraḥ garbhamā dadhuḥ
translated: The wondrous ones, the fathers, the seers, have placed the embryo by his magic power

original: gandharva itthā padamasya rakṣati pāti devānāṃ janimānyadbhutaḥ🔽gṛbhṇāti ripuṃ nidhayā nidhāpatiḥ sukṛttamā madhuno bhakṣamāśata
analyzed: gandharvaḥ itthā padam asya rakṣati pāti devānām janimāni adbhutaḥ  gṛbhṇāti ripum nidhayā nidhā patiḥ su kṛttamāḥ madhunaḥ bhakṣam āśata
translated: The Gandharva guards his place here, the wondrous one protects the generations of the gods🔽The lord of treasures seizes the foe with his treasure; the most skillful ones have come to the share of honey

original: havirhaviṣmo mahi sadma daivyaṃ nabho vasānaḥ pari yāsyadhvaram
analyzed: haviḥ haviṣmas mahi sadma daivyam nabhaḥ vasānaḥ pari yāsi adhvaram
translated: Wearing the heavenly abode, clothed in the vault, you shall go around the sacrifice, O oblation-worthy one

original: rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayasi śravo bṛhat
analyzed: rājā pavitra rathaḥ vājam āruhaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ jayasi śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The king with the chariot of the filter, mounted on strength, with a thousand spikes, you conquer great glory

original: pavasva devamādano vicarṣaṇirapsā indrāya varuṇāya vāyave
analyzed: pavasva deva mādanaḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ apsāḥ indrāya varuṇāya vāyave
translated: Flow, delighting the gods, most active, for Indra, for Varuṇa, for Vāyu

original: kṛdhī no adya varivaḥ svastimadurukṣitau gṛṇīhi daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: kṛdhī naḥ adya varivaḥ svastimat uru kṣitau gṛṇīhi daivyam janam
translated: Make room for us today, O bountiful one, in the wide expanse; praise the divine people

original: ā yastasthau bhuvanānyamartyo viśvāni somaḥ pari tānyarṣati
analyzed: ā yaḥ tasthau bhuvanāni amartyaḥ viśvāni somaḥ pari tāni arṣati
translated: He who stands here, the immortal one among the worlds, Soma flows around them all

original: kṛṇvan saṃcṛtaṃ vicṛtamabhiṣṭaya induḥ siṣaktyuṣasaṃ na sūryaḥ
analyzed: kṛṇvan saṃcṛtam vicṛtam abhiṣṭaye induḥ siṣakti uṣasam na sūryaḥ
translated: Making the scattered and the gathered his support, Indu moves on, like the sun to dawn

original: ā yo gobhiḥ sṛjyata oṣadhīṣvā devānāṃ sumna iṣayannupāvasuḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ gobhiḥ sṛjyate oṣadhīṣvā devānām sumne iṣayan upāvasuḥ
translated: He who is sent forth with the cows among the plants, bringing the wealth of the gods, the favor of the gods,

original: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā suta indraṃ somo mādayan daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: ā vidyutā pavate dhārayā sutaḥ indram somaḥ mādayan daivyam janam
translated: The Soma flows with lightning in its stream, pressed out, gladdening Indra and the divine people.

original: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasrajid dhinvāno vācamiṣirāmuṣarbudham
analyzed: eṣa sya somaḥ pavate sahasra jit dhinvānaḥ vācam iṣirām uṣarbudham
translated: This Soma flows, conquering in a thousand ways, stimulating the swift-moving speech of the dawn-knowing one.

original: induḥ samudramudiyarti vāyubhirendrasya hārdikalaśeṣu sīdati
analyzed: induḥ samudram udiyarti vāyubhiḥ indrasya hārdi kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: The moon rises to the ocean with the winds, and settles in Indra's heart-cauldrons.

original: abhi tyaṃ gāvaḥ payasā payovṛdhaṃ somaṃ śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svarvidam🔽dhanaṃjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyo raso vipraḥ kaviḥkāvyenā svarcanāḥ
analyzed: abhi tyam gāvaḥ payasā payaḥ vṛdham somam śrīṇanti matibhiḥ svar vidam  dhanaṃjayaḥ pavate kṛtvyaḥ rasaḥ vipraḥ kaviḥ kāvyena svar canāḥ
translated: The cows mix this Soma, the increaser of milk, with milk, with thoughts, finding the heaven.🔽The conquering juice flows, to be made ready, the sage, the poet, to be praised with his poem.

original: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari sravāpāmīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha
analyzed: indrāya soma suṣutaḥ pari srava apa amīvā bhavatu rakṣasā saha
translated: O Soma, well-pressed, flow around this one who finds the heaven, may the evil spell be with the Rakshas.

original: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvino draviṇasvanta iha santvindavaḥ
analyzed: mā te rasasya matsata dvayāvinaḥ draviṇasvantaḥ iha santu indavaḥ
translated: Let not the two-natured ones taste of thy juice; let the juices be here rich in treasure.

original: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣo devānāmasi hi priyo madaḥ
analyzed: asmān samarye pavamāna codaya dakṣaḥ devānām asi hi priyaḥ madaḥ
translated: O Pavamana, impel us to the battle; thou art the power, the dear joy of the gods.

original: jahi śatrūnrabhyā bhandanāyataḥ pibendra somamava no mṛdho jahi
analyzed: jahi śatrūn rabhyā bhandanāyataḥ piba indra somam ava naḥ mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: Slay the enemies, O Indra, who come to fight; drink the Soma, O Indra, drive away our foes.

original: adabdha indo pavase madintama ātmendrasya bhavasi dhāsiruttamaḥ
analyzed: adabdhaḥ indo pavase madintamaḥ ātmā indrasya bhavasi dhāsiḥ uttamaḥ
translated: O Indu, thou flowest invincible, most gladdening; thou becomest the best supporter of Indra's self.

original: abhi svaranti bahavo manīṣiṇo rājānamasya bhuvanasyaniṃsate
analyzed: abhi svaranti bahavaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ rājānam asya bhuvanasya niṃsate
translated: Many wise ones sing to him, the king of this world is praised

original: sahasraṇīthaḥ śatadhāro adbhuta indrāyenduḥ pavate kāmyaṃ madhu
analyzed: sahasraṇīthaḥ śata dhāraḥ adbhutaḥ indrāya induḥ pavate kāmyam madhu
translated: The wondrous moon flows for Indra, with a thousand paths, a hundred streams, delightful honey

original: jayan kṣetramabhyarṣā jayannapa uruṃ no gātuṃ kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ🔽kanikradat kalaśe gobhirajyase vyavyayaṃ samayā vāramarṣasi🔽marmṛjyamāno atyo na sānasirindrasya soma jaṭhare samakṣaraḥ
analyzed: jayan kṣetram abhyarṣa jayan apaḥ urum naḥ gātum kṛṇu soma mīḍhvaḥ  kanikradat kalaśe gobhiḥ ajyase vi avyayam samayā vāram arṣasi  marmṛjyamānaḥ atyaḥ na sānasiḥ indrasya soma jaṭhare samakṣaraḥ
translated: Conquering the field, flow hither, conquering the foe, O bountiful Soma, make a wide path for us🔽Neighing in the vat, thou art anointed with milk, thou passest through the wool in due time🔽Being cleansed, thou flowest into Indra's belly like a swift horse to the stake

original: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svādurindrāya suhavītunāmne
analyzed: svāduḥ pavasva divyāya janmane svāduḥ indrāya suhavītu nāmne
translated: Be sweet as thou flowest for the heavenly race, sweet for Indra, whose name is easily invoked

original: svādurmitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhumānadābhyaḥ🔽atyaṃ mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇāṃ matayo vāca īrate
analyzed: svāduḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave bṛhaspataye madhu māna dābhyaḥ  atyam mṛjanti kalaśe daśa kṣipaḥ pra viprāṇām matayaḥ vācaḥ īrate
translated: Sweet for Mitra, Varuna, Vayu, Brihaspati, rich in honey, invincible🔽They cleanse the swift one in the vat with ten fingers, the thoughts of the seers and the voices (of the priests) move in order

original: pavamānā abhyarṣanti suṣṭutimendraṃ viśantimadirāsa indavaḥ
analyzed: pavamānāḥ abhyarṣanti suṣṭutim indram viśanti madirāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The purifying (waters) flow on, they reach the praise, the gladdening drops enter Indra

original: pavamāno abhyarṣā suvīryamurvīṃ gavyūtiṃ mahi śarma saprathaḥ
analyzed: pavamānaḥ abhyarṣa su vīryam urvīm gavyūtim mahi śarma saprathaḥ
translated: O Pavamana, flow on to us great hero strength, wide pasture for our cattle, great easy shelter

original: mākirno asya pariṣūtirīśatendo jayema tvayādhanaṃdhanam
analyzed: mākir naḥ asya pariṣūtiḥ īśata indo jayema tvayā adhanaṃdhanam
translated: Let not the overturning of this (earth) be our portion. O Indra, may we win wealth with thee, O wealthy one.

original: adhi dyāmasthād vṛṣabho vicakṣaṇo 'rūrucad vi divo rocanā kaviḥ
analyzed: adhi dyām asthāt vṛṣabhaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ rūrucat vi divaḥ rocanā kaviḥ
translated: The all-seeing bull hath mounted to the sky, the sage hath shone forth through the luminous realms of heaven.

original: rājā pavitramatyeti roruvad divaḥ pīyūṣanduhate nṛcakṣasaḥ
analyzed: rājā pavitram atyeti roruvat divaḥ pīyūṣan duhate nṛ cakṣasaḥ
translated: The king, roaring, passes through the purifying sieve; the eye of men milks the milk of heaven.

original: divo nāke madhujihvā asaścato venā duhantyukṣaṇaṃ giriṣṭhām
analyzed: divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ venāḥ duhanti ukṣaṇam giriṣṭhām
translated: In the vault of the sky, the immortal ones with sweet tongues milk the unpressed juice that dwells in the mountain.

original: apsu drapsaṃ vāvṛdhānaṃ samudra ā sindhorūrmāmadhumantaṃ pavitra ā
analyzed: apsu drapsam vāvṛdhānam samudre ā sindhoḥ ūrmā madhumantam pavitre ā
translated: In the waters, in the ocean, they milk the growing drop, the sweet wave, through the purifying sieve.

original: nāke suparṇamupapaptivāṃsaṃ giro venānāmakṛpanta pūrvīḥ
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upapaptivāṃsam giraḥ venānām akṛpanta pūrvīḥ
translated: The many songs of the longing ones have flown to the bird in the vault of the sky.

original: śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ hiraṇyayaṃ śakunaṃ kṣāmaṇi sthām
analyzed: śiśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam hiraṇyayam śakunam kṣāmaṇi sthām
translated: The thoughts kiss the youngling, the golden bird, that rests on the back.

original: ūrdhvo gandharvo adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇo asya
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ gandharvaḥ adhi nāke asthāt viśvā rūpā praticakṣāṇaḥ asya
translated: The Gandharva, standing erect, hath mounted to the vault of the sky, beholding all forms.

original: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vyadyaut prārūrucad rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
analyzed: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā vyadyaut prārūrucat rodasī mātarā śuciḥ
translated: The light hath shone with pure radiance; the pure one hath shone forth to the two mothers, heaven and earth.

original: pra ta āśavaḥ pavamāna dhījavo madā arṣanti raghujā iva tmanā
analyzed: pra te āśavaḥ pavamāna dhī javaḥ madāḥ arṣanti raghu jāḥ iva tmanā
translated: O Pavamâna, thy swift thoughts, thy joys, flow onward, like swift horses, of themselves.

original: divyāḥ suparṇā madhumanta indavo madintamāsaḥ pari kośamāsate
analyzed: divyāḥ suparṇāḥ madhumantaḥ indavaḥ madintamāsaḥ pari kośam āsate
translated: The heavenly birds, the drops full of sweetness, the most gladdening, sit in the vat.

original: pra te madāso madirāsa āśavo 'sṛkṣata rathyāso yathā pṛthak
analyzed: pra te madāsaḥ madirāsaḥ āśavaḥ sṛkṣata rathyāsaḥ yathā pṛthak
translated: Thy gladdening juices, thy most sweet and swift, have flowed apart like chariots.

original: dhenurna vatsaṃ payasābhi vajriṇamindramindavo madhumanta ūrmayaḥ
analyzed: dhenuḥ na vatsam payasā abhi vajriṇam indram indavaḥ madhumantaḥ ūrmayaḥ
translated: Like a cow to her calf with milk, the Soma drops, rich in honey, flow to the wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra.

original: atyo na hiyāno abhi vājamarṣa svarvit kośaṃ divo adrimātaram
analyzed: atyaḥ na hiyānaḥ abhi vāja marṣa svar vid kośam divaḥ adri mātaram
translated: Like a swift horse rushing to the prize, the finder of light, the ocean-born, the son of the mountain, flows.

original: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punāna indriyāya dhāyase
analyzed: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avyaye somaḥ punānaḥ indriyāya dhāyase
translated: The bull in the pure sieve, on the unfailing surface, Soma, being purified, for power and support.

original: pra ta āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhījuvo divyā asṛgran payasā dharīmaṇi🔽prāntarṛṣayaḥ sthāvirīrasṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanty ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ
analyzed: pra te āśvinīḥ pavamāna dhī juvaḥ divyāḥ asṛgran payasā dharīmaṇi  prāntar ṛṣayaḥ sthāvirīrasṛkṣata ye tvā mṛjanti ṛṣiṣāṇa vedhasaḥ
translated: O Pavamana, the inspired songs of the Asvins have been poured into the reservoir, the heaven, with milk.🔽The Rishis, the sages, have flowed forth from the interior, those who, O finder of the Rishis, O inspirer, purify you.

original: viśvā dhāmāni viśvacakṣa ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoste sataḥ pariyanti ketavaḥ
analyzed: viśvā dhāmāni viśva cakṣaḥ ṛbhvasaḥ prabhoḥ te sataḥ pariyanti ketavaḥ
translated: O all-seeing one, your rays, powerful, encompass all abodes, O lord.

original: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patirviśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
analyzed: vyānaśiḥ pavase soma dharmabhiḥ patiḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
translated: O Soma, you flow with your own powers, you rule as the lord of the entire world.

original: ubhayataḥ pavamānasya raśmayo dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
analyzed: ubhayatas pavamānasya raśmayaḥ dhruvasya sataḥ pari yanti ketavaḥ
translated: The rays of Pavamana, of the firm one, go around on both sides, his banners.

original: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati
analyzed: yadī pavitre adhi mṛjyate hariḥ sattā ni yonā kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: When the tawny one is purified on the filter, he sits down in the wombs, in the jars.

original: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate svadhvaraḥ somo devānāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam
analyzed: yajñasya ketuḥ pavate su adhvaraḥ somaḥ devānām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: The banner of the sacrifice flows, well-ordered, Soma approaches the well-performed rite of the gods.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pari kośamarṣati vṛṣā pavitramatyeti roruvat
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pari kośam arṣati vṛṣā pavitram atyeti roruvat
translated: The thousand-streamed one flows around the vat, the bull passes through the filter, roaring.

original: rājā samudraṃ nadyo vi gāhate 'pāmūrmiṃ sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ
analyzed: rājā samudram nadyaḥ vi gāhate pām ūrmim sacate sindhuṣu śritaḥ
translated: The King penetrates the ocean and the rivers, he dwells in the waves of the waters, united with the streams.

original: adhyasthāt sānu pavamāno avyayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā dharuṇo maho divaḥ
analyzed: adhyasthāt sānu pavamānaḥ avyayam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ dharuṇaḥ mahaḥ divaḥ
translated: Pavamana has stood on the summit, the imperishable one, the supporter of the earth's navel, the great one of the sky.

original: divo na sānu stanayannacikradad dyauśca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ
analyzed: divaḥ na sānu stanayan acikradat dyauḥ ca yasya pṛthivī ca dharmabhiḥ
translated: The summit of the sky has thundered and roared; by his laws he is the lord of both heaven and earth.

original: indrasya sakhyaṃ pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥkalaśeṣu sīdati
analyzed: indrasya sakhyam pavate vivevidat somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sīdati
translated: Soma, being purified, flows forth to Indra's companionship, and settles in the jars.

original: jyotiryajñasya pavate madhu priyaṃ pitā devānāṃ janitā vibhūvasuḥ
analyzed: jyotiḥ yajñasya pavate madhu priyam pitā devānām janitā vibhūvasuḥ
translated: The dear honey of the sacrifice flows forth as light; the father of the gods, the begetter, of abundant wealth.

original: dadhāti ratnaṃ svadhayorapīcyaṃ madintamo matsara indriyo rasaḥ
analyzed: dadhāti ratnam svadhayoḥ apīcyam madintamaḥ matsaraḥ indriyaḥ rasaḥ
translated: He places the treasure in the two self-moving ones, the most delightful, the most exhilarating, the powerful juice.

original: abhikrandan kalaśaṃ vājyarṣati patirdivaḥ śatadhāro vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: abhikrandan kalaśam vājī arṣati patiḥ divaḥ śata dhāraḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The strong one, the lord of heaven, of a hundred streams, the far-sighted one, roars to the jar.

original: harirmitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjāno 'vibhiḥsindhubhirvṛṣā
analyzed: hariḥ mitrasya sadaneṣu sīdati marmṛjānaḥ vibhiḥ sindhubhiḥ vṛṣā
translated: The tawny one sits in the seats of Mitra, being cleansed by the pure ones, the streams, the strong one.

original: agre sindhūnāṃ pavamāno arṣatyagre vāco agriyo goṣu gachati
analyzed: agre sindhūnām pavamānaḥ arṣati agre vācaḥ agriyaḥ goṣu gacchati
translated: Pavamana flows at the head of the rivers, he goes at the head of the voices, at the head of the cows.

original: agre vājasya bhajate mahādhanaṃ svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā
analyzed: agre vājasya bhajate mahā dhanam su āyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyate vṛṣā
translated: He distributes at the head of the prize the great wealth; the strong one, furnished with his own weapons, is purified by the pressers.

original: ayaṃ matavāñchakuno yathā hito 'vye sasāra pavamāna ūrmiṇā
analyzed: ayam matavān śakunaḥ yathā hitaḥ vye sasāra pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā
translated: This Pavamana, like a bird that has found its place, has flowed in his wave on the bare (earth).

original: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śucirdhiyā pavate soma indra te
analyzed: tava kratvā rodasī antarā kave śuciḥ dhiyā pavate somaḥ indra te
translated: O wise one, with thy wisdom between the two world-halves, Soma flows pure with thought for thee, O Indra.

original: drāpiṃ vasāno yajato divispṛśamantarikṣaprā bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ
analyzed: drāpim vasānaḥ yajataḥ divispṛśam antarikṣa prāḥ bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: Garbed in a robe, reaching to heaven, the sacrificer, occupying the atmosphere, is set in the worlds.

original: svarjajñāno nabhasābhyakramīt pratnamasya pitaramā vivāsati
analyzed: svar jajñānaḥ nabhasā abhyakramīt pratnam asya pitaramā vivāsati
translated: The light-knower has gone forth with the cloud; he reveals his ancient father.

original: so asya viśe mahi śarma yachati yo asya dhāma prathamaṃ vyānaśe
analyzed: saḥ asya viśe mahi śarma yacchati yaḥ asya dhāma prathamam vyānaśe
translated: He grants great protection to his people, he who first extended his abode.

original: padaṃ yadasya parame vyomanyato viśvā abhi saṃyāti saṃyataḥ
analyzed: padam yat asya parame vyomani atas viśvāḥ abhi saṃyāti saṃyataḥ
translated: The place which is his highest heaven, from there he goes forth, self-restrained, over all.

original: pro ayāsīdindurindrasya niṣkṛtaṃ sakhā sakhyurna pra mināti saṃgiram
analyzed: pra u ayāsīt induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtam sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṃgiram
