translated: The drop has gone forth to Indra's place; the friend does not transgress the agreement with his friend.

original: marya iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmnā pathā
analyzed: maryaḥ iva yuvatibhiḥ samarṣati somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmnā pathā
translated: Like a young man he is stirred by the maidens; Soma in the jar by the path of a hundred winters.

original: pra vo dhiyo mandrayuvo vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣvakramuḥ🔽somaṃ manīṣā abhyanūṣata stubho 'bhi dhenavaḥ payasemaśiśrayuḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ dhiyaḥ mandrayuvaḥ vipanyuvaḥ panasyuvaḥ saṃvasaneṣu akramuḥ  somam manīṣāḥ abhyanūṣata stubhaḥ bhi dhenavaḥ payasā imā aśiśrayuḥ
translated: Your thoughts, young and delightful, wandering in different directions, have come forth in the assemblies.🔽The hymns have sung after Soma with longing; the milch-cows have come to the milk for him.

original: ā naḥ soma saṃyataṃ pipyuśīmiṣamindo pavasva pavamānoasridham
analyzed: ā naḥ soma saṃyatam pipyuśīmiṣam indo pavasva
translated: O Soma, make our store of food abundant; O Indu, flow on, O purifier, without obstruction.

original: yā no dohate trirahannasaścuṣī kṣumad vājavan madhumad suvīryam
analyzed: yā naḥ dohate kṣumat vājavat madhumat su vīryam
translated: Which, three times a day, milks for us food with strength and honey, and good heroism.

original: vṛṣā matīnāṃ pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somo ahnaḥ pratarītoṣaso divaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ somaḥ ahnaḥ pratarītā uṣasaḥ divaḥ
translated: The bull, the all-seeing one, flows on for the thoughts, Soma, the leader of the day, of the dawn, of the sky

original: krāṇā sindhūnāṃ kalaśānavīvaśadindrasya hārdyāviśan manīṣibhiḥ
analyzed: krāṇā sindhūnām kalaśān avīvaśat indrasya hārdī āviśat manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The impeller of the rivers, he has filled the jars, has entered into Indra's heart with the wise ones

original: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kavirnṛbhiryataḥ pari kośānacikradat
analyzed: manīṣibhiḥ pavate pūrvyaḥ kaviḥ nṛbhiḥ yatas pari kośān acikradat
translated: The wise one flows on, the ancient sage, urged on by the men, he has roared around the vats

original: tritasya nāma janayan madhu kṣaradindrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave
analyzed: tritasya nāma janayat madhu kṣarat indrasya vāyoḥ sakhyāya kartave
translated: Causing Trita's name to be born, he flows on, producing honey, to make friendship with Indra and Vayu

original: ayaṃ punāna uṣaso vi rocayadayaṃ sindhubhyo abhavadu lokakṛt
analyzed: ayam punānaḥ uṣasaḥ vi rocayat ayam sindhubhyaḥ abhavat u loka kṛt
translated: This one, being purified, illumines the dawns; this one has become the maker of room for the rivers

original: ayaṃ triḥ sapta duduhāna āśiraṃ somo hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
analyzed: ayam tris sapta duduhānaḥ āśiram somaḥ hṛde pavate cāru matsaraḥ
translated: This one, being milked thrice seven times, the essence, Soma, flows on, a charming juice, into Indra's heart

original: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjāna indo kalaśe pavitra ā🔽sīdannindrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhiryataḥ sūryamārohayo divi
analyzed: pavasva soma divyeṣu dhāmasu sṛjānaḥ indo kalaśe pavitre ā  sīdan indrasya jaṭhare kanikradan nṛbhiḥ yatas sūryam ārohayaḥ divi
translated: Flow on, O Soma, to the heavenly abodes, being poured out, O Indu, into the purifying sieve🔽Roaring, having entered into Indra's belly, urged on by the men, thou hast mounted the sun to the sky

original: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitra ā indavindrasya jaṭhareṣvāviśan🔽tvaṃ nṛcakṣā abhavo vicakṣaṇa soma gotramaṅgirobhyo 'vṛṇorapa
analyzed: adribhiḥ sutaḥ pavase pavitre ā indo indrasya jaṭhareṣu āviśan  tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ abhavaḥ vicakṣaṇa soma gotram aṅgirobhyaḥ vṛṇoḥ apa
translated: Being pressed with the stones, thou flowest on to the purifying filter; O Indu, thou hast entered into Indra's belly🔽O Soma, thou hast become the all-seeing one; thou hast opened the fold for the Angirases

original: tvāṃ soma pavamānaṃ svādhyo 'nu viprāso amadannavasyavaḥ
analyzed: tvām soma pavamānam su ādhyaḥ nu viprāsaḥ amadan avasyavaḥ
translated: O Soma Pavamana, the wise ones, the bards, have rejoiced in thee, the new one, O thou of good thoughts

original: tvāṃ suparṇa ābharad divas parīndo viśvābhirmatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam
analyzed: tvām suparṇaḥ ābharat divaḥ pari indo viśvābhiḥ matibhiḥ pariṣkṛtam
translated: The eagle brought thee down from heaven, O Indu, purified by all thoughts, O drop.

original: avye punānaṃ pari vāra ūrmiṇā hariṃ navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ
analyzed: avye punānam pari vāre ūrmiṇā harim navante abhi sapta dhenavaḥ
translated: The seven milch-kine with their wave, in the fleecy womb, praise the tawny one who is purified.

original: apāmupasthe adhyāyavaḥ kavim ṛtasya yonā mahiṣā aheṣata🔽induḥ punāno ati gāhate mṛdho viśvāni kṛṇvan supathāni yajyave
analyzed: apām upasthe adhyāyavaḥ kavim ṛtasya yonā mahiṣāḥ aheṣata  induḥ punānaḥ ati gāhate mṛdhaḥ viśvāni kṛṇvan su pathāni yajyave
translated: The mighty ones have urged the sage, in the waters' lap, in the birthplace of holy order.🔽Indu, being purified, passes through the filth, making all the paths easy for the worshipper.

original: gāḥ kṛṇvāno nirṇijaṃ haryataḥ kaviratyo na krīḷan pari vāramarṣati
analyzed: gāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ nirṇijam haryataḥ kaviḥ atyaḥ na krīḍan pari vāram arṣati
translated: Making the cows, the cleansing robe, the tawny one, the sage, he rushes along the fleece, as a horse in sport.

original: asaścataḥ śatadhārā abhiśriyo hariṃ navante 'va tā udanyuvaḥ
analyzed: asaścataḥ śata dhārāḥ abhiśriyaḥ harim navante vai tāḥ udanyuvaḥ
translated: The hundred-streaming, never-failing streams, the tawny one, the water-loving ones, praise.

original: kṣipo mṛjanti pari gobhirāvṛtaṃ tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
analyzed: kṣipaḥ mṛjanti pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: They cleanse the one who is to be cleansed, surrounded by the cows, on the third ridge, in the light of the sky.

original: tavemāḥ prajā divyasya retasastvaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
analyzed: tava imāḥ prajāḥ divyasya retasaḥ tvam viśvasya bhuvanasya rājasi
translated: These creatures of thine are the seed of the heavenly one; thou rulest over all the world.

original: athedaṃ viśvaṃ pavamāna te vaśe tvamindo prathamodhāmadhā asi
analyzed: atha idam viśvam pavamāna te vaśe tvam indo prathamaḥ ūdhāma dhāḥ asi
translated: And this whole universe, O Pavamâna, is in thy power. Thou, O Indu, art the first to hold the abode.

original: tvaṃ samudro asi viśvavit kave tavemāḥ pañca pradiśo vidharmaṇi
analyzed: tvam samudraḥ asi viśva vid kave tava imāḥ pañca pradiśaḥ vidharmaṇi
translated: Thou art the ocean, O wise one, all-knowing; these five regions are in thy fixed ordinance.

original: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ
analyzed: tvam dyām ca pṛthivīm ca ati jabhriṣe tava jyotīṃṣi pavamāna sūryaḥ
translated: Thou hast encompassed both the sky and the earth; thy lights, O Pavamâna, are the sun.

original: tvaṃ pavitre rajaso vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase
analyzed: tvam pavitre rajasaḥ vidharmaṇi devebhyaḥ soma pavamāna pūyase
translated: You, O purifier, in the law of the pure essence, are purified for the gods, O Soma Pavamana.

original: tvāmuśijaḥ prathamā agṛbhṇata tubhyemā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire🔽pra rebha etyati vāramavyayaṃ vṛṣā vaneṣvava cakradaddhariḥ
analyzed: tvām uśijaḥ prathamāḥ agṛbhṇata tubhya imā viśvā bhuvanāni yemire  pra rebhaḥ eti ati vāram avyayam vṛṣā vaneṣu ava cakradat hariḥ
translated: The Uśijas first grasped you; for you all these existing things have been made to move.🔽The singer has come to the imperishable flood; the bull, the tawny one, has bellowed in the woods.

original: saṃ dhītayo vāvaśānā anūṣata śiśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam
analyzed: sam dhītayaḥ vāvaśānāḥ anūṣata śiśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam
translated: The hymns, longing for the cow, have resounded; the thoughts kiss the bent one, the child.

original: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantuṃ tanvānastrivṛtaṃyathā vide🔽nayannṛtasya praśiṣo navīyasīḥ patirjanīnāmupa yāti niṣkṛtam
analyzed: sa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ pari vyata tantum tanvānaḥ trivṛtam yathā vide  nayan nṛtasya praśiṣaḥ navīyasīḥ patiḥ janīnām upa yāti niṣkṛtam
translated: He is clothed with the rays of the sun, weaving the thread as he knows the threefold one.🔽Leading the newest ordinances of truth, the lord of the people approaches the accomplished (sacrifice).

original: rājā sindhūnāṃ pavate patirdiva ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat
analyzed: rājā sindhūnām pavate patiḥ divaḥ ṛtasya yāti pathibhiḥ kanikradat
translated: The king of the rivers flows, the lord of the sky, roaring along the paths of truth.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pari ṣicyate hariḥ punāno vācaṃ janayannupāvasuḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pari sicyate hariḥ punānaḥ vācam janayan upāvasuḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed tawny one is sprinkled around, purifying, producing speech, and bringing wealth.

original: pavamāna mahyarṇo vi dhāvasi sūro na citro avyayāni pavyayā
analyzed: pavamāna mahi arṇaḥ vi dhāvasi sūraḥ na citraḥ avyayāni pavyayā
translated: O Pavamana, you run your course, like the variegated sun, through the undecaying (waters).

original: gabhastipūto nṛbhiradribhiḥ suto mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi
analyzed: gabhasti pūtaḥ nṛbhiḥ adribhiḥ sutaḥ mahe vājāya dhanyāya dhanvasi
translated: Purified by the hands, pressed by men and stones, you flow for the great prize, for the winning of wealth.

original: iṣamūrjaṃ pavamānābhyarṣasi śyeno na vaṃsu kalaśeṣusīdasi
analyzed: iṣam ūrjam pavamāna abhyarṣasi śyenaḥ na kalaśeṣu sīdasi
translated: You, O Pavamana, pour down food and strength; you, like a hawk, sit in the bowls.

original: indrāya madvā madyo madaḥ suto divo viṣṭambha upamo vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: indrāya madvā madyaḥ madaḥ sutaḥ divaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ upamaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The gladdening, intoxicating, exhilarating juice is pressed for Indra, the prop of heaven, the all-seeing one.

original: sapta svasāro abhi mātaraḥ śiśuṃ navaṃ jajñānaṃ jenyaṃ vipaścitam
analyzed: sapta svasāraḥ abhi mātaraḥ śiśum navam jajñānam jenyam vipaścitam
translated: The seven sisters, the mothers, the newly born child, the noble, wise child, just born,

original: apāṃ gandharvaṃ divyaṃ nṛcakṣasaṃ somaṃviśvasya bhuvanasya rājase
analyzed: apām gandharvam divyam nṛ cakṣasam somam viśvasya bhuvanasya rājase
translated: The Gandharva of the waters, the divine one, with eyes for men, Soma, you rule over the whole world.

original: īśāna imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujāna indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ🔽tāste kṣarantu madhumad ghṛtaṃ payastava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: īśānaḥ imā bhuvanāni vīyase yujānaḥ indo haritaḥ suparṇyaḥ  tāḥ te kṣarantu madhumat ghṛtam payaḥ tava vrate soma tiṣṭhantu kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: You rule over these worlds, O Indra, yoking your tawny, winged horses.🔽May they flow for you, full of honey, ghee, and milk. May the people abide in your rule, O Soma.

original: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā asi soma viśvataḥ pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi
analyzed: tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ asi soma viśvatas pavamāna vṛṣabha tā vi dhāvasi
translated: You, O Soma, are the seer of men from all sides, O Pavamana, O bull, you run through them.

original: sa naḥ pavasva vasumad dhiraṇyavad vayaṃ syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase
analyzed: sa naḥ pavasva vasumat hiraṇyavat vayam syāma bhuvaneṣu jīvase
translated: Flow for us, full of wealth, full of gold. May we be in the worlds, to live.

original: govit pavasva vasuvid dhiraṇyavid retodhā indo bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ
analyzed: go vid pavasva vasu vid hiraṇya vid retaḥ dhāḥ indo bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: Knowing the cow, finding wealth, finding gold, depositing seed, O Indu, placed in the worlds,

original: tvaṃ suvīro asi soma viśvavit taṃ tvā viprā upa girema āsate
analyzed: tvam su vīraḥ asi soma viśva vid tam tvā viprāḥ upa girā ime āsate
translated: You are the Soma with good heroes, finding all. The sages come to you, as to a mountain.

original: un madhva ūrmirvananā atiṣṭhipadapo vasāno mahiṣo vi gāhate
analyzed: ud madhvaḥ ūrmiḥ vananāḥ atiṣṭhipat apaḥ vasānaḥ mahiṣaḥ vi gāhate
translated: The wave of sweetness has been set in motion. The bull, clothed in waters, plunges into the wood.

original: rājā pavitraratho vājamāruhat sahasrabhṛṣṭirjayati śravo bṛhat
analyzed: rājā pavitra rathaḥ vājam āruhat sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ jayati śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The king, with the chariot of the filter, has mounted the prize. With a thousand spikes he conquers great glory.

original: sa bhandanā udiyarti prajāvatīrviśvāyurviśvāḥ subharā ahardivi
analyzed: sa bhandanāḥ udiyarti prajāvatīḥ viśvāyuḥ viśvāḥ subharāḥ ahardivi
translated: He, the bountiful, rises up with his offspring, all-life, all-sustaining, all-bearing in the day

original: brahma prajāvad rayimaśvapastyaṃ pīta indavindramasmabhyaṃ yācatāt
analyzed: brahma prajāvat rayim aśva pastyam pītaḥ indo indram asmabhyam yācatāt
translated: Brahman, bestow on us, O Indu, Indra, wealth with offspring, and a home abounding in horses.

original: so agre ahnāṃ harirharyato madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anudyubhiḥ
analyzed: saḥ agre ahnām hariḥ haryataḥ madaḥ pra cetasā cetayate anu dyubhiḥ
translated: He, the tawny one, the joy of the tawny ones, in the beginning of the days, thinks with his mind, with those who are ever active,

original: dvā janā yātayannantarīyate narā ca śaṃsaṃ daivyaṃ ca dhartari
analyzed: dvā janā yātayan antarīyate narā ca śaṃsam daivyam ca dhartari
translated: Guiding the two peoples, he passes between, the man and the divine, O supporter.

original: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratuṃ rihanti madhunābhyañjate
analyzed: añjate vyañjate samañjate kratum rihanti madhunā abhyañjate
translated: They anoint, they spread, they unite; they kiss the sacrifice; they anoint it with honey.

original: sindhorucchvāse patayantamukṣaṇaṃ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśumāsu gṛbhṇate
analyzed: sindhoḥ ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇam hiraṇya pāvāḥ paśumāsu gṛbhṇate
translated: The golden-hued ones seize the bull that flies along in the breath of the river, the animal, in these (waters).

original: vipaścite pavamānāya gāyata mahī na dhārātyandho arṣati
analyzed: vipaścite pavamānāya gāyata mahī na dhārā ati andhaḥ arṣati
translated: Sing to the wise Pavamana; the great one flows on, the brown one, bearing his stream.

original: ahirna jūrṇāmati sarpati tvacamatyo na krīḷannasarad vṛṣā hariḥ
analyzed: ahiḥ na sarpati tvacam atyaḥ na krīḍan asarat vṛṣā hariḥ
translated: Like a snake he glides along, casting off his worn-out skin; like a horse sporting, the strong tawny one hastens along.

original: agrego rājāpyastaviṣyate vimāno ahnāṃ bhuvaneṣvarpitaḥ
analyzed: agregaḥ rājā api astaviṣyate vimānaḥ ahnām bhuvaneṣu arpitaḥ
translated: The first-born king is glorified, the unmeasured one, set in the worlds, in the days.

original: harirghṛtasnuḥ sudṛśīko arṇavo jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāya okyaḥ
analyzed: hariḥ ghṛta snuḥ su dṛśīkaḥ arṇavaḥ jyotīrathaḥ pavate rāye okyaḥ
translated: The tawny one, bathed in ghee, the well-looking one, the ocean, flows on, the chariot of light, to the abode of wealth.

original: asarji skambho diva udyato madaḥ pari tridhāturbhuvanānyarṣati
analyzed: asarji skambhaḥ divaḥ udyataḥ madaḥ pari tri dhātuḥ bhuvanāni arṣati
translated: The pillar has been set up, the joy that rises to heaven; he flows around the three worlds.

original: aṃśuṃ rihanti matayaḥ panipnataṃ girā yadi nirṇijam ṛgmiṇo yayuḥ
analyzed: aṃśum rihanti matayaḥ panipnatam girā yadi nirṇijam ṛgmiṇaḥ yayuḥ
translated: The hymns kiss the ray that is bent down, if the singers have come to the garment with song.

original: pra te dhārā atyaṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyato yantiraṃhayaḥ🔽yad gobhirindo camvoḥ samajyasa ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi
analyzed: pra te dhārāḥ atyaṇvāni meṣyaḥ punānasya saṃyataḥ yantiḥ aṃhayaḥ  yat gobhiḥ indo camvoḥ samajyase ā suvānaḥ soma kalaśeṣu sīdasi
translated: When thou art purified, O honey-sweet one, the streams of thy rapture, restrained, flow swiftly past the small particles.🔽When thou art pressed, O Indu, with the milk, in the bowls, thou sittest in the jars, O Soma, being poured.

original: pavasva soma kratuvin na ukthyo 'vyo vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam
analyzed: pavasva soma kratu vid naḥ ukthyaḥ vyaḥ vāre pari dhāva madhu priyam
translated: Flow on, O Soma, wise, meet for praise, run through the fleece in the trough, the dear sweet (juice).

original: jahi viśvān rakṣasa indo atriṇo bṛhad vadema vidathesuvīrāḥ
analyzed: jahi viśvān rakṣasaḥ indo atriṇaḥ bṛhat vadema vidathesu vīrāḥ
translated: Slay all the Raksases, O Indu, the devourers: with brave sons may we utter our great voice in the assembly.

original: pra tu drava pari kośaṃ ni ṣīda nṛbhiḥ punāno abhi vājamarṣa
analyzed: pra tu drava pari kośam ni sīda nṛbhiḥ punānaḥ abhi vāja marṣa
translated: Rush on, sit down within the trough, being purified by the men, flow on to the booty.

original: aśvaṃ na tvā vājinaṃ marjayanto 'chā barhī raśanābhirnayanti
analyzed: aśvam na tvā vājinam marjayantaḥ chā barhī raśanābhiḥ nayanti
translated: Anointing thee, O strong one, as a horse, they lead thee with reins to the place of the sacrificial grass.

original: svāyudhaḥ pavate deva induraśastihā vṛjanaṃ rakṣamāṇaḥ
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ pavate devaḥ induḥ aśasti hā vṛjanam rakṣamāṇaḥ
translated: The god Indu flows on, well-armed, protecting the people, slaying the accuser.

original: pitā devānāṃ janitā sudakṣo viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: pitā devānām janitā su dakṣaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ divaḥ dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The father of the gods, the creator, of good skill, the supporter of the sky, the prop of the earth.

original: ṛṣirvipraḥ puraetā janānām ṛbhurdhīra uśanā kāvyena
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ vipraḥ puraetā janānām ṛbhuḥ dhīraḥ uśanā kāvyena
translated: The sage, the priest, the leader of the people, the wise, the mighty, Uśanâ by his wisdom.

original: sa cid viveda nihitaṃ yadāsāmapīcyaṃ guhyaṃ nāma gonām
analyzed: sa cit viveda nihitam yat āsām apīcyam guhyam nāma gonām
translated: He even hath discovered the hidden, wonderful name of the cows, which they possessed.

original: eṣa sya te madhumānindra somo vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ
analyzed: eṣa sya te madhumān indra somaḥ vṛṣā vṛṣṇe pari pavitre akṣāḥ
translated: This is thy Soma, O Indra, rich in sweets, the bull for the bull, pressed out in the purifying sieve

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā bhūridāvā śaśvattamaṃ barhirā vājyasthāt
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ bhūri dāvā śaśvattamam barhirā vājī asthāt
translated: Winning a thousand, a hundred, bestowing much, the strong one shall sit on the grass for ever

original: ete somā abhi gavyā sahasrā mahe vājāyāmṛtāya śravāṃsi
analyzed: ete somāḥ abhi gavyā sahasrā mahe vājāya amṛtāya śravāṃsi
translated: These Somas, for great strength and immortality, have flowed forth with thousands of cattle and glories

original: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānā asṛgrañchravasyavo na pṛtanājo atyāḥ
analyzed: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānāḥ asṛgran śravasyavaḥ na pṛtanājaḥ atyāḥ
translated: The purifying ones have been poured forth with the purifying strains, the glorious ones, swift as racers

original: pari hi ṣmā puruhūto janānāṃ viśvāsarad bhojanā pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: pari hi sma puruhūtaḥ janānām bhojanā pūyamānaḥ
translated: For he, much invoked, the bestower of all desires, is purified in the belly of the people

original: athā bhara śyenabhṛta prayāṃsi rayiṃ tuñjāno abhi vājamarṣa
analyzed: athā bhara śyena bhṛta prayāṃsi rayim tuñjānaḥ abhi vāja marṣa
translated: Then, O bearer of the swift ones, bring the gifts, urging wealth, come forward with strength

original: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargo na sṛṣṭo adadhāvadarvā
analyzed: eṣa suvānaḥ pari somaḥ pavitre sargaḥ na sṛṣṭaḥ adadhāvat arvā
translated: This Soma, being pressed, flows around the purifying filter, the creation, not created, flows not far

original: tigme śiśāno mahiṣo na śṛṅge gā gavyannabhiśūro na satvā
analyzed: tigme śiśānaḥ mahiṣaḥ na śṛṅge gāḥ gavyan abhiśūraḥ na satvā
translated: Sharpening on the stone, like a bull his horns, for cattle, like a hero his strength

original: eṣā yayau paramādantaradreḥ kūcit satīrūrve gā viveda
analyzed: eṣā yayau paramāt antar adreḥ kūcid satīḥ ūrve gāḥ viveda
translated: This one has gone from the highest peak of the mountain, having been confined, has found the cows in the two thighs

original: divo na vidyut stanayantyabhraiḥ somasya te pavata indradhārā
analyzed: divaḥ na vidyut stanayantī abhraiḥ somasya te pavate indra dhārā
translated: Like lightning from the sky thunders with the clouds, O Soma, thy stream flows for Indra

original: uta sma rāśiṃ pari yāsi gonāmindreṇa soma sarathaṃ punānaḥ
analyzed: uta sma rāśim pari yāsi gonām indreṇa soma sa ratham punānaḥ
translated: And sometimes thou goest to the cattle-pen, being purified, O Soma, with Indra in the same chariot

original: pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrjīradāno śikṣā śacīvastava tā upaṣṭut
analyzed: pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ bṛhatīḥ jīra dāno śikṣa śacīvas tava tāḥ upaṣṭut
translated: Granting the early great and fresh gifts, O bountiful one, these are to be praised by thee, O mighty one

original: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunve tubhyaṃ pavate tvamasya pāhi
analyzed: ayam somaḥ indra tubhyam sunve tubhyam pavate tvam asya pāhi
translated: This Soma is pressed for thee, O Indra; it is purified for thee; do thou guard it.

original: tvaṃ ha yaṃ cakṛṣe tvaṃ vavṛṣa induṃ madāya yujyāya somam
analyzed: tvam ha yam cakṛṣe tvam vavṛṣe indum madāya yujyāya somam
translated: Thou, O Indra, whom thou hast made, whom thou hast caused to rain, the Soma, the drop, for the sake of joy, for the sake of union,

original: sa īṃ ratho na bhuriṣāḷ ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni🔽ādīṃ viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vana ūrdhvā navanta
analyzed: saḥ īm rathaḥ na bhuriṣāh ayoji mahaḥ purūṇi sātaye vasūni  ādīm viśvā nahuṣyāṇi jātā svarṣātā vane ūrdhvā navanta
translated: He is yoked like a chariot to many things, to great things, to the winning of treasures.🔽All the Nahuṣa races, born from the self-existent one, sing to him, self-luminous, upwards.

original: vāyurna yo niyutvāniṣṭayāmā nāsatyeva hava ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: vāyuḥ na yaḥ niyutvān iṣṭa yāmā nāsatyā iva have ā śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: Like Vāyu, yoked with his teams, he has come to the sacrifice; like the Nāsatyas, most auspicious, to the call.

original: viśvavāro draviṇodā iva tman pūṣeva dhījavano 'si soma
analyzed: viśva vāraḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ iva tman pūṣā iva dhī javanaḥ si soma
translated: Like a giver of wealth, all-bountiful, in thy own self; like Pūṣan, O Soma, thou art the inspirer of thought.

original: indro na yo mahā karmāṇi cakrirhantā vṛtrāṇāmasi somapūrbhit
analyzed: indraḥ na yaḥ mahā karmāṇi cakriḥ hantā vṛtrāṇām asi soma pūḥ bhid
translated: Like Indra, thou who hast performed great deeds; thou art the slayer of the Vr̥itras, filled with Soma.

original: paidvo na hi tvamahināmnāṃ hantā viśvasyāsisoma dasyoḥ
analyzed: paidvaḥ na hi tvam ahi nāmnām hantā viśvasya asisoma dasyoḥ
translated: Like Paijavana, thou who art the slayer of the Ahi-named ones; thou art the slayer of all the Dasyus, O Soma.

original: agnirna yo vana ā sṛjyamāno vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu
analyzed: agniḥ na yaḥ vane ā sṛjyamānaḥ vṛthā pājāṃsi kṛṇute nadīṣu
translated: Like Agni, thou who art let loose in the wood; thou makest thy paths in the rivers.

original: jano na yudhvā mahata upabdiriyarti somaḥ pavamānaūrmim
analyzed: janaḥ na yudhvā mahataḥ upabdiḥ iyarti somaḥ pavamāna ūrmim
translated: Like a warrior, the people's great helper; Soma Pavamâna impels his wave.

original: ete somā ati vārāṇyavyā divyā na kośāso abhravarṣāḥ
analyzed: ete somāḥ ati vārāṇyavyāḥ divyāḥ na kośāsaḥ abhra varṣāḥ
translated: These Somas have passed through the fleecy filter, the heavenly jars, the rain-clouds of the sky.

original: vṛthā samudraṃ sindhavo na nīcīḥ sutāso abhi kalaśānasṛgran
analyzed: vṛthā samudram sindhavaḥ na nīcīḥ sutāsaḥ abhi kalaśān asṛgran
translated: Like rivers to the sea, the juices, low-voiced, have flowed into the jars.

original: śuṣmī śardho na mārutaṃ pavasvānabhiśastā divyā yathāviṭ
analyzed: śuṣmī śardhaḥ na mārutam pavasva an abhiśastā divyā yathā viś
translated: Flow on, O mighty one, like the Marut host, unblamed, as is thy wont, O heavenly one,

original: āpo na makṣū sumatirbhavā naḥ sahasrāpsāḥ pṛtanāṣāṇ na yajñaḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ na makṣū sumatiḥ bhava naḥ sahasra apsāḥ pṛtanāṣāh na yajñaḥ
translated: Be thou, O waters, as a swift favour to us, as a sacrifice, a thousandfold winner of battles.

original: rājño nu te varuṇasya vratāni / / /
analyzed: rājñaḥ nu te varuṇasya vratāni
translated: The laws of king Varuna are these.

original: pro sya vahniḥ pathyābhirasyān divo na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamānoakṣāḥ
analyzed: pra u sya vahniḥ pathyābhiḥ asyān divaḥ na vṛṣṭiḥ pavamāna uakṣāḥ
translated: Let thy fire, O Pavamana, be carried forward with the paths, like the rain of heaven, with the rays,

original: sahasradhāro asadan nyasme māturupasthe vana āca somaḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ asadat nyasme mātuḥ upasthe vane āca somaḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed one has sat down for us in the wood, in the lap of the mother, the Soma.

original: rājā sindhūnāmavasiṣṭa vāsa ṛtasya nāvamāruhad rajiṣṭhām
analyzed: rājā sindhūnām avasiṣṭa vāsaḥ ṛtasya nāvam āruhat rajiṣṭhām
translated: The king of the rivers has mounted the straightest ship of holy order, O Vasishtha.

original: apsu drapso vāvṛdhe śyenajūto duha īṃ pitā duha īṃ piturjām
analyzed: apsu drapsaḥ vāvṛdhe śyena jūtaḥ duhe īm pitā duhe īm pituḥ jām
translated: The drop has grown in the waters, urged on by the hawk. His father milks him, his mother milks him.

original: siṃhaṃ nasanta madhvo ayāsaṃ harimaruṣaṃ divo asya patim
analyzed: siṃham nasanta madhvaḥ ayāsam harim aruṣam divaḥ asya patim
translated: They make him a lion, a tawny one, of the sweet, the red one, the lord of heaven.

original: śūro yutsu prathamaḥ pṛchate gā asya cakṣasā pari pātyukṣā
analyzed: śūraḥ yutsu prathamaḥ pṛcchate gāḥ asya cakṣasā pari pāti ukṣā
translated: The hero, the first in battle, asks for the cows, the bull is to be protected by his eye.

original: madhupṛṣṭhaṃ ghoramayāsamaśvaṃ rathe yuñjantyurucakraṛṣvam
analyzed: madhu pṛṣṭham ghoram ayāsam aśvam rathe yuñjanti uru cakra ṛṣvam
translated: They yoke to the chariot the horse with a back covered in honey, terrible, tawny, of the sweet, with high wheels.

original: svasāra īṃ jāmayo marjayanti sanābhayo vājinamūrjayanti
analyzed: svasāraḥ īm jāmayaḥ marjayanti sanābhayaḥ vājinam ūrjayanti
translated: His sisters, his cousins, his kinsmen, make him strong, the strong one, they make him powerful.

original: catasra īṃ ghṛtaduhaḥ sacante samāne antardharuṇe niṣattāḥ
analyzed: catasraḥ īm ghṛta duhaḥ sacante samāne antar dharuṇe niṣattāḥ
translated: Four milk him, yielding ghee, they attend on him, seated in the same place, in the same stall.

original: tā īmarṣanti namasā punānāstā īṃ viśvataḥ pari ṣanti pūrvīḥ
analyzed: tāḥ īm arṣanti namasā punānāḥ tāḥ īm viśvatas pari santi pūrvīḥ
translated: They flow to him, purified with reverence, they, the many, come to him from every side.

original: viṣṭambho divo dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyā viśvā uta kṣitayo haste asya
analyzed: viṣṭambhaḥ divaḥ dharuṇaḥ pṛthivyāḥ viśvāḥ uta kṣitayaḥ haste asya
translated: The prop of the sky, the supporter of the earth, and in his hand all the regions (of the world).

original: asat ta utso gṛṇate niyutvān madhvo aṃśuḥ pavataindriyāya
analyzed: asat te utsaḥ gṛṇate niyutvān madhvaḥ aṃśuḥ pavata aindriyāya
translated: May the strong one, accompanied by his team, be present for the singer, may the stalk of the sweet (juice) flow for power.

original: vanvannavāto abhi devavītimindrāya soma vṛtrahā pavasva
analyzed: vanvan avātaḥ abhi deva vītim indrāya soma vṛtra hā pavasva
translated: Purified, O Soma, flow to the feast of the gods, flow on for Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: śagdhi mahaḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
analyzed: śagdhi mahaḥ puru ścandrasya rāyaḥ su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: Be thou propitious to great wealth, most excellent, and may we be lords of brave sons and noble riches.

original: pra hinvāno janitā rodasyo ratho na vājaṃ saniṣyannayāsīt
analyzed: pra hinvānaḥ janitā rodasyaḥ rathaḥ na vājam saniṣyan ayāsīt
translated: Impelled, the Sire of earth and heaven hath come, fain to win strength, like a chariot.

original: indraṃ gachannāyudhā saṃśiśāno viśvā vasu hastayorādadhānaḥ
analyzed: indram gacchan āyudhā saṃśiśānaḥ viśvā vasu hastayoḥ ādadhānaḥ
translated: Going to Indra, sharpening his weapons, he hath placed in his hands all treasures.

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vayodhāmāṅgūṣāṇāmavāvaśanta vāṇīḥ
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham vṛṣaṇam vayodhām āṅgūṣāṇām avāvaśanta vāṇīḥ
translated: The songs have sung to the three-backed, the mighty, the life-bestower,

original: vanā vasāno varuṇo na sindhūn vi ratnadhā dayate vāryāṇi
analyzed: vanā vasānaḥ varuṇaḥ na sindhūn vi ratna dhāḥ dayate vāryāṇi
translated: Wearing the woods, like Varuna the streams, he distributeth treasures, boons.

original: śūragrāmaḥ sarvavīraḥ sahāvāñ jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni
analyzed: śūra grāmaḥ sarva vīraḥ saha āvām jetā pavasva sanitā dhanāni
translated: The hero's home, all-manly, victorious, winning, flow on, winning treasures.

original: tigmāyudhaḥ kṣipradhanvā samatsvaṣāḷhaḥ sāhvānpṛtanāsu śatrūn
analyzed: tigma āyudhaḥ kṣipra dhanvā samatsu aṣāḷhaḥ sāhvān pṛtanāsu śatrūn
translated: With keen weapons, with a bow that shoots afar, impetuous, challenging foes in battle,

original: urugavyūtirabhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasvā purandhī
analyzed: uru gavyūtiḥ abhayāni kṛṇvan samīcīne ā pavasva purandhī
translated: Making wide shelter and security, pour on us, O thou of far-reaching thought, in unison,

original: apaḥ siṣāsannuṣasaḥ svargāḥ saṃ cikrado maho asmabhyaṃ vājān
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan uṣasaḥ svar gāḥ sam cikradaḥ mahaḥ asmabhyam vājān
translated: Desiring the waters, the heavenly dawns, and the great prizes, do thou roar for us.

original: matsi soma varuṇaṃ matsi mitraṃ matsīndramindo pavamāna viṣṇum
analyzed: matsi soma varuṇam matsi mitram matsi indram indo pavamāna viṣṇum
translated: Thou, O Soma, delightest Varuna, delightest Mitra, delightest Indra, O Indu, O Pavamana, delightest Vishnu.

original: matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi mahāmindramindo madāya
analyzed: matsi śardhaḥ mārutam matsi devān matsi mahām indram indo madāya
translated: Thou delightest the Marut host, thou delightest the gods, thou delightest the great Indra, O Indu, for the rapture.

original: evā rājeva kratumānamena viśvā ghanighnad duritā pavasva
analyzed: eva rājā iva kratumān amena viśvā ghanighnat duritā pavasva
translated: Thus, O king, like one of mighty power, do thou, O Indu, while purifying, drive away all misfortunes.

original: indo sūktāya vacase vayo dhā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: indo sūktāya vacase vayaḥ dhāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Soma, give strength to the hymn and the prayer. Do ye, O (gods), protect us evermore with your protections.

original: asarji vakvā rathye yathājau dhiyā manotā prathamo manīṣī
analyzed: asarji vakvā rathye yathā ājau dhiyā manotā prathamaḥ manīṣī
translated: The swift one has been sent forth, like a charioteer to the battle, the mind-offerer, the first, the wise one.

original: daśa svasāro adhi sāno avye 'janti vahniṃ sadanānyacha
analyzed: daśa svasāraḥ adhi sāno avye janti vahnim sadanāni acha
translated: The ten sisters on the uneven ridge lead the bearer to their seats.

original: vītī janasya divyasya kavyairadhi suvāno nahuṣyebhirinduḥ
analyzed: vītī janasya divyasya kavyaiḥ adhi suvānaḥ nahuṣyebhiḥ induḥ
translated: The bountiful one, with the sacred food of the heavenly people, with the Nahushas, is being pressed.

original: pra yo nṛbhiramṛto martyebhirmarmṛjāno 'vibhirgobhiradbhiḥ
analyzed: pra yaḥ nṛbhiḥ amṛtaḥ martyebhiḥ marmṛjānaḥ vibhiḥ gobhiḥ adbhiḥ
translated: He who, the immortal one, with the mortal men, being anointed with the limbs, with the sheep, with the cows, with the waters,

original: vṛṣā vṛṣne roruvadaṃśurasmai pavamāno ruśadīrte payogoḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣne roruvat aṃśuḥ asmai pavamānaḥ ruśat īrte payaḥ goḥ
translated: The bull, the strong one, the strong one for him, the steed, Pavamana, roars in the two bowls.

original: sahasram ṛkvā pathibhirvacovidadhvasmabhiḥ sūro aṇvaṃ vi yāti
analyzed: sahasram ṛkvā pathibhiḥ vacaḥ vida dhvasmabhiḥ sūraḥ aṇvam vi yāti
translated: The singer with a thousand paths, knowing speech, with us, Surya, moves along his course.

original: rujā dṛḷhā cid rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punāna inda ūrṇuhi vivājān
analyzed: rujā dṛḍhā cit rakṣasaḥ sadāṃsi punānaḥ indo ūrṇuhi vivājān
translated: Purifying, O Indra, break through the firm strongholds of the Rakshasas, and spread out the treasures.

original: vṛścopariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrādupanāyameṣām
analyzed: vṛśca upariṣṭāt tujatā vadhena ye anti dūrāt upanāyam eṣām
translated: With a blow from above, with a blow, those who are far away and those who are near to attack them.

original: sa pratnavan navyase viśvavāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ
analyzed: sa pratna vat navyase viśva vāra sūktāya pathaḥ kṛṇuhi prācaḥ
translated: Make the paths go forward, as of old, for the new praise, O finder of all treasures.

original: ye duḥṣahāso vanuṣā bṛhantastāṃste aśyāma purukṛt purukṣo
analyzed: ye duḥṣahāsaḥ vanuṣā bṛhantaḥ tān te aśyāma puru kṛt purukṣo
translated: May we obtain those, O thou of much wealth, who are difficult to conquer, who are great in desire.

original: evā punāno apaḥ svargā asmabhyaṃ tokā tanayāni bhūri
analyzed: eva punānaḥ apaḥ svar gāḥ asmabhyam tokā tanayāni bhūri
translated: Thus purifying the heavenly waters, give us offspring and many children.

original: śaṃ naḥ kṣetramuru jyotīṃṣi soma jyoṃ naḥ sūryandṛśaye rirīhi
analyzed: śam naḥ kṣetram uru jyotīṃṣi soma jyok naḥ sūryan dṛśaye rirīhi
translated: Make our field prosperous, O Soma, and the great lights. Make the sun shine for us to see.

original: pari suvāno hariraṃśuḥ pavitre ratho na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ
analyzed: pari suvānaḥ hari raṃśuḥ pavitre rathaḥ na sarji sanaye hiyānaḥ
translated: The tawny-hued one, being pressed, with his rays, on the purifying filter, is sent forth like a chariot, eager to move.

original: āpacchlokamindriyaṃ pūyamānaḥ prati devānajuṣata prayobhiḥ
analyzed: āpat ślokam indriyam pūyamānaḥ prati devān ajuṣata prayobhiḥ
translated: Being purified, he has obtained the glory and power. He has delighted the gods with his offerings.

original: achā nṛcakṣā asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kavirasya yonau
analyzed: achā nṛ cakṣāḥ asarat pavitre nāma dadhānaḥ kaviḥ asya yonau
translated: Looking on men, he has gone to the purifying filter, bearing his name in the womb of the wise one.

original: sīdan hoteva sadane camūṣūpemagmannṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ
analyzed: sīdan hotā iva sadane camūṣu upemagman ṛṣayaḥ sapta viprāḥ
translated: The seven sages, the poets, have come to the vessel, sitting in the seat as the Hotar priest.

original: pra sumedhā gātuvid viśvadevaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sada eti nityam
analyzed: pra sumedhāḥ gātu vid viśva devaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ sadaḥ eti nityam
translated: The very wise Soma, who finds the way, who belongs to all the gods, being purified, comes to the seat, ever present.

original: bhuvad viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantānu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ
analyzed: bhuvat viśveṣu kāvyeṣu rantā anu janān yatate pañca dhīraḥ
translated: He has become the entertainer in all the poetic compositions; the wise one strives to reach the five peoples.

original: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devāstraya ekādaśāsaḥ
analyzed: tava tye soma pavamāna niṇye viśve devāḥ trayaḥ ekādaśāsaḥ
translated: These, O Soma Pavamâna, are thy stations, all the gods, the thirty-three,

original: daśa svadhābhiradhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ
analyzed: daśa svadhābhiḥ adhi sāno avye mṛjanti tvā nadyaḥ sapta yahvīḥ
translated: On the back of the brown one with their ten powers; the seven swift rivers cleanse thee.

original: tan nu satyaṃ pavamānasyāstu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta
analyzed: tat nu satyam pavamānasya astu yatra viśve kāravaḥ saṃnasanta
translated: This is the truth of Pavamâna, where all the craftsmen are assembled together.

original: jyotiryadahne akṛṇodu lokaṃ prāvan manuṃ dasyave karabhīkam
analyzed: jyotiḥ yat ahne akṛṇot u lokam prāvat manum dasyave karabhīkam
translated: He who hath made the light for the day, hath given Manu to the Dasyu Karabhâka.

original: pari sadmeva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīriyānaḥ
analyzed: pari sadmā iva paśumānti hotā rājā na satyaḥ samitīḥ iyānaḥ
translated: The true king, like a priest, hath gone to the gatherings, as if to his own seat, the wealthy one.

original: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśānayāsīt sīdan mṛgo na mahiṣo vaneṣu
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśān ayāsīt sīdan mṛgaḥ na mahiṣaḥ vaneṣu
translated: Soma, being purified, hath gone to the jars, as a deer to the woods, to the great lakes.

original: sākamukṣo marjayanta svasāro daśa dhīrasya dhītayo dhanutrīḥ
analyzed: sākamukṣaḥ marjayanta svasāraḥ daśa dhīrasya dhītayaḥ dhanutrīḥ
translated: The sisters, the ten, the inspirers of the sage, the milkers, are cleansing the one who is milked together.

original: hariḥ paryadravajjāḥ sūryasya droṇaṃ nanakṣe atyo na vājī
analyzed: hariḥ paryadravat jāḥ sūryasya droṇam nanakṣe atyaḥ na vājī
translated: The tawny one hath run around, the son of Sûrya; he hath filled the trough, like a strong horse.

original: saṃ mātṛbhirna śiśurvāvaśāno vṛṣā dadhanve puruvāroadbhiḥ
analyzed: sam mātṛbhiḥ na śiśuḥ vāvaśānaḥ vṛṣā dadhanve puru vāraḥ adbhiḥ
translated: The youngling, like a bull, is bellowing with the waters, rejoicing with his mothers, the bountiful one.

original: maryo na yoṣāmabhi niṣkṛtaṃ yan saṃ gachate kalaśa usriyābhiḥ
analyzed: maryaḥ na yoṣām abhi niṣkṛtam yan sam gacchate kalaśe usriyābhiḥ
translated: As a man to a maiden, so he approaches the purified (Soma) with the milk-pots and the cows.

original: uta pra pipya ūdharaghnyāyā indurdhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ
analyzed: uta pra pipye ūdhara ghnyāyāḥ induḥ dhārābhiḥ sacate sumedhāḥ
translated: And he fills the udder of the milch cow; the wise Indu accompanies him with the streams.

original: mūrdhānaṃ gāvaḥ payasā camūṣvabhi śrīṇanti vasubhirna niktaiḥ
analyzed: mūrdhānam gāvaḥ payasā camūṣu abhi śrīṇanti vasubhiḥ na niktaiḥ
translated: The cows fill the head (of the Soma) with milk in the bowls, as if with unwashed (dishes) and with wealth.

original: sa no devebhiḥ pavamāna radendo rayimaśvinaṃ vāvaśānaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ devebhiḥ pavamāna rada indoḥ rayim aśvinam vāvaśānaḥ
translated: O Pavamâna, with the gods, O Indu, longing for wealth, do thou bring us riches in horses.

original: rathirāyatāmuśatī purandhirasmadryagā dāvane vasūnām
analyzed: rathiḥ āyatām āmuśatī purandhiḥ asmadrya gāḥ dāvane vasūnām
translated: Let the longing, far-seeing (cow) come to the chariot, to us, to bring (us) treasures.

original: nū no rayimupa māsva nṛvantaṃ punāno vātāpyaṃ viśvaścandram🔽pra vanditurindo tāryāyuḥ prātarmakṣū dhiyāvasurjagamyāt🔽adhi yadasmin vājinīva śubha spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye naviśaḥ
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim upa māsva nṛvantam punānaḥ vātāpyam viśva ścandram  pra vandituḥ indo tārī āyuḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt  adhi yat asmin vājinī iva śubhe spardhante dhiyaḥ sūrye naviśaḥ
translated: Now, being purified, enjoy thou our wealth, desirable to men, dear to the wind, all-beautiful.🔽O Indu, let the worshipper's life be prolonged; may he who possesses wealth come quickly with his thought.🔽When in this (world) the beautiful, like a mare, the thoughts contend for him, as in the sun for the rays.

original: apo vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajaṃ na paśuvardhanāya manma
analyzed: apaḥ vṛṇānaḥ pavate kavīyan vrajam na paśu vardhanāya manma
translated: Choosing the waters, he flows on, most wise, for the hymn, as 'twere, to increase the herd of cattle.

original: dvitā vyūrṇvannamṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta
analyzed: dvitā vyūrṇvan amṛtasya dhāma svarvide bhuvanāni prathanta
translated: Dispersing the two-fold abode of immortality, he extends the worlds to him who finds the light.

original: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na gāva ṛtāyantīrabhi vāvaśra indum
analyzed: dhiyaḥ pinvānāḥ svasare na gāvaḥ ṛtāyantīḥ abhi vāvaśre indum
translated: The thoughts, swelling in the sister (heaven), tending to the truth, have lowed to Indu.

original: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūro na ratho bhuvanāni viśvā
analyzed: pari yat kaviḥ kāvyā bharate śūraḥ na rathaḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: When the wise one bears his thoughts, like a strong chariot through all the worlds

original: deveṣu yaśo martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ purubhūṣu navyaḥ
analyzed: deveṣu yaśaḥ martāya bhūṣan dakṣāya rāyaḥ puru bhūṣu navyaḥ
translated: Seeking glory among the gods for the mortal, the new wealth for the powerful

original: śriye jātaḥ śriya ā niriyāya śriyaṃ vayo jaritṛbhyo dadhāti
analyzed: śriye jātaḥ śriye ā niriyāya śriyam vayaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ dadhāti
translated: Born for glory, he goes forth to glory; he bestows glory and strength upon the worshippers

original: śriyaṃ vasānā amṛtatvamāyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau🔽iṣamūrjamabhyarṣāśvaṃ gāmuru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān
analyzed: śriyam vasānāḥ amṛta tvam āyan bhavanti satyā samithā mitadrau  iṣam ūrjam abhyarṣa aśvam gām uru jyotiḥ kṛṇuhi matsi devān
translated: Clad in glory, they have gone to immortality; the pacts are true for the one who measures wealth🔽Press for us food and strength, for the horse, for the cow; create great light; delight the gods

original: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyaṃ pavamāna bādhasesoma śatrūn🔽kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ
analyzed: viśvāni hi suṣahā tāni tubhyam pavamāna bādhasesoma śatrūn  kanikranti harirā sṛjyamānaḥ sīdan vanasya jaṭhare punānaḥ
translated: For all these easy tasks are yours, O Pavamana; you, O Soma, overcome the enemies🔽The tawny one, when loosed, neighs, sitting in the belly of the wood, being purified

original: nṛbhiryataḥ kṛṇute nirṇijaṃ gā ato matīrjanayatasvadhābhiḥ
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yatas kṛṇute nirṇijam gāḥ atas matīḥ janayata svadhābhiḥ
translated: When urged by men, he makes the cleansing cloth; from there he generates thoughts with his own powers

original: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyām ṛtasyeyarti vācamariteva nāvam
analyzed: hariḥ sṛjānaḥ pathyām ṛtasya iyarti vācam aritā iva nāvam
translated: The tawny one, when loosed, moves along the path of truth, carrying the voice like a boat on water

original: devo devānāṃ guhyāni nāmāviṣ kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce
analyzed: devaḥ devānām guhyāni nāma āvis kṛṇoti barhiṣi pravāce
translated: The god reveals the secret names of the gods on the sacrificial grass, in the proclamation

original: apāmivedūrmayastarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣā īrate somamacha
analyzed: apām iva id ūrmayaḥ tarturāṇāḥ pra manīṣāḥ īrate somam acha
translated: Like waves of water, the thoughts move forward, striving to reach Soma

original: namasyantīrupa ca yanti saṃ cā ca viśantyuśatīruśantam
analyzed: namasyantīḥ upa ca yanti sam ca ā ca viśanti uśatīḥ uśantam
translated: They come together and enter into the one who is eager, the eager ones, worshipping

original: taṃ marmṛjānaṃ mahiṣaṃ na sānāvaṃśuṃ duhantyukṣaṇaṃ giriṣṭhām
analyzed: tam marmṛjānam mahiṣam na sānau aṃśum duhanti ukṣaṇam giriṣṭhām
translated: They milk the mighty one as he is anointed, the bull who dwells in the mountains, the steed

original: taṃ vāvaśānaṃ matayaḥ sacante trito bibharti varuṇaṃ samudre🔽iṣyan vācamupavakteva hotuḥ punāna indo vi ṣyā manīṣām
analyzed: tam vāvaśānam matayaḥ sacante tritaḥ bibharti varuṇam samudre  iṣyan vācam upavaktā iva hotuḥ punānaḥ indo vi sya manīṣām
translated: The thoughts attend on him who is eager, Trita bears Varuna in the ocean🔽Desiring to utter speech as it were before the Hotar, O Indu, purify the thought,

original: indraśca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhagāya suvīryasya patayaḥsyāma
analyzed: indraḥ ca yat kṣayathaḥ saubhagāya su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: And when, O Indra, ye two rejoice for good fortune, may we be lords of good heroism

original: pra senānīḥ śūro agre rathānāṃ gavyanneti harṣate asya senā
analyzed: pra senā nīḥ śūraḥ agre rathānām gavyan neti harṣate asya senā
translated: The hero, the general, goes in front of the chariots, rejoicing, he delights in his army

original: bhadrān kṛṇvannindrahavān sakhibhya ā somo vastrā rabhasāni datte
analyzed: bhadrān kṛṇvan indra havān sakhibhyaḥ ā somaḥ vastrā rabhasāni datte
translated: Making the auspicious calls to Indra for his friends, Soma gives out garments and impetuous (steeds)

original: samasya hariṃ harayo mṛjantyaśvahayairaniśitaṃ namobhiḥ
analyzed: samasya harim harayaḥ mṛjanti aśva hayaiḥ aniśitam namobhiḥ
translated: His tawny (steeds) cleanse the tawny one, the uninjured one with bows and salutations

original: ā tiṣṭhati rathamindrasya sakhā vidvānenā sumatiṃ yātyacha
analyzed: ā tiṣṭhati ratham indrasya sakhā vidvān enā sumatim yāti acha
translated: The friend of Indra mounts the chariot, the wise one goes to his favour with this (sacrifice)

original: sa no deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarasa indrapānaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase indra pānaḥ
translated: Flow to us, O god, for the gods, O great Soma, as a drink for Indra

original: kṛṇvannapo varṣayan dyāmutemāmurorā no varivasyā punānaḥ
analyzed: kṛṇvan apaḥ varṣayan dyām uta imām urorāḥ naḥ varivasyā punānaḥ
translated: Making the waters rain down on this sky and earth, shine on us, O purifying one, with favour

original: ajītaye 'hataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate
analyzed: ajītaye hataye pavasva svastaye sarvatātaye bṛhate
translated: Flow for victory, for the unslain, for well-being, for all-embracing greatness

original: taduśanti viśva ime sakhāyastadahaṃ vaśmi pavamāna soma
analyzed: tat uśanti viśve ime sakhāyaḥ tat aham vaśmi pavamāna soma
translated: All these friends praise that (Soma), and I, O Soma Pavamana, ask for that (favour)

original: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnāṃ janitā divo janitā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: somaḥ pavate janitā matīnām janitā divaḥ janitā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Soma flows, the begetter of thoughts, the begetter of heaven, the begetter of earth

original: janitāgnerjanitā sūryasya janitendrasya janitota viṣṇoḥ
analyzed: janitā agneḥ janitā sūryasya janitā indrasya janitā uta viṣṇoḥ
translated: The begetter of Agni, the begetter of the sun, the begetter of Indra, and the begetter of Vishnu

original: brahmā devānāṃ padavīḥ kavīnām ṛṣirviprāṇāṃ mahiṣomṛgāṇām
analyzed: brahmā devānām padavīḥ kavīnām ṛṣiḥ viprāṇām mahiṣaḥ mṛgāṇām
translated: Brahman of the gods, the path of the sages, the seer of the seers, the bull of the beasts

original: śyeno gṛdhrāṇāṃ svadhitirvanānāṃ somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan
analyzed: śyenaḥ gṛdhrāṇām svadhitiḥ vanānām somaḥ pavitram atyeti rebhan
translated: The eagle of the eagles, the axe of the woods, Soma, singing, passes through the filter

original: prāvīvipad vāca ūrmiṃ na sindhurgiraḥ somaḥ pavamānomanīṣāḥ
analyzed: prāvīvipat vācaḥ ūrmim na sindhuḥ giraḥ somaḥ pavamānaḥ manīṣāḥ
translated: He has sent forth the wave of speech like a river, Soma Pavamana the thoughts and songs of men

original: antaḥ paśyan vṛjanemāvarāṇyā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabho goṣu jānan
analyzed: antar paśyan vṛjanemā avarāṇyā tiṣṭhati vṛṣabhaḥ goṣu jānan
translated: Looking within, he stands in the midst of the people, the bull knowing among the cows

original: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvannavātaḥ sahasraretā abhi vājamarṣa
analyzed: sa matsaraḥ pṛtsu vanvan avātaḥ sahasra retāḥ abhi vāja marṣa
translated: The gladdener, winning in contests, unvanquished, with a thousand powers, he speeds to the prize

original: indrāyendo pavamāno manīṣyaṃśorūrmimīraya gā iṣaṇyan
analyzed: indrāya indo pavamānaḥ manīṣī aṃśoḥ ūrmimīraya gāḥ iṣaṇyan
translated: O Indu, Pavamana, the wise one, for Indra, send forth the wave of the juice, urging the cows

original: pari priyaḥ kalaśe devavāta indrāya somo raṇyo madāya
analyzed: pari priyaḥ kalaśe deva vātaḥ indrāya somaḥ raṇyaḥ madāya
translated: The dear one, borne by the gods, in the vat, Soma for Indra, the gladdening one, for joy

original: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja indurvājī na saptiḥ samanā jigāti
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ śata vājaḥ induḥ vājī na saptiḥ samanā jigāti
translated: The Indu with a thousand streams, with a hundred powers, the strong one, goes straight forward like a swift horse

original: sa pūrvyo vasuvijjāyamāno mṛjāno apsu duduhāno adrau
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ vasu vid jāyamānaḥ mṛjānaḥ apsu duduhānaḥ adrau
translated: The ancient one, finding wealth, being born, being cleansed, being milked in the waters, in the mountain

original: abhiśastipā bhuvanasya rājā vidad gātuṃ brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: abhiśasti pāḥ bhuvanasya rājā vidat gātum brahmaṇe pūyamānaḥ
translated: The protector from curses, the king of the world, finding the way, being purified, for the Brahman

original: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamānadhīrāḥ
analyzed: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ
translated: For our fathers, O Soma, in the days of old, O Pavamana, have performed their rites with thee, O wise one.

original: vanvannavātaḥ paridhīnraporṇu vīrebhiraśvairmaghavā bhavā naḥ🔽yathāpavathā manave vayodhā amitrahā varivovid dhaviṣmān
analyzed: vanvan avātaḥ paridhīn rapaḥ ūrṇu vīrebhiḥ aśvaiḥ maghavā bhava naḥ  yathā apavathāḥ manave vayaḥ dhāḥ amitra hā varivaḥ vid haviṣmān
translated: Shaking off the coverings, unfettered, bestowing wealth on us with thy heroes and steeds.🔽As thou hast flowed for Manu, O thou who givest life, the slayer of foes, the finder of room, the possessor of oblations,

original: evā pavasva draviṇaṃ dadhāna indre saṃ tiṣṭha janayāyudhāni
analyzed: eva pavasva draviṇam dadhānaḥ indre sam tiṣṭha janaya āyudhāni
translated: So flow on, bestowing wealth, unite with Indra, and generate the weapons.

original: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvāpo vasāno adhi sāno avye
analyzed: pavasva soma madhumān ṛtāvā apaḥ vasānaḥ adhi sāno avye
translated: Flow on, O Soma, rich in meath, true to the eternal law, clothed in the waters, on the fleecy ridge.

original: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamo matsara indrapānaḥ
analyzed: ava droṇāni ghṛtavānti sīda madintamaḥ matsaraḥ indra pānaḥ
translated: Sit in the troughs that drip with ghee, most gladdening, the draught that Indra loves.

original: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ śatadhāraḥ pavasva sahasrasā vājayurdevavītau
analyzed: vṛṣṭim divaḥ śata dhāraḥ pavasva sahasra sāḥ vājayuḥ deva vītau
translated: Flow on, O thou of hundred streams, from heaven, rain, in the feast of the gods, the prize-winning racer.

original: saṃ sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ samusriyābhiḥpratiran na āyuḥ
analyzed: sam sindhubhiḥ kalaśe vāvaśānaḥ sam usriyābhiḥ pratiran naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Rejoicing in the trough with the streams, prolonging our life with the ruddy ones.

original: eṣa sya somo matibhiḥ punāno 'tyo na vājī taratīdarātīḥ🔽payo na dugdhamaditeriṣiramurviva gātuḥ suyamona vo /ḷhā
analyzed: eṣa sya somaḥ matibhiḥ punānaḥ tyaḥ na vājī tarati id arātīḥ  payaḥ na dugdham aditeḥ iṣiram uru iva gātuḥ suyamaḥ na voḷhā
translated: This Soma, being purified with thoughts, like a strong steed, overcomes the enemies.🔽Like milk, the food of Aditi, the swift one, the path, easy to travel, for you, O men.

original: svāyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamāno 'bhyarṣa guhyaṃ cāru nāma
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ sotṛbhiḥ pūyamānaḥ bhyarṣa guhyam cāru nāma
translated: The well-weaponed one, being purified by the pressers, flow on to the secret and lovely name.

original: abhi vājaṃ saptiriva śravasyābhi vāyumabhi gā devasoma
analyzed: abhi vājam saptiḥ iva śravasya abhi vāyum abhi gāḥ deva soma
translated: Like a racer to the prize, to the wind, to the cows, O divine Soma, flow to the strength.

original: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ haryataṃ mṛjanti śumbhanti vahniṃ maruto gaṇena
analyzed: śiśum jajñānam haryatam mṛjanti śumbhanti vahnim marutaḥ gaṇena
translated: They cleanse the tawny one, the child newly born; the Maruts with their band adorn the bearer.

original: kavirgīrbhiḥ kāvyenā kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitramatyeti rebhan
analyzed: kaviḥ gīrbhiḥ kāvyena kaviḥ san somaḥ pavitram atyeti rebhan
translated: The sage, the wise one, with his songs, with his wisdom, the wise one, Soma, passing through the filter, sings.

original: ṛṣimanā ya ṛṣikṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
analyzed: ṛṣi manāḥ yaḥ ṛṣi kṛt svarṣāḥ sahasraṇīthaḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
translated: He who is the sage, the maker of sages, self-resplendent, with a path of a thousand journeys, of the poets.

original: tṛtīyaṃ dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somo virājamanurājati ṣṭup
analyzed: tṛtīyam dhāma mahiṣaḥ siṣāsan somaḥ virājam anurājati ṣṭubh
translated: The mighty one, seeking the third abode, Soma follows the Virāj, the Tristubh metre.

original: camūṣacchyenaḥ śakuno vibhṛtvā govindurdrapsa āyudhānibibhrat
analyzed: camūṣat śyenaḥ śakunaḥ vibhṛtvā go vinduḥ drapsaḥ āyudhāni bibhrat
translated: The hawk, the bird, bearing in his beaks, the drop, marked with milk, bearing weapons,

original: apāmūrmiṃ sacamānaḥ samudraṃ turīyaṃ dhāmamahiṣo vivakti
analyzed: apām ūrmim sacamānaḥ samudram turīyam dhāma mahiṣaḥ vivakti
translated: Following the wave of the waters, the ocean, the bull proclaims the fourth abode.

original: maryo na śubhrastanvaṃ mṛjāno 'tyo na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām
analyzed: maryaḥ na śubhraḥ tanvam mṛjānaḥ tyaḥ na sṛtvā sanaye dhanānām
translated: The fair one, like a youth, cleansing his body, like a horse after a race, for the winning of treasures,

original: vṛṣeva yūthā pari kośamarṣan kanikradaccamvorāviveśa🔽pavasvendo pavamāno mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇyarṣa
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthā pari kośam arṣan kanikradat camvoḥ āviveśa  pavasva indo pavamānaḥ mahobhiḥ kanikradat pari vārāṇi arṣa
translated: Rushing around the vat like a bull, he has entered the beakers, bellowing.🔽Flow on, O Indu, purified with great powers, bellowing, flow around the straining cloths.

original: krīḷañcamvorā viśa pūyamāna indraṃ te raso madiro mamattu🔽prāsya dhārā bṛhatīrasṛgrannakto gobhiḥ kalaśānā viveśa
analyzed: krīḍan camvā urāḥ viśa pūyamānaḥ indram te rasaḥ madiraḥ mamattu  prāsya dhārāḥ bṛhatīḥ asṛgran naktaḥ gobhiḥ kalaśānā viveśa
translated: Playing, purified in the beakers, let thy intoxicating essence gladden thee, O Indra.🔽He has poured forth his great streams, the night has entered the jars with the milk.

original: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyo vipaścit krandannetyabhi sakhyurna jāmim
analyzed: sāma kṛṇvan sāmanyaḥ vipaścit krandan eti abhi sakhyuḥ na jāmim
translated: Making the Sāman, the Sāman-chanter, the wise one, crying out, he has come to his friend, to his brother.

original: apaghnanneṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyāṃ na jāro abhigīta induḥ🔽sīdan vaneṣu śakuno na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā
analyzed: apaghnan eṣi pavamāna śatrūn priyām na jāraḥ abhigītaḥ induḥ  sīdan vaneṣu śakunaḥ na patvā somaḥ punānaḥ kalaśeṣu sattā
translated: O Pavamana, thou goest destroying the foes, like a beloved lover, O Indu, with songs of praise🔽Sitting in the woods like a bird on the wing, Soma, being purified, sits in the jars

original: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣeva yanti sudughāḥ sudhārāḥ🔽harirānītaḥ puruvāro apsvacikradat kalaśe devayūnām
analyzed: ā te rucaḥ pavamānasya soma yoṣā iva yanti sudughāḥ su dhārāḥ  hariḥ ānītaḥ puru vāraḥ apsu acikradat kalaśe devayūnām
translated: Thy rays, O Soma Pavamana, flow like milch-kine well-milked, with good streams, to thy damsel🔽The tawny one, the bestower of boons, brought by the Apsarases, hath bellowed in the vessel of the gods

original: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamāno devo devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam
analyzed: asya preṣā hemanā pūyamānaḥ devaḥ devebhiḥ samapṛkta rasam
translated: His messengers, being purified by the ladle, the god hath mingled the juice with the gods

original: sutaḥ pavitraṃ paryeti rebhan miteva sadma paśumānti hotā
analyzed: sutaḥ pavitram paryeti rebhan mitā iva sadma paśumānti hotā
translated: The pressed (juice) goes around the filter, singing, like a priest to his house full of cattle

original: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasāno mahān kavirnivacanāni śaṃsan
analyzed: bhadrā vastrā samanyā vasānaḥ mahān kaviḥ nivacanāni śaṃsan
translated: Wearing beautiful garments, clad in a robe, the great sage, uttering his invocations

original: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamāno vicakṣaṇo jāgṛvirdevavītau
analyzed: ā vacyasva camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ jāgṛviḥ deva vītau
translated: Be purified, O wise one, in the bowls, watchful at the banquet of the gods

original: samu priyo mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaro yaśasāṃ kṣaito asme
analyzed: samu priyaḥ mṛjyate sāno avye yaśastaraḥ yaśasām kṣaitaḥ asme
translated: He, the dear one, is made bright on the fleecy cloth, most famous of the famous, the strong one for us

original: abhi svara dhanvā pūyamāno yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: abhi svara dhanva pūyamānaḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Sing forth, O thou that art purified, like a bowman; do ye, O ye, protect us evermore with your favours

original: pra gāyatābhyarcāma devān somaṃ hinota mahate dhanāya
analyzed: pra gāyata abhyarcāma devān somam hinota mahate dhanāya
translated: Sing forth, let us glorify the gods; urge ye on Soma for great wealth

original: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāramavyamā sīdāti kalaśaṃ devayurnaḥ
analyzed: svāduḥ pavāte ati vāram avyamā sīdāti kalaśam devayuḥ naḥ
translated: Sweetly flows he over the fleecy cloth; he sits in our jar, dear to the gods

original: indurdevānāmupa sakhyamāyan sahasradhāraḥ pavate madāya
analyzed: induḥ devānām upa sakhyam āyan sahasra dhāraḥ pavate madāya
translated: The moon has come to the companionship of the gods, he flows with a thousand streams for the rapture

original: nṛbhiḥ stavāno anu dhāma pūrvamagannindraṃ mahate saubhagāya
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ stavānaḥ anu dhāma pūrvam agan indram mahate saubhagāya
translated: Praised by men, following the ancient way, he has gone to Indra for great good fortune

original: stotre rāye harirarṣā punāna indraṃ mado gachatu te bharāya
analyzed: stotre rāye hariḥ arṣa punānaḥ indram madaḥ gacchatu te bharāya
translated: O tawny one, flow for praise and wealth, purified, let your rapture go to Indra for support

original: devairyāhi sarathaṃ rādho achā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ yāhi sa ratham rādhaḥ achā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Come with the gods in your chariot to the gift, do you all protect us with your blessings

original: pra kāvyamuśaneva bruvāṇo devo devānāṃ janimā vivakti
analyzed: pra kāvyam uśanā iva bruvāṇaḥ devaḥ devānām janimā vivakti
translated: Speaking like Uśanā, the god reveals the birth of the gods, proclaiming the hymn

original: mahivrataḥ śucibandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāho abhyeti rebhan🔽pra haṃsāsastṛpalaṃ manyumachāmādastaṃ vṛṣagaṇā ayāsuḥ🔽āṅgūṣyaṃ pavamānaṃ sakhāyo durmarṣaṃ sākaṃ pravadanti vāṇam
analyzed: mahi vrataḥ śuci bandhuḥ pāvakaḥ padā varāhaḥ abhyeti rebhan  pra haṃsāsaḥ tṛpalam manyum achāmādaḥ tam vṛṣagaṇāḥ ayāsuḥ  āṅgūṣyam pavamānam sakhāyaḥ durmarṣam sākam pravadanti vāṇam
translated: Of great vow, of pure kinship, the purifier, the boar goes forth with his foot, singing🔽The geese have brought down the wrathful Tṛpāla, the herds of bulls have gone to the setting🔽The friends call together the irresistible Pavamāna, the herald, the arrow

original: sa raṃhata urugāyasya jūtiṃ vṛthā krīḷantaṃ mimate na gāvaḥ
analyzed: sa raṃhate uru gāyasya jūtim vṛthā krīḍantam mimate na gāvaḥ
translated: They measure the speed of the far-striding one, as if he were sporting idly, the cows

original: parīṇasaṃ kṛṇute tigmaśṛṅgo divā harirdadṛśe naktam ṛjraḥ
analyzed: parīṇasam kṛṇute tigma śṛṅgaḥ divā hariḥ dadṛśe naktam ṛjraḥ
translated: The sharp-horned one makes the round, the tawny one is seen by day, the dark one by night

original: indurvājī pavate gonyoghā indre somaḥ saha invan madāya
analyzed: induḥ vājī pavate gonyoghāḥ indre somaḥ sahaḥ invan madāya
translated: The strong Indu flows, the Soma of the people, together with Indra, to stimulate his joy

original: hanti rakṣo bādhate paryarātīrvarivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā
analyzed: hanti rakṣaḥ bādhate pari arātīḥ varivaḥ kṛṇvan vṛjanasya rājā
translated: Slaying the demon, repelling the enemy, the king of the people, making room for himself

original: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānastiro roma pavate adridugdhaḥ
analyzed: adha dhārayā madhvā pṛcānaḥ tiras roma pavate adri dugdhaḥ
translated: Then, being purified with sweet juice, he flows along with the stream, milked from the rock, through the wool

original: indurindrasya sakhyaṃ juṣāṇo devo devasya matsaro madāya
analyzed: induḥ indrasya sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ devaḥ devasya matsaraḥ madāya
translated: Indra's friend, the god, delighting in Indra's friendship, for the god's joy, for his rapture

original: abhi priyāṇi pavate punāno devo devān svena rasena pṛñcan
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi pavate punānaḥ devaḥ devān svena rasena pṛñcan
translated: He flows on to the dear (objects), being purified, the god, besprinkling the gods with his own juice

original: indurdharmāṇy ṛtuthā vasāno daśa kṣipo avyata sāno avye
analyzed: induḥ dharmāṇi ṛtuthā vasānaḥ daśa kṣipaḥ avyata sāno avye
translated: Indra, clothed in the laws of the seasons, has woven ten fingers on the woof of the fleece

original: vṛṣā śoṇo abhikanikradad gā nadayanneti pṛthivīmuta dyām
analyzed: vṛṣā śoṇaḥ abhikanikradat gāḥ nadayan eti pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: The red bull roars to the cows, thundering, he goes to the earth and to the sky

original: indrasyeva vagnurā śṛṇva ājau pracetayannarṣati vācamemām🔽rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamāna īrayanneṣi madhumantamaṃśum
analyzed: indrasya iva vagnuḥ ā śṛṇve ājau pracetayan arṣati vācam emām  rasāyyaḥ payasā pinvamānaḥ īrayan eṣi madhumantam aṃśum
translated: Like the shout of Indra is heard in the battle, he sends forth this speech, being very wise🔽Being purified, swelling with milk, urging on, thou goest to the most delightful plant

original: pavamānaḥ santanimeṣi kṛṇvannindrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ
analyzed: pavamānaḥ santanim eṣi kṛṇvan indrāya soma pariṣicyamānaḥ
translated: O Soma, being sprinkled, thou, O Pavamâna, makest the joints of the sacrifice

original: evā pavasva madiro madāyodagrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ
analyzed: eva pavasva madiraḥ madāya udagrābhasya namayan vadhasnaiḥ
translated: So flow thou, the gladdener, for the rapture, bending the weapons of the strong-armed one

original: pari varṇaṃ bharamāṇo ruśantaṃ gavyurno arṣa pari soma siktaḥ🔽juṣṭvī na indo supathā sugānyurau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan
analyzed: pari varṇam bharamāṇaḥ ruśantam gavyuḥ naḥ arṣa pari soma siktaḥ  juṣṭvī naḥ indo su pathā sugāni urau pavasva varivāṃsi kṛṇvan
translated: Bearing the radiant hue, flow on, O Soma, being sprinkled, as one who wins the spoil for us🔽Be thou acceptable to us, O Indu, make the paths easy and the fords easy to cross, flowing on, making wide room

original: ghaneva viṣvag duritāni vighnannadhi ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye
analyzed: ghanā iva viṣvak duritāni vighnan adhi snunā dhanva sāno avye
translated: Like a wedge, driving away all evils, on the fleecy sieve, on the fleece

original: vṛṣṭiṃ no arṣa divyāṃ jigatnumiḷāvatīṃ śaṃgayīṃ jīradānum🔽stukeva vītā dhanvā vicinvan bandhūnrimānavarānindo vāyūn
analyzed: vṛṣṭim naḥ arṣa divyām jigatnum iḷāvatīm śaṃgayīm jīra dānum  stukā iva vītā dhanva vicinvan bandhūn rimān avarān indo vāyūn
translated: Pour down upon us rain from heaven, O thou who art to be conquered, full of sweetness, with good gifts,🔽Like a singer, O Indu, seeking out these thy friends, the most excellent, the most youthful,

original: granthiṃ na vi ṣya grathitaṃ punāna ṛjuṃ ca gātuṃ vṛjinaṃ ca soma
analyzed: granthim na vi sya grathitam punānaḥ ṛjum ca gātum vṛjinam ca soma
translated: Untie, O Soma, as thou art purified, the tied knot, and make the path straight and crooked,

original: atyo na krado harirā sṛjāno maryo deva dhanva pastyāvān
analyzed: atyaḥ na kradaḥ harirā sṛjānaḥ maryaḥ deva dhanva pastyāvān
translated: Like a bay horse, O god, a racer, a young man, a dweller in the steppe, let loose,

original: juṣṭo madāya devatāta indo pari ṣṇunā dhanva sāno avye
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ madāya devatāte indo pari snunā dhanva sāno avye
translated: O Indu, dear for the rapture of the gods, flow around the edge, O thou of the fleece,

original: sahasradhāraḥ surabhiradabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ surabhiḥ adabdhaḥ pari srava vājasātau nṛṣahye
translated: With a thousand streams, fragrant, infallible, flow around in the battle for booty, in the contest of men.

original: araśmāno ye 'rathā ayuktā atyāso na sasṛjānāsa ājau
analyzed: a raśmānaḥ ye rathāḥ a yuktāḥ atyāsaḥ na sasṛjānāsaḥ ājau
translated: Those who have no reins, no chariots, no yokes, no horses, no bonds in the battle,

original: ete śukrāso dhanvanti somā devāsastānupa yātā pibadhyai
analyzed: ete śukrāsaḥ dhanvanti somāḥ devāsaḥ tān upa yātā pibadhyai
translated: These bright ones, the Somas, flow, O gods, come to them to drink.

original: evā na indo abhi devavītiṃ pari srava nabho arṇaścamūṣu
analyzed: eva naḥ indo abhi deva vītim pari srava nabhaḥ arṇaḥ camūṣu
translated: Thus, O Indu, flow to the feast of the gods around the cloud and the waters in the bowls.

original: somo asmabhyaṃ kāmyaṃ bṛhantaṃ rayiṃ dadātu vīravantamugram
analyzed: somaḥ asmabhyam kāmyam bṛhantam rayim dadātu vīravantam ugram
translated: May Soma grant us great wealth to be desired, mighty, full of heroes.

original: takṣad yadī manaso venato vāg jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣoranīke
analyzed: takṣat yadī manasaḥ venataḥ vāc jyeṣṭhasya vā dharmaṇi kṣoḥ anīke
translated: He fashions what the longing mind desires, in the highest law, in the line of the Kshatriya.

original: ādīmāyan varamā vāvaśānā juṣṭaṃ patiṃ kalaśe gāva indum
analyzed: ādīmāyan varamāḥ vāvaśānāḥ juṣṭam patim kalaśe gāvaḥ indum
translated: The lowing cows have come to choose a dear husband, the cows to Indu in the jar.

original: pra dānudo divyo dānupinva ṛtam ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ
analyzed: pra dānudaḥ divyaḥ dānu pinvaḥ ṛtam ṛtāya pavate sumedhāḥ
translated: The giver of gifts, the heavenly one who fills with gifts, the wise one flows for truth to truth.

original: dharmā bhuvad vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhirdaśabhirbhāri bhūma
analyzed: dharmā bhuvat vṛjanyasya rājā pra raśmibhiḥ daśabhiḥ bhāri bhūma
translated: He has become the law, the king of the people, he supports the earth with his ten rays.

original: pavitrebhiḥ pavamāno nṛcakṣā rājā devānāmuta martyānām
analyzed: pavitrebhiḥ pavamānaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ rājā devānām uta martyānām
translated: Purified by the purifiers, Pavamana, the king of the gods and of mortals,

original: dvitā bhuvad rayipatī rayīṇām ṛtaṃ bharat subhṛtaṃ cārvinduḥ
analyzed: dvitā bhuvat rayi patiḥ rayīṇām ṛtam bharat su bhṛtam cāru induḥ
translated: Has become the two-fold lord of wealth, the lord of riches, the well-born Indu bears truth.

original: arvāniva śravase sātimachendrasya vāyorabhi vītimarṣa🔽sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīriṣo dā bhavā soma draviṇovit punānaḥ
analyzed: arvān iva śravase sātimachā indrasya vāyoḥ abhi vītimarṣa  sa naḥ sahasrā bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ dāḥ bhava soma draviṇaḥ vid punānaḥ
translated: Like a horse, for glory, he has gone to the contest, he has passed over the path of Indra and Vayu.🔽Give us, O Soma, the great powers of a thousand, be thou a finder of wealth, being purified.

original: devāvyo naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayaṃ suvīraṃ dhanvantu somāḥ
analyzed: devāvyaḥ naḥ pariṣicyamānāḥ kṣayam su vīram dhanvantu somāḥ
translated: The Soma juices, being sprinkled around, may come to our abode rich in brave men.

original: āyajyavaḥ sumatiṃ viśvavārā hotāro na diviyajo mandratamāḥ🔽evā deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase devapānaḥ
analyzed: āyajyavaḥ sumatim viśva vārāḥ hotāraḥ na diviyajaḥ mandratamāḥ  eva deva devatāte pavasva mahe soma psarase deva pānaḥ
translated: The Adhvaryus, worthy of sacrifice, all-desired, the most delightful priests of the heavenly sacrifice,🔽Thus, O god, flow for the sake of the gods, O Soma, for the great enjoyment, to be drunk by the gods.

original: mahaścid dhi ṣmasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ
analyzed: mahaścit hi smasi hitāḥ samarye kṛdhi suṣṭhāne rodasī punānaḥ
translated: For we are indeed set in a great battle, purify the two worlds, make them well-supported.

original: aśvo no krado vṛṣabhiryujānaḥ siṃho na bhīmo manaso javīyān
analyzed: aśvaḥ naḥ kradaḥ vṛṣabhiḥ yujānaḥ siṃhaḥ na bhīmaḥ manasaḥ javīyān
translated: Like a horse, our racer, yoked by the bulls, swifter than thought, like a terrible lion,

original: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhirye rajiṣṭhā ā pavasva saumanasaṃ na indo
analyzed: arvācīnaiḥ pathibhiḥ ye rajiṣṭhāḥ ā pavasva saumanasam naḥ indo
translated: With the most direct paths, O Indu, flow to us the favor of the mind

original: śataṃ dhārā devajātā asṛgran sahasramenāḥ kavayo mṛjanti
analyzed: śatam dhārāḥ deva jātāḥ asṛgran sahasram enāḥ kavayaḥ mṛjanti
translated: The hundred streams, born of the gods, have flowed, the wise ones cleanse the thousand (streams)

original: indo sanitraṃ diva ā pavasva puraetāsi mahato dhanasya
analyzed: indo sanitram divaḥ ā pavasva puraetā asi mahataḥ dhanasya
translated: O Indu, flow to us from heaven the treasure of the great one

original: divo na sargā asasṛgramahnāṃ rājā na mitraṃ pra minātidhīraḥ
analyzed: divaḥ na sargāḥ asasṛgram ahnām rājā na mitram pra mināti dhīraḥ
translated: The streams of days have flowed like the outpourings of heaven, the wise one, like a king, does not transgress the covenant

original: piturna putraḥ kratubhiryatāna ā pavasva viśeasyā ajītim
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ kratubhiḥ yatānaḥ ā pavasva viśeasyai ajītim
translated: Like a son of his father, urged on by the holy powers, flow to this people for their prosperity

original: pra te dhārā madhumatīrasṛgran vārān yat pūto atyeṣyavyān🔽pavamāna pavase dhāma gonāṃ jajñānaḥ sūryamapinvo arkaiḥ
analyzed: pra te dhārāḥ madhumatīḥ asṛgran vārān yat pūtaḥ atyeṣyavyān  pavamāna pavase dhāma gonām jajñānaḥ sūryam apinvaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: Your streams have flowed, rich in honey, when, being purified, you have to pass through the woolen filters🔽O Pavamâna, thou purifiest the abode of the cows, being born, thou hast filled the sun with thy rays

original: kanikradadanu panthām ṛtasya śukro vi bhāsyamṛtasya dhāma
analyzed: kanikradat anu panthām ṛtasya śukraḥ vi bhāsyam ṛtasya dhāma
translated: The white one, roaring, has gone along the path of holy order, illuminating the abode of immortality

original: sa indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvāno vācaṃ matibhiḥ kavīnām
analyzed: saḥ indrāya pavase matsaravān hinvānaḥ vācam matibhiḥ kavīnām
translated: Thou, O Pavamâna, flowest to Indra, full of joy, impelling speech with the thoughts of the sages

original: divyaḥ suparṇo 'va cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā devavītau
analyzed: divyaḥ suparṇaḥ va cakṣi soma pinvan dhārāḥ karmaṇā deva vītau
translated: O Soma, the divine bird has looked down, filling the streams in the performance of the feast of the gods

original: endo viśa kalaśaṃ somadhānaṃ krandannihi sūryasyopa raśmim
analyzed: ā indo viśa kalaśam soma dhānam krandan ihi sūryasya upa raśmim
translated: O Indu, enter the vat, the receptacle of Soma, roaring, take up the ray of the sun

original: tisro vāca īrayati pra vahnirṛtasya dhītiṃ brahmaṇo manīṣām🔽gāvo yanti gopatiṃ pṛchamānāḥ somaṃ yanti matayo vāvaśānāḥ
analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ īrayati pra vahniḥ ṛtasya dhītim brahmaṇaḥ manīṣām  gāvaḥ yanti gopatim pṛcchamānāḥ somam yanti matayaḥ vāvaśānāḥ
translated: The priest sends forth three voices, the thought of truth, the wisdom of prayer.🔽The cows go to the lord of the cows with questions, the thoughts go to Soma, lowing.

original: somaṃ gāvo dhenavo vāvaśānāḥ somaṃ viprā matibhiḥ pṛchamānāḥ
analyzed: somam gāvaḥ dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ somam viprāḥ matibhiḥ pṛcchamānāḥ
translated: The cows, the milch cows, low to Soma, the sages with their thoughts ask questions of Soma.

original: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkāstriṣṭubhiḥ saṃ navante
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ pūyate ajyamānaḥ some arkāḥ triṣṭubhiḥ sam navante
translated: The pressed Soma is purified, being anointed, in Soma the hymns are renewed with Tristubh verses.

original: evā naḥ soma pariṣicyamāna ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti
analyzed: eva naḥ soma pariṣicyamānaḥ ā pavasva pūyamānaḥ svasti
translated: O Soma, thus being poured out, flow to us, being purified, to our welfare.

original: indramā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhayā vācaṃ janayā purandhim
analyzed: indra mā viśa bṛhatā raveṇa vardhaya vācam janaya purandhim
translated: Enter Indra with loud sound, increase the voice, generate Purandhi.

original: ā jāgṛvirvipra ṛtā matīnāṃ somaḥ punāno asadaccamūṣu
analyzed: ā jāgṛviḥ vipraḥ ṛtā matīnām somaḥ punānaḥ asadat camūṣu
translated: The watchful one, the sage of the true thoughts, Soma, being purified, has sat in the bowls.

original: sapanti yaṃ mithunāso nikāmā adhvaryavo rathirāsaḥ suhastāḥ
analyzed: sapanti yam mithunāsaḥ nikāmāḥ adhvaryavaḥ rathirāsaḥ su hastāḥ
translated: The pairs who desire him, the swift Adhvaryus with skillful hands, praise him.

original: sa punāna upa sūre na dhātobhe aprā rodasī vi ṣa āvaḥ
analyzed: sa punānaḥ upa sūre na dhātā ubhe aprāḥ rodasī vi saḥ āvaḥ
translated: He, being purified, has risen to the sun, has filled both the worlds, has opened the two worlds.

original: priyā cid yasya priyasāsa ūtī sa tū dhanaṃ kāriṇena pra yaṃsat
analyzed: priyā cit yasya priyasāsaḥ ūtī sa tu dhanam kāriṇena pra yaṃsat
translated: Even he whose help is dear through dear deeds, may he carry off the wealth of the niggard.

original: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somo mīḍhvānabhi no jyotiṣāvīt
analyzed: sa vardhitā vardhanaḥ pūyamānaḥ somaḥ mīḍhvān abhi naḥ jyotiṣā āvīt
translated: He, being purified, the increaser, the augmenter, Soma, the bountiful, has come to us with light.

original: yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñāḥ svarvido abhi gā adrimuṣṇan
analyzed: yena naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ svar vidaḥ abhi gāḥ adrim uṣṇan
translated: By whom our sires of old, knowing the place, bestowing heaven, pressed out the milk against the rock

original: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmañ janayan prajā bhuvanasyarājā
analyzed: akrān samudraḥ prathame vidharmam janayan prajāḥ bhuvanasya rājā
translated: The ocean hath flowed forth, the first of all existing things, begetting offspring, king of the world

original: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somo vāvṛdhe suvāna induḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā pavitre adhi sāno avye bṛhat somaḥ vāvṛdhe suvānaḥ induḥ
translated: The bull hath flowed upon the fleece, upon the spotless place: Soma hath waxen great, the drop hath flowed

original: mahat tat somo mahiṣaścakārāpāṃ yad garbho 'vṛṇīta devān
analyzed: mahat tat somaḥ mahiṣaḥ cakāra apām yat garbhaḥ vṛṇīta devān
translated: That great deed hath Soma done, the great bull, when he, the germ of waters, chose the gods

original: adadhādindre pavamāna ojo 'janayat sūrye jyotirinduḥ
analyzed: adadhāt indre pavamānaḥ ojaḥ janayat sūrye jyotiḥ induḥ
translated: He hath bestowed strength in Indra, O Pavamana, he hath generated light in the sun, the drop

original: matsi vāyumiṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: matsi vāyum iṣṭaye rādhase ca matsi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Thou rejoicest Vayu for the sake of strength and bounty, thou rejoicest Mitra-Varuṇa when purified

original: matsi śardho mārutaṃ matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma
analyzed: matsi śardhaḥ mārutam matsi devān matsi dyāvāpṛthivī deva soma
translated: Thou rejoicest the Marut host, thou rejoicest the gods, thou rejoicest heaven and earth, O god, O Soma

original: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantāpāmīvāṃ bādhamāno mṛdhaśca🔽abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasābhi gonāmindrasya tvaṃ tava vayaṃ sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: ṛjuḥ pavasva vṛjinasya hantā apa amīvām bādhamānaḥ mṛdhaḥ ca  abhiśrīṇan payaḥ payasā abhi gonām indrasya tvam tava vayam sakhāyaḥ
translated: Flow straight, the slayer of the crooked one, repelling evil speech and spite🔽Blending the milk with milk for the milker's son, we are the friends of Indra, thou of us, O Soma

original: madhvaḥ sūdaṃ pavasva vasva utsaṃ vīraṃ ca na ā pavasvā bhagaṃ ca
analyzed: madhvaḥ sūdam pavasva vasvaḥ utsam vīram ca naḥ ā pavasva bhagam ca
translated: Flow on, purifying, as a presser, the sweet juice, the spring of wealth: flow on to us for hero strength and bliss

original: svadasvendrāya pavamāna indo rayiṃ ca na ā pavasvā samudrāt
analyzed: svadasva indrāya pavamānaḥ indoḥ rayim ca naḥ ā pavasva samudrāt
translated: Be sweet for Indra, O Indu, O Pavamana: flow on to us from the ocean for riches.

original: somaḥ suto dhārayātyo na hitvā sindhurna nimnamabhi vājyakṣāḥ
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ dhāraya atyaḥ na hitvā sindhuḥ na nimnam abhi vājī akṣāḥ
translated: Soma, pressed, flows on with a stream, like a courser, like a river, to the low place, the racer

original: ā yoniṃ vanyamasadat punānaḥ samindurgobhirasarat samadbhiḥ
analyzed: ā yonim vanyam asadat punānaḥ sam induḥ gobhiḥ asarat samadbhiḥ
translated: Having been purified, he has sat down in the ancient seat, with the drops, with the cows, with the swift ones

original: eṣa sya te pavata indra somaścamūṣu dhīra uśate tavasvān
analyzed: eṣa sya te pavate indra somaḥ camūṣu dhīraḥ uśate tavasvān
translated: This, O Indra, is thy Soma, pressed, in the bowls, the wise one, the strong one, for the eager one

original: svarcakṣā rathiraḥ satyaśuṣmaḥ kāmo na yo devayatāmasarji
analyzed: svar cakṣāḥ rathiraḥ satya śuṣmaḥ kāmaḥ na yaḥ devayatām asarji
translated: The seer of light, the charioteer, of true strength, like a wish, he has been sent forth by those who delight in the gods

original: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānastiro varpāṃsi duhiturdadhānaḥ
analyzed: eṣa pratnena vayasā punānaḥ tiras varpāṃsi duhituḥ dadhānaḥ
translated: This one, being purified with the ancient vigour, bearing the forms of his daughter in concealment

original: vasānaḥ śarma trivarūthamapsu hoteva yāti samaneṣurebhan
analyzed: vasānaḥ śarma tri varūtham apsu hotā iva yāti samaneṣuḥ ebhan
translated: Wearing the protection of the threefold refuge, he goes to the waters, like a priest, singing with the rays

original: nū nastvaṃ rathiro deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: nu naḥ tvam rathiraḥ deva soma pari srava camvoḥ pūyamānaḥ
translated: Now, O charioteer, O god Soma, flowing around in the bowls, being purified

original: apsu svādiṣṭho madhumān ṛtāvā devo na yaḥ savitā satyamanmā
analyzed: apsu svādiṣṭhaḥ madhumān ṛtāvā devaḥ na yaḥ savitā satya manmā
translated: In the waters, most sweet, full of honey, righteous, like a god, like Savitar, of true thought

original: abhi vāyuṃ vītyarṣā gṛṇāno 'bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: abhi vāyum vītyarṣa gṛṇānaḥ bhi mitrāvaruṇā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flowing past Vayu, being praised, past Mitra-Varuna, being purified

original: abhī naraṃ dhījavanaṃ ratheṣṭhāmabhīndraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhum
analyzed: abhi naram dhī javanam ratheṣṭhām abhi indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum
translated: Past the man who delights in thought, the chariot-rider, past Indra, the strong one, with the thunderbolt in his arm

original: abhi vastrā suvasanānyarṣābhi dhenūḥ sudughāḥ pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: abhi vastrā su vasanāni arṣa abhi dhenūḥ su dughāḥ pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow past the garments that are well-woven, past the cows that yield good milk, being purified

original: abhi candrā bhartave no hiraṇyābhyaśvān rathino deva soma
analyzed: abhi candrā bhartave naḥ hiraṇyā abhi aśvān rathinaḥ deva soma
translated: Past the radiant gold to bear for us, past the horses that draw chariots, O god Soma

original: abhī no arṣa divyā vasūnyabhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ
