analyzed: abhi naḥ arṣa divyā vasūni abhi viśvā pārthivā pūyamānaḥ
translated: Flow to us, purifying, with the heavenly treasures, and all those on earth,

original: abhi yena draviṇamaśnavāmābhyarṣeyaṃ jamadagnivannaḥ
analyzed: abhi yena draviṇam aśnavāma abhyarṣeyam jamadagni vat naḥ
translated: So that we may obtain wealth by which, O Indu, you flow to us like Jamadagni.

original: ayā pavā pavasvainā vasūni māṃścatva indo sarasi pra dhanva
analyzed: ayā pavā pavasva enā vasūni māṃścatve indo sarasi pra dhanva
translated: Flow on, O Purifier, with these treasures, and with the six, O Indu, in the lake, spread out wealth.

original: bradhnaścidatra vāto na jātaḥ purumedhaścit takave naraṃ dāt
analyzed: bradhnaḥ cit atra vātaḥ na jātaḥ puru medhaḥ cit takave naram dāt
translated: Even here the thunder is born like the wind, and the bountiful one has given a man to the singer.

original: uta na enā pavayā pavasvādhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe
analyzed: uta naḥ enā pavayā pavasva adhi śrute śravāyyasya tīrthe
translated: And for us, flow on with the purifying (stream), in the well-known place of the glorious one, to be drunk.

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā naiguto vasūni vṛkṣaṃ na pakvaṃ dhūnavad raṇāya
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim sahasrā naigutaḥ vasūni vṛkṣam na pakvam dhūnavat raṇāya
translated: The Nîgada has shaken for the contest the tree full of ripe fruit, as it were, for wealth.

original: mahīme asya vṛṣanāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre
analyzed: mahi ime asya vṛṣa nāma śūṣe māṃścatve vā pṛśane vā vadhatre
translated: I praise his great and mighty name, either in the battle or in the contest.

original: asvāpayan nigutaḥ snehayaccāpāmitrānapācito acetaḥ
analyzed: asvāpayat nigutaḥ snehayat ca apa amitra anapā citaḥ acetaḥ
translated: He has put to sleep the Nîgada, and has melted him, the uncooked, the senseless foe.

original: saṃ trī pavitrā vitatānyeṣyanvekaṃ dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ
analyzed: sam trī pavitrā vitatāni eṣi anu ekam dhāvasi pūyamānaḥ
translated: You have spread out the three sieves, and you flow along each one, being purified.

original: asi bhago asi dātrasya dātāsi maghavā maghavadbhya indo
analyzed: asi bhagaḥ asi dātrasya dātā asi maghavā maghavadbhyaḥ indo
translated: You are Bhaga, you are the giver of the giver, you are the bountiful one for the bountiful ones, O Indu.

original: eṣa viśvavit pavate manīṣī somo viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
analyzed: eṣa viśva vid pavate manīṣī somaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translated: This all-knowing, wise Soma flows on, the king of the whole world.

original: drapsānīrayan vidatheṣvindurvi vāramavyaṃ samayāti yāti
analyzed: drapsān īrayan vidatheṣu induḥ vi vāram avyam samayā ati yāti
translated: Sending forth drops, the moon in the sacrifices, he goes through the sieve, he goes.

original: induṃ rihanti mahiṣā adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayo na gṛdhrāḥ
analyzed: indum rihanti mahiṣāḥ adabdhāḥ pade rebhanti kavayaḥ na gṛdhrāḥ
translated: The untroubled bulls lick the moon, in the place they sing like the eager sages

original: hinvanti dhīrā daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ samañjate rūpamapāṃ rasena
analyzed: hinvanti dhīrāḥ daśabhiḥ kṣipābhiḥ samañjate rūpam apām rasena
translated: The wise ones urge him with ten swift (horses), they adorn his form with the essence of the waters

original: tvayā vayaṃ pavamānena soma bhare kṛtaṃ vi cinuyāma śaśvat
analyzed: tvayā vayam pavamānena soma bhare kṛtam vi cinuyāma śaśvat
translated: By you, O Soma, by this purifying (juice), we may always win what has been done in the contest

original: tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantāmaditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivīuta dyauḥ🔽abhi no vājasātamaṃ rayimarṣa puruspṛham
analyzed: tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ  abhi naḥ vāja sātamam rayi marṣa puruspṛham
translated: May this be granted to us by Mitra, Varuna, Aditi, the Sindhu, the earth, and the sky🔽Impel to us, O Indu, wealth most worthy of the prize, most desired by many,

original: indo sahasrabharṇasaṃ tuvidyumnaṃ vibhvāsaham
analyzed: indo sahasrabharṇasam tuvi dyumnam vibhvāsaham
translated: O Indu, wealth consisting of a thousand (cows), very glorious, to be obtained by all,

original: pari ṣya suvāno /
analyzed: pari sya suvānaḥ
translated: Flowing around, being pressed,

original: avyayaṃ rathe na varmāvyata
analyzed: avyayam rathe na varma āvyata
translated: He is clothed in an imperishable armour, like a chariot,

original: indurabhidruṇā hito hiyāno dhārābhirakṣāḥ🔽pari ṣya suvāno akṣā induravye madacyutaḥ
analyzed: induḥ abhidruṇā hitaḥ hiyānaḥ dhārā abhirakṣāḥ  pari sya suvānaḥ akṣāḥ indu ravye mada cyutaḥ
translated: Indu, impelled by the swift one, being carried along with streams, O guardian,🔽Flowing around, being pressed, Indu, in the unploughed (land), not spilling the rapture,

original: dhārā ya ūrdhvo adhvare bhrājā naiti gavyayuḥ
analyzed: dhārā yaḥ ūrdhvaḥ adhvare bhrājā na eti gavyayuḥ
translated: The stream which rises upwards at the sacrifice, goes shining, seeking the cows,

original: sa hi tvaṃ deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: sa hi tvam deva śaśvate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
translated: For you are that, O god, always the good thing for the mortal who offers,

original: indo sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ śatātmānaṃ vivāsasi
analyzed: indo sahasriṇam rayim śata ātmānam vivāsasi
translated: O Indu, you bestow wealth consisting of a thousand (cows), of a hundred (cows),

original: vayaṃ te asya vṛtrahan vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ🔽ni nediṣṭhatamā iṣaḥ syāma sumnasyādhrigo
analyzed: vayam te asya vṛtra han vaso vasvaḥ puruspṛhaḥ 🔽ni nediṣṭhatamāḥ iṣaḥ syāma sumnasya adhrigo
translated: We, O Vṛtra-slayer, of this your good thing, O good one, most desired by many,🔽May we be the nearest to your food, O you who go to the sacrifice, to bliss.

original: dviryaṃ pañca svayaśasaṃ svasāro adrisaṃhatam🔽priyamindrasya kāmyaṃ prasnāpayantyūrmiṇam
analyzed: dvis yam pañca sva yaśasam svasāraḥ adri saṃhatam  priyam indrasya kāmyam prasnāpayanti ūrmiṇam
translated: The two, the five, his own sisters, the one who is united with the mountain,🔽The dear one, desirable to Indra, they make to flow, the one with waves.

original: pari tyaṃ haryataṃ hariṃ babhruṃ punanti vāreṇa
analyzed: pari tyam haryatam harim babhrum punanti vāreṇa
translated: They purify the tawny one, the brown one, the cheerful one, with the filter,

original: yo devān viśvānit pari madena saha gachati
analyzed: yaḥ devān viśvān id pari madena saha gacchati
translated: He who goes around with intoxication to all the gods.

original: asya vo hyavasā pānto dakṣasādhanam
analyzed: asya vaḥ hi avasā pāntaḥ dakṣa sādhanam
translated: For you indeed is this help, this protection, the means of accomplishing strength,

original: yaḥ sūriṣu śravobṛhad dadhe svarṇa haryataḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sūriṣu śravaḥ bṛhat dadhe svarṇa haryataḥ
translated: He who has placed great fame among the nobles, the golden one, the tawny one.

original: sa vāṃ yajñeṣu mānavī indurjaniṣṭa rodasī
analyzed: sa vām yajñeṣu mānavī induḥ janiṣṭa rodasī
translated: That Indu, O human ones, has generated the two worlds at your sacrifices.

original: devo devī giriṣṭhā asredhan taṃ tuviṣvaṇi
analyzed: devaḥ devī giriṣṭhāḥ asredhan tam tuviṣvaṇi
translated: The god, the goddess dwelling in the mountain, the one who does not injure, him, the very powerful one,

original: indrāya soma pātave vṛtraghne pari ṣicyase
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave vṛtra ghne pari sicyase
translated: For Indra, O Soma, you are poured out to be drunk, to the slayer of Vritra.

original: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade
analyzed: nare ca dakṣiṇāvate devāya sadanāsade
translated: To the god who sits in the seat, to the god who is given the sacrificial fee, to the man who gives the sacrificial fee.

original: te pratnāso vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran
analyzed: te pratnāsaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu somāḥ pavitre akṣaran
translated: Those ancient ones, the Somas, have flowed into the filter at the dawns.

original: apaprothantaḥ sanutarhuraścitaḥ prātastānapracetasaḥ🔽taṃ sakhāyaḥ purorucaṃ yūyaṃ vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ🔽aśyāma vājagandhyaṃ sanema vājapastyam
analyzed: apaprothantaḥ sanutar huraścitaḥ prātastāna pracetasaḥ  tam sakhāyaḥ purorucam yūyam vayam ca sūrayaḥ  aśyāma vājagandhyam sanema vāja pastyam
translated: Stretching out, far-reaching, with sharpened horns, the impetuous ones, the wise ones, at dawn.🔽You, O friends, and we, the princes,🔽May we obtain the one who smells like strength, may we win the one who has strength as his share.

original: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanustanvanti pauṃsyam
analyzed: ā haryatāya dhṛṣṇave dhanuḥ tanvanti pauṃsyam
translated: They stretch the bow for the tawny one, the daring one, for manly strength.

original: śukrāṃvayantyasurāya nirṇijaṃ vipāmagre mahīyuvaḥ
analyzed: śukrām vayanti asurāya nirṇijam vipām agre mahīyuvaḥ
translated: They purify the bright robe for the Asura, the mighty ones first in the house of Vipā

original: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛto vājānabhi pra gāhate
analyzed: adha kṣapā pariṣkṛtaḥ vājān abhi pra gāhate
translated: Then the night, purified, goes forth to the abundant food

original: yadī vivasvato dhiyo hariṃ hinvanti yātave
analyzed: yadī vivasvataḥ dhiyaḥ harim hinvanti yātave
translated: When the thoughts of Vivasvan urge the tawny one to speed

original: tamasya marjayāmasi mado ya indrapātamaḥ
analyzed: tamasya marjayāmasi madaḥ yaḥ indra pātamaḥ
translated: We adorn him, the most delightful juice, who belongs to Indra

original: yaṃ gāva āsabhirdadhuḥ purā nūnaṃ ca sūrayaḥ
analyzed: yam gāvaḥ āsabhiḥ dadhuḥ purā nūnam ca sūrayaḥ
translated: Whom the cows, as it were, with their mouths, and the princes of old and of recent times

original: taṃ gāthayā purāṇyā punānamabhyanūṣata
analyzed: tam gāthayā purāṇyā punānam abhyanūṣata
translated: Him, the ancient one, they have praised with a song, while he was being purified

original: uto kṛpantadhītayo devānāṃ nāma bibhratīḥ
analyzed: uta u kṛpanta dhītayaḥ devānām nāma bibhratīḥ
translated: And the thoughts of the gods have come forth, bearing the names of the gods

original: tamukṣamāṇamavyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim
analyzed: tam ukṣamāṇam avyaye vāre punanti dharṇasim
translated: They purify in the inexhaustible sieve the one who is being pressed, the supporter

original: dūtaṃ na pūrvacittaya ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: dūtam na pūrvacittaye ā śāsate manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise ones send forth the messenger, thinking of him first, to give instruction

original: sa punāno madintamaḥ somaścamūṣu sīdati
analyzed: sa punānaḥ madintamaḥ somaḥ camūṣu sīdati
translated: He, being purified, the most delightful Soma, sits in the bowls

original: paśau na reta ādadhat patirvacasyate dhiyaḥ
analyzed: paśau na retaḥ ādadhat patiḥ vacasyate dhiyaḥ
translated: As a husband bestowing seed on a cow, he is praised as the lord of speech and thoughts

original: sa mṛjyate sukarmabhirdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: sa mṛjyate su karmabhiḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
translated: He is adorned by the well-performing ones, the god, pressed for the gods

original: vide yadāsu sandadirmahīrapo vi gāhate🔽suta indo pavitra ā nṛbhiryato vi nīyase🔽indrāya matsarintamaścamūṣvā ni ṣīdasi
analyzed: vide yadāsu sandadiḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vi gāhate  sutaḥ indo pavitre ā nṛbhiḥ yataḥ vi nīyase  indrāya matsarintamaḥ camū uṣva ā ni sīdasi
translated: He knows when he is let loose, when he plunges into the great waters🔽O Indu, being pressed in the sieve, when you are led forth by the men🔽You sit in the bowls, most gladdening, for Indra

original: abhī navante adruhaḥ priyamindrasya kāmyam
analyzed: abhi navante adruhaḥ priyam indrasya kāmyam
translated: The guileless ones have sung forth the dear one, dear to Indra

original: vatsaṃ na pūrva āyuni jātaṃ rihanti mātaraḥ
analyzed: vatsam na pūrve āyuni jātam rihanti mātaraḥ
translated: The mothers lick the calf that is born in the east, as if it were their own

original: punāna indavā bhara soma dvibarhasaṃ rayim
analyzed: punānaḥ indavā bhara soma dvibarhasam rayim
translated: Purifying, O Indu, bring us wealth, O Soma, in twofold abundance

original: tvaṃ vasūnipuṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe
analyzed: tvam vasūni puṣyasi viśvāni dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: You promote all treasures in the house of the worshipper

original: tvaṃ dhiyaṃ manoyujaṃ sṛjā vṛṣṭiṃ na tanyatuḥ
analyzed: tvam dhiyam manaḥ yujam sṛja vṛṣṭim na tanyatuḥ
translated: You send forth the thought yoked with the mind, like rain from a cloud

original: tvaṃ vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi
analyzed: tvam vasūni pārthivā divyā ca soma puṣyasi
translated: You promote, O Soma, the treasures on earth and in heaven

original: pari te jigyuṣo yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati🔽raṃhamāṇāvyavyayaṃ vāraṃ vājīva sānasiḥ
analyzed: pari te jigyuṣaḥ yathā dhārā sutasya dhāvati  raṃhamāṇa avi avyayam vāram vājī iva sānasiḥ
translated: Your stream flows like that of one who desires to conquer🔽Rushing along, like a swift horse, to the prize

original: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā
analyzed: kratve dakṣāya naḥ kave pavasva soma dhārayā
translated: Flow for our wisdom and skill, O wise Soma, in a stream

original: indrāya pātave suto mitrāya varuṇāya ca
analyzed: indrāya pātave sutaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: Pressed, for Indra to drink, for Mitra, for Varuna

original: pavasva vājasātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ
analyzed: pavasva vāja sātamaḥ pavitre dhārayā sutaḥ
translated: Flow on, best at winning strength, pressed, in a stream, into the purifying filter

original: indrāya somaviṣṇave devebhyo madhumattamaḥ
analyzed: indrāya soma viṣṇave devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ
translated: For Indra, for Soma, for Vishnu, for the gods, most rich in honey

original: tvāṃ rihanti mātaro hariṃ pavitre adruhaḥ
analyzed: tvām rihanti mātaraḥ harim pavitre adruhaḥ
translated: The guileless mothers lick the tawny one, the dear one, in the purifying sieve

original: vatsaṃ jātaṃna dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi🔽pavamāna mahi śravaścitrebhiryāsi raśmibhiḥ
analyzed: vatsam jātaṃna dhenavaḥ pavamāna vidharmaṇi  pavamāna mahi śravaḥ citrebhiḥ yāsi raśmibhiḥ
translated: Like cows licking their newborn calf, O Pavamana, in the place of holy order🔽O Pavamana, with your wondrous rays you come to us, O mighty one, for great glory

original: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣo gṛhe
analyzed: śardhan tamāṃsi jighnase viśvāni dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: You, a falcon, destroy the darkness, all, in the house of the worshipper

original: tvaṃ dyāṃ ca mahivrata pṛthivīṃ cāti jabhriṣe
analyzed: tvam dyām ca mahi vrata pṛthivīm ca ati jabhriṣe
translated: You, O mighty one, surpass both heaven and earth

original: prati drāpimamuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā
analyzed: prati drāpim amuñcathāḥ pavamāna mahitvanā
translated: You have released the drop, O Pavamâna, through your greatness,

original: purojitī vo andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave
analyzed: purojitī vaḥ andhasaḥ sutāya mādayitnave
translated: The leaders of you all, O juice, for the gladdening draught that is pressed,

original: apa śvānaṃ śnathiṣṭana sakhāyo dīrghajihvyam
analyzed: apa śvānam śnathiṣṭana sakhāyaḥ dīrghajihvyam
translated: Tear off the dog, O friends, the long-tongued one,

original: yo dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ dhārayā pāvakayā pariprasyandate sutaḥ
translated: He who flows on with purifying stream, the juice that is pressed,

original: induraśvo na kṛtvyaḥ🔽taṃ duroṣamabhī naraḥ somaṃ viśvācyā dhiyā
analyzed: induḥ aśvaḥ na kṛtvyaḥ  tam duroṣam abhi naraḥ somam viśvācyā dhiyā
translated: Indra's dear friend, the courser,🔽Him, the irresistible, the men urge on with thought that reaches all,

original: yajñaṃ hinvantyadribhiḥ
analyzed: yajñam hinvanti adribhiḥ
translated: Soma, with stones, to the sacrifice,

original: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ
analyzed: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ
translated: The juices, most rich in sweets, the Somas, gladdeners, for Indra,

original: pavitravantoakṣaran devān gachantu vo madāḥ
analyzed: pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gachantu vaḥ madāḥ
translated: Flow, having the cleansing sieve: let your delights go to the Gods.

original: indurindrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan
analyzed: induḥ indrāya pavate iti devāsaḥ abruvan
translated: Indra's dear friend, the courser, gladdens him, the juice, the essence of the wood,

original: vācas patirmakhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā
analyzed: vācaḥ patiḥ makhasyate viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: The Lord of Speech, the Lord of sacrifice, the Lord of all by might,

original: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pavate samudraḥ vācamīṅkhayaḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed, the ocean, who moves the voice, is purified,

original: somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya divedive
analyzed: somaḥ patiḥ rayīṇām sakhā indrasya dive dive
translated: Soma, the Lord of wealth, is Indra's friend day after day.

original: ayaṃ pūṣā rayirbhagaḥ somaḥ punāno arṣati
analyzed: ayam pūṣā rayiḥ bhagaḥ somaḥ punānaḥ arṣati
translated: This Soma, Pûshan, Bhaga, wealth, flows on, being purified,

original: patirviśvasya bhūmano vyakhyad rodasī ubhe
analyzed: patiḥ viśvasya bhūmanaḥ vyakhyat rodasī ubhe
translated: The Lord of all the people, he hath filled both the worlds with light.

original: samu priyā anūṣata gāvo madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ
analyzed: samu priyāḥ anūṣata gāvaḥ madāya ghṛṣvayaḥ
translated: The dear ones have sung forth together: the cows have lowed to the joyous one.

original: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsa indavaḥ
analyzed: somāsaḥ kṛṇvate pathaḥ pavamānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The Somas, the drops, purifying, make the paths flow on.

original: ya ojiṣṭhastamā bhara pavamana śravāyyam
analyzed: yaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ tam ā bhara pavamana śravāyyam
translated: Bring us the most powerful one, O Pavamana, worthy of fame,

original: yaḥ pañcacarṣaṇīrabhi rayiṃ yena vanāmahai🔽somāḥ pavanta indavo 'smabhyaṃ gātuvittamaḥ

translated: By whom we may conquer the wealth of the five peoples.🔽The Soma juices are purified, best able to give us a way.

original: mitrāḥ suvānā arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svarvidaḥ🔽suṣvāṇāso vyadribhiścitānā goradhi tvaci
analyzed: mitrāḥ suvānāḥ arepasaḥ svādhyaḥ svar vidaḥ  suṣvāṇāsaḥ vyadribhiḥ citānāḥ goḥ adhi tvaci

original: iṣamasmabhyamabhitaḥ samasvaran vasuvidaḥ
analyzed: iṣam asmabhyam abhitas samasvaran vasu vidaḥ
translated: Well-swung, marked by the mountains, on the skin of the cow,🔽Have resounded around for food for us, finders of treasure.

analyzed: ete pūtāḥ vipaścitaḥ somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: These purified wise ones, the Soma juices, with curds on their heads,

original: sūryāso na darśatāso jigatnavo dhruvā ghṛte
analyzed: sūryāsaḥ na darśatāsaḥ jigatnavaḥ dhruvāḥ ghṛte
translated: Like suns, like those to be seen, striving, firm in ghee,

original: pra sunvānasyāndhaso marto na vṛta tad vacaḥ
analyzed: pra sunvānasya andhasaḥ martaḥ na vṛta tat vacaḥ

analyzed: sarat jāraḥ na yoṣaṇām varaḥ na yonim āsadam

translated: That hero, the fulfiller of strength, who has propped up the two worlds,🔽The golden one has sat down on the filter, the creator on the seat.

original: avyo vārebhiḥ pavate somo gavye adhi tvaci
analyzed: avyaḥ vārebhiḥ pavate somaḥ gavye adhi tvaci
translated: Soma is purified with the vessels on the skin of the cow,

analyzed: viśvā apari priyā bhuvat adha dvitā

original: upa tritasya pāṣyorabhakta yad guhā padam
analyzed: upa tritasya pāṣyoḥ abhakta yat guhā padam

analyzed: yajñasya sapta dhāmabhiḥ adha priyam

translated: With Trita's support he has extended wealth over the backs (of the people).

original: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ
analyzed: mimīte asya yojanā vi sukratuḥ
translated: His wise one measures out his course.

original: jajñānaṃ sapta mātaro vedhāmaśāsata śriye
analyzed: jajñānam sapta mātaraḥ vedhām aśāsata śriye
translated: The seven mothers have instructed the unborn Vedhā for glory.

original: ayaṃ dhruvo rayīṇāṃ ciketa yat
analyzed: ayam dhruvaḥ rayīṇām ciketa yat
translated: This one has thought out the firm ones of riches, what

original: asya vrate sajoṣaso viśve devāso adruhaḥ
analyzed: asya vrate sajoṣasaḥ viśve devāsaḥ adruhaḥ
translated: In his rule, the all-agreeing gods, the guileless ones,

analyzed: spārhāḥ bhavanti rantayaḥ juṣanta yat  yamī garbham ṛtāvṛdhaḥ dṛśe cārum ajījanan

analyzed: kavim maṃhiṣṭham adhvare puruspṛham  samīcīne abhi tmanā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: The most bountiful sage at the sacrifice, who is desired by many,🔽The two young mothers of truth, in unison,

original: tanvānā yajñamānuṣag yadañjate
analyzed: tanvānāḥ yajña mānuṣak yat añjate
translated: Weaving together, as they anoint themselves, for the sake of the sacrifice.

original: kratvā śukrebhirakṣabhirṛṇorapa vrajaṃ divaḥ
analyzed: kratvā śukrebhiḥ akṣabhiḥ ṛṇoḥ apa vrajam divaḥ

original: hinvannṛtasya dīdhitiṃ prādhvare
analyzed: hinvan ṛtasya dīdhitim pra adhvare
translated: Impelling the light of truth, at the sacrifice,

original: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vaca udyatam
analyzed: pra punānāya vedhase somāya vacaḥ udyatam

original: bhṛtiṃ na bharā matibhirjujoṣate
analyzed: bhṛtim na bharā matibhiḥ jujoṣate

original: pari vārāṇyavyayā gobhirañjāno arṣati
analyzed: pari vārāṇi avyayā gobhiḥ añjānaḥ arṣati

analyzed: trī sadhasthā punānaḥ kṛṇute hariḥ

original: pari kośaṃ madhuścutamavyaye vāre arṣati
analyzed: pari kośam madhuścutam avyaye vāre arṣati
translated: He flows into the unchanging vessel, the vat that drips with honey

original: abhi vāṇīrṛṣīṇāṃ sapta nūṣata🔽pari ṇetā matīnāṃ viśvadevo adābhyaḥ
analyzed: abhi vāṇīḥ ṛṣīṇām sapta nūṣata  pari netā matīnām viśva devaḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The seven voices of the seers call to him🔽The all-god, the infallible, the leader of thoughts

original: somaḥ punānaścamvorviśad dhariḥ
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ camvoḥ viśat hariḥ
translated: Soma, purified, has entered the bowls, the golden one

original: pari daivīranu svadhā indreṇa yāhi saratham
analyzed: pari daivīḥ anu svadhāḥ indreṇa yāhi sa ratham
translated: Go with Indra in your chariot along the divine ways, following your own nature

original: punāno vāghad vāghadbhiramartyaḥ
analyzed: punānaḥ vāghat vāghadbhiḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Purified, immortal, by the pressers

original: pari saptirna vājayurdevo devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: pari saptiḥ na vājayuḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ sutaḥ
translated: Like a swift steed, eager for strength, the god, pressed,

original: vyānaśiḥ pavamāno vi dhāvati🔽sakhāya ā ni śīdata punānāya pra gāyata
analyzed: vyānaśiḥ pavamānaḥ vi dhāvati  sakhāyaḥ ā ni śīdata punānāya pra gāyata
translated: The purifier flows along, the all-knower🔽Sit down, O friends, and sing to the one who is being purified

original: śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye
analyzed: śiśum na yajñaiḥ pari bhūṣata śriye
translated: Adorn the child with sacrifices for his glory

original: samī vatsaṃ na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā gayasādhanam
analyzed: samī vatsam na mātṛbhiḥ sṛjatā gaya sādhanam
translated: Let him be loosed like a calf to its mother, the one who brings gain

original: devāvyammadamabhi dviśavasam
analyzed: devāvyam madam abhi dvi śavasam
translated: The intoxicating drink of the gods, the one with two powers

original: punātā dakṣasādhanaṃ yathā śardhāya vītaye
analyzed: punāta dakṣa sādhanam yathā śardhāya vītaye
translated: Purify the one who brings skill, as for the Maruts' banquet

original: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ🔽asmabhyaṃ tvā vasuvidamabhi vāṇīranūṣata
analyzed: yathā mitrāya varuṇāya śantamaḥ  asmabhyam tvā vasu vidam abhi vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: As for Mitra and Varuna, the most pleasing🔽We have sung to you, O finder of treasure, with our voices

original: gobhiṣ ṭe varṇamabhi vāsayāmasi
analyzed: gobhiḥ te varṇam abhi vāsayāmasi
translated: We clothe your color with cows

original: sa no madānāṃ pata indo devapsarā asi
analyzed: sa naḥ madānām pate indo deva psarāḥ asi
translated: O Indu, you are the lord of our delights, the one who delights the gods for us

original: sakheva sakhye gātuvittamo bhava
analyzed: sakhā iva sakhye gātu vittamaḥ bhava
translated: Be most skilful in finding a way for the friend in the friend,

original: sanemi kṛdhyasmadā rakṣasaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam
analyzed: sanemi kṛdhī asmadā rakṣasam kam cit atriṇam
translated: Be thou a protector to us, ward off every Raksas here, every devourer.

original: apādevaṃ dvayumaṃho yuyodhi naḥ
analyzed: dvayum aṃhaḥ yuyodhi naḥ
translated: Keep far from us the Dasyu's hate.

original: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyo madāya punānamabhi gāyata🔽śiśuṃ na yajñaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ
analyzed: tam vaḥ sakhāyaḥ madāya punānam abhi gāyata  śiśum na yajñaiḥ svadayanta gūrtibhiḥ
translated: Sing ye to him, O friends, as he is purified for your delight,🔽As with sacrifices and praises they gladden the child.

original: saṃ vatsa iva mātṛbhirindurhinvāno ajyate
analyzed: sam vatsaḥ iva mātṛbhiḥ induḥ hinvānaḥ ajyate
translated: Like a calf with its mothers, Indu is urged on and made to move,

original: devāvīrmadomatibhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: Purified by the thoughts of the two divine ones.

original: ayaṃ dakṣāya sādhano 'yaṃ śardhāya vītaye
analyzed: ayam dakṣāya sādhanaḥ yam śardhāya vītaye
translated: This is the means of power for you, O friends, this is for the band to enjoy,

original: ayaṃ devebhyo madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: ayam devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ sutaḥ
translated: This is the sweetest of the juices pressed for the gods.

original: goman na indo aśvavat sutaḥ sudakṣa dhanva
analyzed: gomat naḥ indo aśvavat sutaḥ su dakṣa dhanva
translated: O Indu, pressed with milk and horses, pressed with good skill,

original: śuciṃ te varṇamadhi goṣu dīdharam
analyzed: śucim te varṇam adhi goṣu dīdharam
translated: I will place thy pure hue upon the cows.

original: sa no harīṇāṃ pata indo devapsarastamaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ harīṇām pate indo deva psarastamaḥ
translated: O thou who art the lord of the tawny ones, O Indu, most divine of the gods' food,

original: sakheva sakhye naryo ruce bhava
analyzed: sakhā iva sakhye naryaḥ ruce bhava
translated: Be thou to us, O man, as a friend to his friend, for joy.

original: sanemi tvamasmadānadevaṃ kaṃ cidatriṇam
analyzed: sanemi tvam asmad ānadevam kam cit atriṇam
translated: Keep far from us every godless devourer here.

original: sāhvānindo pari bādho apa dvayum
analyzed: sāhvā anindo pari bādhaḥ apa dvayum
translated: O Indu, drive away the Dasyu with thy shout.

original: indramacha sutā ime vṛṣaṇaṃ yantu harayaḥ
analyzed: indram acha sutāḥ ime vṛṣaṇam yantu harayaḥ
translated: Let these tawny coursers go to the mighty Indra, to whom the pressed (juices) belong.

original: śruṣṭī jātāsa indavaḥ svarvidaḥ
analyzed: śruṣṭī jātāsaḥ indavaḥ svar vidaḥ
translated: The drops, born for hearing, have been produced, the finders of the heaven.

original: ayaṃ bharāya sānasirindrāya pavate sutaḥ
analyzed: ayam bharāya sānasiḥ indrāya pavate sutaḥ
translated: This one, the son of Sâna, is pressed for bearing, pressed for Indra,

original: somo jaitrasyacetati yathā vide🔽asyedindro madeṣvā grābhaṃ gṛbhṇīta sānasim
analyzed: somaḥ jaitrasya cetati yathā vide  asya id indraḥ mada iṣvā grābham gṛbhṇīta sānasim
translated: Soma knows the victorious one as he knows himself🔽In his (Soma's) rapture may Indra grasp the booty that is to be gained

original: vajraṃca vṛṣaṇaṃ bharat samapsujit
analyzed: vajraṃca vṛṣaṇam bharat sam apsujit
translated: And bring the strong thunderbolt, the conqueror of waters

original: pra dhanvā soma jāgṛvirindrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: pra dhanva soma jāgṛviḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: O Soma, flow on, watchful, to Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: dyumantaṃ śuṣmamā bharā svarvidam
analyzed: dyumantam śuṣmam ā bhara svar vidam
translated: Bring the glorious strength that finds the light

original: indrāya vṛṣaṇaṃ madaṃ pavasva viśvadarśataḥ
analyzed: indrāya vṛṣaṇam madam pavasva viśva darśataḥ
translated: Flow on, O thou who art seen by all, as a strong drink for Indra

original: sahasrayāmā pathikṛd vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: sahasra yāmā pathikṛt vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The thousand-wayed, the path-maker, the discerning one

original: asmabhyaṃ gātuvittamo devebhyo madhumattamaḥ
analyzed: asmabhyam gātu vittamaḥ devebhyaḥ madhumattamaḥ
translated: Most bountiful to us, most rich in honey to the gods

original: sahasraṃ yāhipathibhiḥ kanikradat
analyzed: sahasram yāhi pathibhiḥ kanikradat
translated: Roaring, he goes with a thousand paths

original: pavasva devavītaya indo dhārābhirojasā
analyzed: pavasva deva vītaye indo dhārābhiḥ ojasā
translated: Flow on, O Indu, for the feast of the gods, with streams of strength

original: ā kalaśaṃ madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ
analyzed: ā kalaśam madhumān soma naḥ sadaḥ
translated: O Soma, be sweet with honey in our vessel

original: tava drapsā udapruta indraṃ madāya vāvṛdhuḥ
analyzed: tava drapsāḥ uda prutaḥ indram madāya vāvṛdhuḥ
translated: Thy drops, O thou who art sped forward by the waters, have made Indra grow for the rapture (of drinking)

original: tvāṃ devāso amṛtāya kaṃ papuḥ
analyzed: tvām devāsaḥ amṛtāya kam papuḥ
translated: The gods have drunk thee for immortality

original: ā naḥ sutāsa indavaḥ punānā dhāvatā rayim🔽vṛṣṭidyāvorītyāpaḥ svarvidaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ sutāsaḥ indavaḥ punānāḥ dhāvata rayim  svar vidaḥ
translated: Our pressed Soma juices, being purified, run forward, bestowing wealth🔽The waters that rain rain, that find the light

original: somaḥ punāna ūrmiṇāvyo vāraṃ vi dhāvati
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ ūrmiṇā avyaḥ vāram vi dhāvati
translated: Soma, being purified, flows over the fleece with waves

original: agre vācaḥpavamānaḥ kanikradat
analyzed: agre vācaḥpavamānaḥ kanikradat
translated: Pavamana, roaring, is in front of the voices

original: dhībhirhinvanti vājinaṃ vane krīḷantamatyavim
analyzed: dhībhiḥ hinvanti vājinam vane krīḍantam atyavim
translated: With thoughts they urge the strong one who sports in the wood, the ram

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaṃ matayaḥ samasvaran
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭham matayaḥ samasvaran
translated: The hymns have resounded to the three-backed one

original: asarji kalaśānabhi mīḷhe saptirna vājayuḥ
analyzed: asarji kalaśān abhi mīḍhe saptiḥ na vājayuḥ
translated: The swift one has been sent forth to the pressing-stones, like a horse eager for the prize

original: punāno vācaṃ janayannasiṣyadat🔽pavate haryato harirati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā
analyzed: punānaḥ vācam janayan asiṣyadat  pavate haryataḥ hariḥ ati hvarāṃsi raṃhyā
translated: Purifying, generating speech, he has flowed forth🔽The tawny one flows along the ridges, the tawny one swiftly

original: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyo vīravad yaśaḥ
analyzed: abhyarṣan stotṛbhyaḥ vīravat yaśaḥ
translated: Flowing to the praisers, (grant) heroic fame

original: ayā pavasva devayurmadhordhārā asṛkṣata
analyzed: ayā pavasva devayuḥ madhoḥ dhārāḥ asṛkṣata
translated: Flowing, O god-adoring one, the streams of honey have flowed forth

original: rebhan pavitramparyeṣi viśvataḥ🔽parīto ṣiñcatā sutaṃ somo ya uttamaṃ haviḥ
analyzed: rebhan pavitram paryeṣi viśvatas  pari itas siñcata sutam somaḥ yaḥ uttamam haviḥ
translated: You go around the filter, singing, from all sides🔽Pour around the pressed (Soma), the Soma which is the best oblation

original: dadhanvānyo naryo apsvantarā suṣāva somamadribhiḥ🔽nūnaṃ punāno 'vibhiḥ pari sravādabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ🔽sute cit tvāpsu madāmo andhasā śrīṇanto gobhiruttaram
analyzed: dadhanva anyaḥ naryaḥ apsu antarā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ  nūnam punānaḥ vibhiḥ pari srava adabdhaḥ surabhintaraḥ  sute cit tvā apsu madāmaḥ andhasā śrīṇantaḥ gobhiḥ uttaram
translated: He who has flowed through the waters, the man, has pressed out Soma with the stones🔽Now, being purified, flow around with the sheep, more fragrant than the sea🔽Even when pressed, we delight in thee in the waters, in the juice, preparing the highest (oblation) with milk

original: pari suvānaścakṣase devamādanaḥ kraturindurvicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: pari suvānaḥ cakṣase deva mādanaḥ kratuḥ induḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Thou, being pressed, lookest around, delighting the gods, the wise Indu is the sacrifice

original: punānaḥ soma dhārayāpo vasāno arṣasi🔽ā ratnadhā yonimṛtasya sīdasyutso deva hiraṇyayaḥ
analyzed: punānaḥ soma dhārayā apaḥ vasānaḥ arṣasi  ā ratna dhāḥ yoni mṛtasya sīdasi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: O Soma, being purified, thou flowest along the stream, clothed in the waters🔽Thou sittest down in the abode of the treasure of the atmosphere, O god, the golden one

original: duhāna ūdhardivyaṃ madhu priyaṃ pratnaṃ sadhasthamāsadat
analyzed: duhānaḥ ūdhar divyam madhu priyam pratnam sadhastham āsadat
translated: Milking the heavenly, dear honey, he has sat down in the ancient abode

original: āpṛchyaṃ dharuṇaṃ vājyarṣati nṛbhirdhūto vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: āpṛchyam dharuṇam vājī arṣati nṛbhiḥ dhūtaḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: The strong one, to be invoked, flows on, purified by men, the all-seeing one

original: punānaḥ soma jāgṛviravyo vāre pari priyaḥ
analyzed: punānaḥ soma jāgṛviḥ avyaḥ vāre pari priyaḥ
translated: Purified, O Soma, watchful, dear in the wool, O you who are to be invoked

original: tvaṃ viproabhavo 'ṅgirastamo madhvā yajñaṃ mimikṣa naḥ
analyzed: tvam vipraḥ abhavaḥ ṅgirastamaḥ madhvā yajñam mimikṣa naḥ
translated: You have become the most Angiras-like sage; mix our sacrifice with sweetness

original: somo mīḍhvān pavate gātuvittama ṛṣirvipro vicakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: somaḥ mīḍhvān pavate gātu vittamaḥ ṛṣiḥ vipraḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Soma, the bountiful one, flows, best at finding a way, a sage, a priest, the all-seeing one

original: tvaṃ kavirabhavo devavītama ā sūryaṃ rohayo divi
analyzed: tvam kaviḥ abhavaḥ deva vītamaḥ ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: You have become the sage at the god's feast; you raise the sun to the sky

original: soma u ṣuvāṇaḥ sotṛbhiradhi ṣṇubhiravīnām
analyzed: somaḥ u suvānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ adhi snubhiḥ avīnām
translated: Soma, the impeller, is pressed by the pressers with the swift ones, the swift ones

original: aśvayevaharita yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā
analyzed: yāti dhārayā mandrayā yāti dhārayā
translated: He goes with a stream like a horse, with a pleasant stream, he goes with a stream

original: anūpe gomān gobhirakṣāḥ somo dugdhābhirakṣāḥ
analyzed: anūpe gomān gobhirakṣāḥ somaḥ dugdha abhirakṣāḥ
translated: In the marsh, rich in cows, Soma is protected by the milch cows, is protected

original: samudraṃ na saṃvaraṇānyagman mandī madāya tośate
analyzed: samudram na saṃvaraṇāni agman mandī madāya tośate
translated: They have reached the ocean, the enclosures, the one who delights for joy

original: ā soma suvāno adribhistiro vārāṇyavyayā
analyzed: ā soma suvānaḥ adribhiḥ tiras vārāṇi avyayā
translated: O Soma, being pressed with the stones, through the woolen filters, the unbreakable ones

original: jano na puri camvorviśad dhariḥ sado vaneṣu dadhiṣe🔽sa māmṛje tiro aṇvāni meṣyo mīḷhe saptirna vajayuḥ
analyzed: janaḥ na puri camvoḥ viśat hariḥ sadaḥ vaneṣu dadhiṣe  sa māmṛje tiras aṇvāni meṣyaḥ mīḍhe saptiḥ na vajayuḥ
translated: The bay one has entered the bowls, like a man in the city; in the woods you have established your seat🔽He has been chosen, to be desired by me, to be desired in the assembly, like a swift horse

original: anumādyaḥ pavamāno manīṣibhiḥ somo viprebhirṛkvabhiḥ
analyzed: anumādyaḥ pavamānaḥ manīṣibhiḥ somaḥ viprebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: To be praised by the wise, Soma is to be praised by the sages, by the reciters of hymns

original: pra soma devavītaye sindhurna pipye arṇasā aṃśoḥ payasāmadiro na jāgṛvirachā kośaṃ madhuścutam
analyzed: pra soma deva vītaye sindhuḥ na pipye arṇasā aṃśoḥ payasā madiraḥ na jāgṛviḥ acha kośam madhuścutam
translated: O Soma, be thou pressed for the feast of the gods, like a river with its waves, like a gladdening drink from the milk of the share, like a watchful one, enter the vat that drips with honey.

original: ā haryato arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnurna marjyaḥ
analyzed: ā haryataḥ arjune atke avyata priyaḥ sūnuḥ na marjyaḥ
translated: The tawny one is stretched on the felt of the brown one, dear, to be anointed, like a son.

original: tamīṃ hinvantyapaso yathā rathaṃ nadīṣvā gabhastyoḥ
analyzed: tamīm hinvanti apasaḥ yathā ratham nadīṣva ā gabhastyoḥ
translated: The priests impel him like a chariot, in the two arms of the river.

original: abhi somāsa āyavaḥ pavante madyaṃ madam🔽samudrasyādhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇo matsarāsaḥ svarvidaḥ
analyzed: abhi somāsaḥ āyavaḥ pavante madyam madam  samudrasya adhi viṣṭapi manīṣiṇaḥ matsarāsaḥ svar vidaḥ
translated: The living Soma juices are purified, flowing to the gladdening drink.🔽In the wide abode of the ocean, the wise ones, the joyous ones, find the heavenly light.

original: tarat samudraṃ pavamāna ūrmiṇā rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat
analyzed: tarat samudram pavamānaḥ ūrmiṇā rājā devaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: The Pavamana crosses the ocean with its wave, the king, the god, the great rite.

original: arṣan mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvāna ṛtaṃ bṛhat
analyzed: arṣat mitrasya varuṇasya dharmaṇā pra hinvānaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: Flowing with the law of Mitra and Varuna, impelling the great rite.

original: nṛbhiryemāno haryato vicakṣaṇo rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ haryataḥ vicakṣaṇaḥ rājā devaḥ samudriyaḥ
translated: The tawny one, the all-seeing one, the god, the king of the ocean, is led by men.

original: indrāya pavate madaḥ somo marutvate sutaḥ
analyzed: indrāya pavate madaḥ somaḥ marutvate sutaḥ
translated: The joy is purified for Indra, Soma is pressed for him, accompanied by the Maruts.

original: sahasradhāro atyavyamarṣati tamīṃ mṛjantyāyavaḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ tamīm mṛjanti āyavaḥ
translated: The one with a thousand streams, the swift one, flows, the wise ones purify him.

original: punānaścamū janayan matiṃ kaviḥ somo deveṣu raṇyati
analyzed: punānaḥ camū janayan matim kaviḥ somaḥ deveṣu raṇyati
translated: Purifying the vessel, generating thought, the wise Soma delights among the gods.

original: apo vasānaḥ pari gobhiruttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣvavyata
analyzed: apaḥ vasānaḥ pari gobhiḥ uttaraḥ sīdan vaneṣu avyata
translated: Clad in waters, surrounded by cows, the northern one, seated in the woods, is purified.

original: tavāhaṃ soma rāraṇa sakhya indo divedive
analyzed: tava aham soma rāraṇa sakhye indo dive dive
translated: O Soma, I delight in your friendship, O Indu, day by day.

original: purūṇi babhro ni caranti māmava paridhīnrati tānihi
analyzed: purūṇi babhro ni caranti mām ava paridhīn rati tānihi
translated: O many-hued one, they move around, they spread out, O Bṛhaspati, drive them away!

original: utāhaṃ naktamuta soma te divā sakhyāya babhra ūdhani
analyzed: uta aham naktam uta soma te divā sakhyāya babhro ūdhani
translated: And I, O Soma, by night and by day, O tawny one, on your udder, for friendship,

original: ghṛṇā tapantamati sūryaṃ paraḥ śakunā iva paptima
analyzed: ghṛṇā tapantam ati sūryam paras śakunāḥ iva paptima
translated: I fly away, like birds, beyond the sun, burning with heat, with ghee.

original: mṛjyamānaḥ suhastya samudre vācaminvasi
analyzed: mṛjyamānaḥ su hastya samudre vācam invasi
translated: Being cleansed, O well-handed one, you send forth your voice over the ocean,

original: rayiṃ piśangaṃ bahulaṃ puruspṛhaṃ pavamānābhyarṣasi
analyzed: rayim piśangam bahulam puruspṛham pavamāna abhyarṣasi
translated: You, being purified, pour forth wealth, tawny, abundant, desired by many,

original: mṛjāno vāre pavamano avyaye vṛṣāva cakrado vane
analyzed: mṛjānaḥ vāre pavamanaḥ avyaye vṛṣā ava cakradaḥ vane
translated: Being cleansed, O Pavamāna, in the spotless sieve, O bull, in the forest,

original: devānāṃ soma pavamāna niṣkṛtaṃ gobhirañjāno arṣasi
analyzed: devānām soma pavamāna niṣkṛtam gobhiḥ añjānaḥ arṣasi
translated: O Soma, being purified, you flow, O god, with milk, to the rite of the gods.

original: pavasva vājasātaye 'bhi viśvāni kāvyā🔽tvaṃ samudraṃ prathamo vi dhārayo devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ
analyzed: pavasva vājasātaye bhi viśvāni kāvyā  tvam samudram prathamaḥ vi dhārayaḥ devebhyaḥ soma matsaraḥ
translated: Flow for the sake of gaining strength, to all the treasures of the wise.🔽You, O Soma, first set in motion the ocean, the inspirer of the gods, for the gods.

original: sa tū pavasva pari pārthivaṃ rajo divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ
analyzed: sa tu pavasva pari pārthivam rajaḥ divyā ca soma dharmabhiḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, around the earthly realm, and through the heavenly realms, O Soma, with your powers.

original: tvāṃ viprāso matibhirvicakṣaṇa śubhraṃ hinvanti dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: tvām viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ vicakṣaṇa śubhram hinvanti dhītibhiḥ
translated: You, O all-seeing one, the sages impel with their thoughts, with their hymns, the bright one.

original: pavamānā asṛkṣata pavitramati dhārayā
analyzed: pavamānāḥ asṛkṣata pavitramati dhārayā
translated: The purifiers have flowed forth with a stream over the purifying sieve,

original: marutvanto matsarā indriyā hayā medhāmabhi prayāṃsi ca
analyzed: marutvantaḥ matsarāḥ indriyāḥ hayāḥ medhām abhi prayāṃsi ca
translated: The impetuous ones accompanied by the Maruts, the horses of Indra, to the sacrificial essence and to the offerings.

original: apo vasānaḥ pari kośamarṣatindurhiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ
analyzed: apaḥ vasānaḥ pari kośa marṣa tinduḥ hiyānaḥ sotṛbhiḥ
translated: Wearing the waters, he moves around the vat, hard to be overcome by the pressers

original: janayañ jyotirmandanā avīvaśad gāḥ kṛṇvāno na nirṇijam
analyzed: janayam jyotiḥ mandanāḥ avīvaśat gāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ na nirṇijam
translated: Generating light, he has shone forth, making the cows, as it were, his garment

original: pavasva madhumattama indrāya soma kratuvittamo madaḥ
analyzed: pavasva madhumattamaḥ indrāya soma kratu vittamaḥ madaḥ
translated: Flow on, O most rich in sweets, as Soma, O Indu, as the most wise exhilarating drink

original: mahi dyukṣatamo madaḥ
analyzed: mahi dyukṣatamaḥ madaḥ
translated: As the most heavenly exhilarating drink

original: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabho vṛṣāyate 'sya pītā svarvidaḥ
analyzed: yasya te pītvā vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣāyate sya pītā svar vidaḥ
translated: By drinking which the bull becomes a bull, by drinking which he finds the light

original: sa supraketo abhyakramīdiśo 'chā vājaṃ naitaśaḥ
analyzed: sa su praketaḥ abhyakramīt iśaḥ chā vājam na etaśaḥ
translated: He, well-directed, has gone forth to the quarters, like a horse to be won

original: tvaṃ hyanga daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi anga daivyā pavamāna janimāni dyumattamaḥ
translated: For you, indeed, O Pavamana, divine, are the most glorious births

original: amṛtatvāya ghoṣayaḥ
analyzed: amṛta tvāya ghoṣayaḥ
translated: For immortality, you proclaim

original: yenā navagvo dadhyannaporṇute yena viprāsa āpire
analyzed: yena navagvaḥ dadhi an aporṇute yena viprāsaḥ āpire
translated: By which the Navagva praises the waters, by which the sages have come

original: devānāṃ sumne amṛtasya cāruṇo yena śravāṃsyānaśuḥ
analyzed: devānām sumne amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ yena śravāṃsi ānaśuḥ
translated: In the bliss of the gods, the beautiful of immortality, by which they have attained fame

original: eṣa sya dhārayā suto 'vyo vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ
analyzed: eṣa sya dhārayā sutaḥ vyaḥ vārebhiḥ pavate madintamaḥ
translated: This one, poured out with its stream, is purified with woolen cloths, the most exhilarating

original: krīḷannūrmirapāmiva
analyzed: krīḍan ūrmiḥ apām iva
translated: Playing like a wave of the waters

original: ya usriyā apyā antaraśmano nirgā akṛntadojasā
analyzed: yaḥ usriyāḥ apyāḥ antar aśmanaḥ nirgāḥ akṛntat ojasā
translated: He who with might has cut out the cows that were hidden in the rocks

original: abhivrajaṃ tatniṣe gavyamaśvyaṃ varmīva dhṛṣṇavā ruja
analyzed: abhivrajam tatniṣe gavyam aśvyam varmī iva dhṛṣṇavā ruja
translated: He has kindled the approaching (cow) for the sake of the cow and the horse, like a warrior eager for victory

original: ā sotā pari ṣiñcatāśvaṃ na stomamapturaṃ rajasturam
analyzed: ā sotā pari siñcata aśvam na stomam apturam rajasturam
translated: Let the pressers pour him in, the horse, the praise, the swift in the air,

original: vanaṛkṣamudaprutam
analyzed: vana ṛkṣam uda prutam
translated: The wild boar, the swift in the water

original: sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ payovṛdhaṃ priyaṃ devāya janmane
analyzed: sahasra dhāram vṛṣabham payaḥ vṛdham priyam devāya janmane
translated: The thousand-streamed bull, increaser of milk, dear to the race of gods

original: ṛtena ya ṛtajāto vivāvṛdhe rājā deva ṛtaṃ bṛhat
analyzed: ṛtena yaḥ ṛta jātaḥ vivāvṛdhe rājā devaḥ ṛtam bṛhat
translated: He who by truth, born of truth, has grown great, the king, the god, the great truth

original: abhi dyumnaṃ bṛhad yaśa iṣas pate didīhi deva devayuḥ
analyzed: abhi dyumnam bṛhat yaśaḥ iṣaḥ pate didīhi deva devayuḥ
translated: O lord of food, shine forth with great glory and splendor, O god, for the worshipper

original: vikośaṃ madhyamaṃ yuva🔽ā vacyasva sudakṣa camvoḥ suto viśāṃ vahnirna viśpatiḥ
analyzed: vi kośam madhyamam yuva  ā vacyasva su dakṣa camvoḥ sutaḥ viśām vahniḥ na viśpatiḥ
translated: Open the middle one, the sheath🔽Be pressed, O very skilful one, in the bowls, as the fire, the lord of the people, is carried by the people

original: vṛṣṭiṃ divaḥ pavasva rītimapāṃ jinvā gaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṭim divaḥ pavasva rītim apām jinva gaviṣṭaye dhiyaḥ
translated: Flow on, O god, from the sky, with the stream of the waters, stimulate the thoughts for the winning of the cow

original: etamu tyaṃ madacyutaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ divo duhuḥ
analyzed: etam u tyam mada cyutam sahasra dhāram vṛṣabham divaḥ duhuḥ
translated: They have milked that bull, the gladdener, of a thousand streams, from the sky

original: viśvā vasūni bibhratam
analyzed: viśvā vasūni bibhratam
translated: Bearing all treasures

original: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayannamartyaḥ pratapañ jyotiṣā tamaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā vi jajñe janayan amartyaḥ pratapam jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: The bull was born, begetting, the immortal, burning away the darkness with his light

original: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhirnirṇijaṃ dadhe tridhātvasya daṃsasā
analyzed: sa suṣṭutaḥ kavibhiḥ nirṇijam dadhe tri dhātvasya daṃsasā
translated: He, well praised by the sages, has put on his radiant garment, with the gift of the three-formed one

original: sa sunve yo vasūnāṃ yo rāyāmānetā ya iḷānām
analyzed: sa sunve yaḥ vasūnām yaḥ rāyām ānetā yaḥ iḷānām
translated: He is to be pressed, who is of the treasures, who is of the wealth, who is of the food

original: somoyaḥ sukṣitīnām
analyzed: somaḥ ūyaḥ su kṣitīnām
translated: Soma, who is of the well-governed

original: yasya na indraḥ pibād yasya maruto yasya vāryamaṇā bhagaḥ
analyzed: yasya naḥ indraḥ pibāt yasya marutaḥ yasya vā aryamaṇā bhagaḥ
translated: Whose (Soma) Indra may drink, whose the Maruts, whose the bounteous Bhaga

original: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmaha endramavase mahe
analyzed: ā yena mitrāvaruṇā karāmahe ā indram avase mahe
translated: By whom we may approach Mitra and Varuna, Indra for help, for greatness

original: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhiryataḥ svāyudho madintamaḥ
analyzed: indrāya soma pātave nṛbhiḥ yataḥ su āyudhaḥ madintamaḥ
translated: For Indra, O Soma, to drink, urged on by the men, the best gladdener, with his own weapon

original: pavasva madhumattamaḥ
analyzed: pavasva madhumattamaḥ
translated: Flow as the sweetest of the sweet

original: indrasya hārdi somadhānamā viśa samudramiva sindhavaḥ
analyzed: indrasya hārdi soma dhānam ā viśa samudram iva sindhavaḥ
translated: Into the heart of Indra, O Soma, into the reservoir, as the rivers into the ocean.

original: juṣṭo mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divo viṣṭambha uttamaḥ
analyzed: juṣṭaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vāyave divaḥ viṣṭambhaḥ uttamaḥ
translated: Beloved by Mitra, Varuṇa, and Vāyu, the highest support of the sky,

original: pari pra dhanvendrāya soma svādur mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya
analyzed: pari pra dhanva indrāya soma svāduḥ mitrāya pūṣṇe bhagāya
translated: Flowing forth, O Soma, sweet to Indra, to Mitra, to Pūṣan, to Bhaga.

original: indras te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
analyzed: indraḥ te soma sutasya peyāḥ kratve dakṣāya viśve ca devāḥ
translated: Indra is the drinker of thy Soma, O Soma, for wisdom and power, and all the gods.

original: evāmṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukro arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ🔽pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānāṃ viśvābhi dhāma
analyzed: eva amṛtāya mahe kṣayāya sa śukraḥ arṣa divyaḥ pīyūṣaḥ  pavasva soma mahān samudraḥ pitā devānām viśvā abhi dhāma
translated: So to the great abode of immortality, thou, O bright one, flowest as heavenly nectar.🔽Flow on, O Soma, as the great ocean, the father of the gods, to all the powers (of the world).

original: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śaṃ ca prajāyai
analyzed: śukraḥ pavasva devebhyaḥ soma dive pṛthivyai śam ca prajāyai
translated: Flow on, O bright Soma, for the gods, for heaven and earth, and for the welfare of offspring.

original: divo dhartāsi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva
analyzed: divaḥ dhartā asi śukraḥ pīyūṣaḥ satye vidharman vājī pavasva
translated: Thou art the supporter of the sky, the bright, the sweet, in true order, O strong one, flow on.

original: pavasva soma dyumnī sudhāro mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ
analyzed: pavasva soma dyumnī su dhāraḥ mahām avīnām anu pūrvyaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, as the brilliant one, the great, the leader of the mighty,

original: nṛbhir yemāno jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarad viśvāni mandraḥ svarvit🔽induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karad viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ jajñānaḥ pūtaḥ kṣarat viśvāni mandraḥ svar vid  induḥ punānaḥ prajām urāṇaḥ karat viśvāni draviṇāni naḥ
translated: Being born, being purified by men, being pressed, the delightful one, finding the light.🔽The moon, being purified, having created offspring, will give us all kinds of wealth.

original: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāyāśvo na nikto vājī dhanāya
analyzed: pavasva soma kratve dakṣāya aśvaḥ na niktaḥ vājī dhanāya
translated: Flow on, O Soma, for wisdom and power, like a bathed horse, a strong steed, for the prize.

original: taṃ te sotāro rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya
analyzed: tam te sotāraḥ rasam madāya punanti somam mahe dyumnāya
translated: Your pressers purify that juice for your rapture, the Soma for great glory.

original: śiśuṃ jajñānaṃ harim mṛjanti pavitre somaṃ devebhya indum
analyzed: śiśum jajñānam harim mṛjanti pavitre somam devebhyaḥ indum
translated: They cleanse the tawny child, the newly-born, the Soma, the drop, on the purifying filter, for the gods.

original: induḥ paviṣṭa cārur madāyāpām upasthe kavir bhagāya
analyzed: induḥ paviṣṭa cāruḥ madāya apām upasthe kaviḥ bhagāya
translated: The drop has entered, lovely for rapture, the wise one for Bhaga in the lap of the waters.

original: bibharti cārv indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna
analyzed: bibharti cāru indrasya nāma yena viśvāni vṛtrā jaghāna
translated: It bears the lovely name of Indra, by which he slew all the Vr̥itras.

original: pibanty asya viśve devāso gobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya🔽pra suvāno akṣāḥ sahasradhāras tiraḥ pavitraṃ vi vāram avyam
analyzed: pibanti asya viśve devāsaḥ gobhiḥ śrītasya nṛbhiḥ sutasya  pra suvānaḥ akṣār sahasra dhāraḥ tiras pavitram vi vāram avyam
translated: All the gods drink of him, of him who is made beautiful with milk, of him who is pressed by men.🔽Well-pressed, with a thousand streams, he goes through the filter, through the woollen cloth.

original: sa vājy akṣāḥ sahasraretā adbhir mṛjāno gobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ
analyzed: sa vājī akṣār sahasra retāḥ adbhiḥ mṛjānaḥ gobhiḥ śrīṇānaḥ
translated: He, the strong one, with a thousand powers, being cleansed with water, being made beautiful with milk,

original: pra soma yāhīndrasya kukṣā nṛbhir yemāno adribhiḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: pra soma yāhi indrasya kukṣā nṛbhiḥ yemānaḥ adribhiḥ sutaḥ
translated: Soma, go forward, O Soma, to Indra's belly, being pressed by men, urged on by the stones.

original: asarji vājī tiraḥ pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasradhāraḥ
analyzed: asarji vājī tiras pavitram indrāya somaḥ sahasra dhāraḥ
translated: The strong one has been sent forth through the filter, the Soma with a thousand streams, for Indra.

original: añjanty enam madhvo rasenendrāya vṛṣṇa indum madāya
analyzed: añjanti enam madhvaḥ rasena indrāya vṛṣṇe indum madāya
translated: They anoint him with the essence of honey, the drop, the tawny one, for Indra's rapture.

original: devebhyas tvā vṛthā pājase 'po vasānaṃ harim mṛjanti
analyzed: devebhyaḥ tvā vṛthā pājase po vasānam harim mṛjanti
translated: For the free-giving gods they cleanse the tawny one, clothed in the waters, for the sacrifice.

original: indur indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇann ugro riṇann apaḥ
analyzed: induḥ indrāya tośate ni tośate śrīṇan ugraḥ riṇan apaḥ
translated: The drop delights Indra, delights him, the strong one, pressing the waters, mixing them.

original: paryū ṣu pra dhanva vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vāja sātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
translated: To the pressing-boards do thou speed for the winning of booty, for the overcoming of foes

original: dviṣastaradhyā ṛṇayā na īyase
analyzed: dviṣaḥ taradhyai ṛṇayāḥ naḥ īyase
translated: Thou goest with debt to the enemies who are to be overcome

original: anu hi tvā sutaṃ soma madāmasi mahe samaryarājye
analyzed: anu hi tvā sutam soma madāmasi mahe samarya rājye
translated: For we, O Pavamâna, make thee glad with the pressed Soma, for the great sovereignty of the feast

original: vājānabhi pavamāna pra gāhase
analyzed: vājān abhi pavamāna pra gāhase
translated: Thou goest, O Pavamâna, to the treasures

original: ajījano hi pavamāna sūryaṃ vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ
analyzed: ajījanaḥ hi pavamāna sūryam vidhāre śakmanā payaḥ
translated: For thou, O Pavamâna, hast generated the Sun, the bearer of strength, the milk

original: gojīrayā raṃhamānaḥ purandhyā
analyzed: go jīrayā raṃhamānaḥ purandhyā
translated: With the swift course of the milch-cow, with the hymn

original: ajījano amṛta martyeṣvā ṛtasya dharmannamṛtasya cāruṇaḥ
analyzed: ajījanaḥ amṛta martyeṣvā ṛtasya dharman amṛtasya cāruṇaḥ
translated: Thou hast generated the immortal among mortals, the lovely one of holy order, of immortality

original: sadāsaro vājamachā saniṣyadat
analyzed: sadā saraḥ vājam achā saniṣyadat
translated: The ever-young one shall win the booty, the prize

original: abhyabhi hi śravasā tatardithotsaṃ na kaṃ cijjanapānamakṣitam
analyzed: abhi abhi hi śravasā tatarditha utsam na kam cit jana pānam akṣitam
translated: For thou hast filled full, as it were, a spring, an inexhaustible drinking-place for men

original: śaryābhirna bharamāṇo gabhastyoḥ
analyzed: śaryābhiḥ na bharamāṇaḥ gabhastyoḥ
translated: Bearing in thy arms the streams of milk

original: ādīṃ ke cit paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ vasuruco divyā abhyanūṣata
analyzed: ādīm ke cit paśyamānāsaḥ āpyam vasu rucaḥ divyāḥ abhyanūṣata
translated: Some have sung to thee, O God, the lovely hymns, the heavenly ones, the Vasus, looking on the light

original: vāraṃ na devaḥ savitā vyūrṇute
analyzed: vāram na devaḥ savitā vyūrṇute
translated: The God Savitar unbars the door

original: tve soma prathamā vṛktabarhiṣo mahe vājāya śravase dhiyandadhuḥ
analyzed: tve soma prathamāḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ mahe vājāya śravase dhiyan dadhuḥ
translated: O Soma, those who first spread out the sacred grass have set their thoughts on thee for great strength and glory

original: sa tvaṃ no vīra vīryāya codaya
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ vīra vīryāya codaya
translated: So do thou, O hero, impel us to manly strength

original: divaḥ pīyūṣaṃ pūrvyaṃ yadukthyaṃ maho gāhād diva āniradhukṣata
analyzed: divaḥ pīyūṣam pūrvyam yat ukthyam mahaḥ gāhāt divaḥ āniradhukṣata
translated: The heavenly food, the ancient, worthy of lauds, they have drawn from the great seizing of the sky

original: indramabhi jāyamānaṃ samasvaran
analyzed: indram abhi jāyamānam samasvaran
translated: They have all sung together to Indra as he was born

original: adha yadime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanābhi majmanā
analyzed: adha yat ime pavamāna rodasī imā ca viśvā bhuvanā abhi majmanā
translated: If, O Pavamâna, thou hast filled these two worlds, and all these living things, with thy surpassing might,

original: yūthe na niṣṭhā vṛṣabho vi tiṣṭhase
analyzed: yūthe na niṣṭhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vi tiṣṭhase
translated: Thou standest in the herd like a strong bull.

original: somaḥ punāno avyaye vāre śiśurna krīḷan pavamāno akṣāḥ
analyzed: somaḥ punānaḥ avyaye vāre śiśuḥ na krīḍan pavamānaḥ akṣār
translated: Soma, being purified in the fleecy cloth, O Pavamâna, like a sporting child,

original: sahasradhāraḥ śatavāja induḥ
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ śata vājaḥ induḥ
translated: Indu, with a thousand streams and a hundred powers,

original: eṣa punāno madhumān ṛtāvendrāyenduḥ pavate svādurūrmiḥ
analyzed: eṣa punānaḥ madhumān ṛtāvā indrāya induḥ pavate svāduḥ ūrmiḥ
translated: This Soma, being purified, flows on, sweet and gladdening, to Indra, the wave of meath,

original: vājasanirvarivovid vayodhāḥ
analyzed: vāja saniḥ varivaḥ vid vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Winning the prize, finding room, bestowing life.

original: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsyapa durgahāṇi
analyzed: sa pavasva sahamānaḥ pṛtanyūn sedhan rakṣāṃsi apa durgahāṇi
translated: Flowing, overcoming foes, drive off the Rakshas, and make our paths free from distress.

original: svāyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn
analyzed: su āyudhaḥ sāsahvān soma śatrūn
translated: O Soma, with thy weapon overcome our enemies.🔽This, purifying itself with tawny lustre, passes by its own path over all enmities, as the Sun by his own path.

original: ayā rucā hariṇyā punāno viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayugvabhiḥ sūro na svayugvabhiḥ dhārā sutasya rocate punāno aruṣo hariḥ
analyzed: ayā rucā hariṇyā punānaḥ viśvā dveṣāṃsi tarati svayugvabhiḥ sūraḥ na svayugvabhiḥ dhārā sutasya rocate punānaḥ aruṣaḥ hariḥ
translated: The stream of the juice shines forth, purifying itself, the red (liquid) the tawny one,

original: viśvā yad rūpā pariyāty ṛkvabhiḥ saptāsyebhirṛkvabhiḥ
analyzed: viśvā yat rūpā pariyāti ṛkvabhiḥ sapta āsyebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: When it passes through all forms with the Rkv-s, with the Rkv-s that have seven mouths.

original: tvaṃ tyat paṇīnāṃ vido vasu saṃ mātṛbhirmarjayasi sva ā dama ṛtasya dhītibhirdame parāvato na sāma tad yatrāraṇanti dhītayaḥ
analyzed: tvam tyad paṇīnām vidaḥ vasu sam mātṛbhiḥ marjayasi sve ā dame ṛtasya dhītibhiḥ dame parāvataḥ na sāma tat yatra araṇanti dhītayaḥ
translated: That which thou knowest, O finder of treasure, thou dost adorn with the Mothers in thy own abode, with the thoughts of holy order, in thy abode. The Sâman is far away, where the thoughts are set in motion.

original: tridhātubhiraruṣībhirvayo dadhe rocamāno vayo dadhe
analyzed: tri dhātubhiḥ aruṣībhiḥ vayaḥ dadhe rocamānaḥ vayaḥ dadhe
translated: He has taken his place with the three ruddy (cows), the radiant one has taken his place.🔽He goes forth in front, he is looked at, the beautiful chariot is harnessed with its rays, the beautiful chariot of the gods.

original: pūrvāmanu pradiśaṃ yāti cekitat saṃ raśmibhiryatate darśato ratho daivyo darśato rathaḥ agmannukthāni pauṃsyendraṃ jaitrāya
analyzed: pūrvām anu pradiśam yāti cekitat sam raśmibhiḥ yatate darśataḥ rathaḥ daivyaḥ darśataḥ rathaḥ agman ukthāni pauṃsyā indram jaitrāya
translated: The praises have come to the manly one, Indra, for victory.

original: vajraśca yad bhavatho anapacyutāsamatsvanapacyutā
analyzed: vajraḥ ca yat bhavathaḥ an apacyutā a samatsu an apacyutā
translated: When you two become the thunderbolt, never failing, in battles, never failing.

original: nānānaṃ vā u no dhiyo vi vratāni janānām
analyzed: nānānam vai u naḥ dhiyaḥ vi vratāni janānām
translated: Our thoughts are different, and the ways of life of the people are different.

original: takṣā riṣṭaṃ rutaṃ bhiṣag brahmā sunvantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: takṣā riṣṭam rutam bhiṣaj brahmā sunvantam ichati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The carpenter desires the wounded, the physician the one who is sick, the priest the one who is pressing. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: jaratībhiroṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām
analyzed: jaratībhiḥ oṣadhībhiḥ parṇebhiḥ śakunānām
translated: With the old plants, with the feathers of the birds,

original: kārmāro aśmabhirdyubhirhiraṇyavantamichatīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: kārmāraḥ aśmabhiḥ dyubhiḥ hiraṇyavantam icchati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The smith desires the one who has gold with the stones that shine. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: kārurahaṃ tato bhiṣagupalaprakṣiṇī nanā
analyzed: kāruḥ aham tatas bhiṣaj upala prakṣiṇī nanā
translated: I am the physician who removes the stone.

original: nānādhiyovasūyavo 'nu gā iva tasthimendrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: nānā dhiyaḥ vasūyavaḥ nu gāḥ iva tasthima indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The Vasus, with different thoughts, longing for wealth, stand like cows. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: aśvo voḷhā sukhaṃ rathaṃ hasanāmupamantriṇaḥ
analyzed: aśvaḥ voḍhā sukham ratham hasanām upamantriṇaḥ
translated: The horse, the cart, the pleasant chariot, the laughers, the advisers,

original: śepo romaṇvantau bhedau vārin maṇḍūka ichatīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: śepaḥ romaṇvantau bhedau vārin maṇḍūkaḥ ichati indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The penis, the hairy ones, the two parts, the frog in the water desires. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: śaryaṇāvati somamindraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā
analyzed: śaryaṇāvati somam indraḥ pibatu vṛtrahā
translated: In the Sarana country, Indra, the slayer of Vritra, shall drink the Soma.

original: balaṃ dadhāna ātmani kariṣyan vīryaṃ mahadindrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: balam dadhānaḥ ātmani kariṣyan vīryam mahat indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Endowed with strength, about to perform great valor for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: ā pavasva diśāṃ pata ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ
analyzed: ā pavasva diśām pate ārjīkāt soma mīḍhvaḥ
translated: Flow to the lord of the quarters, O Soma, from the Ārjīka, O bountiful one

original: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā suta indrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: ṛtavākena satyena śraddhayā tapasā sutaḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: With the truth of the Ṛta, with faith, with austerity, pressed, for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: parjanyavṛddhaṃ mahiṣaṃ taṃ sūryasya duhitābharat
analyzed: parjanya vṛddham mahiṣam tam sūryasya duhitā abharat
translated: The bull, increased by Parjanya, she, the daughter of the sun, bore

original: taṃ gandharvāḥ pratyagṛbhṇan taṃ some rasamādadhurindrāyendopari srava
analyzed: tam gandharvāḥ pratyagṛbhṇan tam some rasam ādadhuḥ indrāya indo upari srava
translated: The Gandharvas received him, they placed that essence in the Soma, for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: ṛtaṃ vadannṛtadyumna satyaṃ vadan satyakarman
analyzed: ṛtam vadan ṛtadyumna satyam vadan satya karman
translated: Speaking truth, with the splendor of truth, speaking truth, with truthful deeds

original: śraddhāṃ vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛta indrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: śraddhām vadan soma rājan dhātrā soma pariṣkṛtaḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Speaking faith, O Soma, O king, purified by the creator, O Soma, for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: satyamugrasya bṛhataḥ saṃ sravanti saṃsravāḥ
analyzed: satyam ugrasya bṛhataḥ sam sravanti saṃsravāḥ
translated: The streams of the mighty one flow together, of the true one

original: saṃ yanti rasino rasāḥ punāno brahmaṇā hara indrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: sam yanti rasinaḥ rasāḥ punānaḥ brahmaṇā haraḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: The juices of the juices flow together, purified by the Brahman, O bay one, for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyāṃ vācaṃ vadan
analyzed: yatra brahmā pavamāna chandasyām vācam vadan
translated: Where, O Pavamāna, the Brahman, speaking the Vedic speech in the Vedic verses

original: grāvṇā some mahīyate somenānandaṃ janayannindrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: grāvṇā some mahīyate somena ānandam janayan indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Is honored with the Soma, generating joy with the Soma, for Indra, O Indu, flow around

original: yatra jyotirajasraṃ yasmin loke svarhitam
analyzed: yatra jyotiḥ ajasram yasmin loke svarhitam
translated: Where the imperishable light, in which world the heavenly is desired

original: tasmin māṃ dhehi pavamānāmṛte loke akṣita indrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: tasmin mām dhehi pavamāna amṛte loke akṣite indrāya indo pari srava
translated: In that, O purifying one, place me in the imperishable world for Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: yatra rājā vaivasvato yatrāvarodhanaṃ divaḥ
analyzed: yatra rājā vaivasvataḥ yatra avarodhanam divaḥ
translated: Where the king Vivasvat is, where is the confinement of heaven,

original: yatrāmūryahvatīrāpastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: yatra amūḥ yahvatīḥ āpaḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where the swift-flowing waters are, there make me immortal, O Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: yatrānukāmaṃ caraṇaṃ trināke tridive divaḥ
analyzed: yatra anukāmam caraṇam trināke tridive divaḥ
translated: Where the path of desire is, in the three-naveled heaven of the three-fold sky,

original: lokā yatra jyotiṣmantastatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: lokāḥ yatra jyotiṣmantaḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where the luminous worlds are, there make me immortal, O Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: yatra kāmā nikāmāśca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam🔽svadhā ca yatra tṛptiśca tatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo parisrava
analyzed: yatra kāmāḥ nikāmāḥ ca yatra bradhnasya viṣṭapam  svadhā ca yatra tṛptiḥ ca tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo parisrava
translated: Where desires and cherished desires are, where is the expanse of the sun,🔽Where is the oblation and satisfaction, there make me immortal, O Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: yatrānandāśca modāśca mudaḥ pramuda āsate
analyzed: yatra ānandāḥ ca modāḥ ca mudaḥ pramudaḥ āsate
translated: Where joys and delights and pleasures and great pleasures abide,

original: kāmasya yatrāptāḥ kāmāstatra māmamṛtaṃ kṛdhīndrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: kāmasya yatra āptāḥ kāmāḥ tatra mām amṛtam kṛdhi indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Where desires are fulfilled by desire, there make me immortal, O Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: ya indoḥ pavamānasyānu dhāmānyakramīt
analyzed: yaḥ indoḥ pavamānasya anu dhāmāni akramīt
translated: He who has followed the forms of the purifying Indu,

original: tamāhuḥ suprajā iti yaste somāvidhan mana indrāyendo pari srava
analyzed: tam āhuḥ suprajāḥ iti yaḥ te soma avidhat manaḥ indrāya indo pari srava
translated: Him they call well-born, O Soma, he who has purified your mind for Indra, O Indu, flow around.

original: ṛṣe mantrakṛtāṃ stomaiḥ kaśyapodvardhayan giraḥ
analyzed: ṛṣe mantra kṛtām stomaiḥ kaśyapa udvardhayan giraḥ
translated: O Rishi, with the hymns composed by the sages, Kashyapa, exalting the songs,

original: somaṃnamasya rājānaṃ yo jajñe vīrudhāṃ patirindrāyendo parisrava
analyzed: somaṃnamasya rājānam yaḥ jajñe vīrudhām patiḥ indrāya indo parisrava
translated: Saluting Soma, the king, who was born as lord of the plants, O Indu, flow to Indra.

original: sapta diśo nānāsūryāḥ sapta hotāra ṛtvijaḥ
analyzed: sapta diśaḥ nānā sūryāḥ sapta hotāraḥ ṛtvijaḥ
translated: The seven directions with different suns, the seven priests who offer oblations,

original: devā ādityā ye sapta tebhiḥ somābhi rakṣa na indrayendo pari srava
analyzed: devāḥ ādityāḥ ye sapta tebhiḥ soma abhi rakṣa naḥ indrayā indo pari srava
translated: The seven Āditya gods, with them, O Soma, protect us. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.

original: yat te rājañchṛtaṃ havistena somābhi rakṣa naḥ
analyzed: yat te rājan śṛtam haviḥ tena soma abhi rakṣa naḥ
translated: With that offered oblation of yours, O king, with that, O Soma, protect us.

original: arātīvā mā nastārīn mo ca naḥ kiṃ canāmamadindrāyendo parisrava
analyzed: arātīvā mā naḥ tārīt mā u ca naḥ kim cana amamat indrāya indo parisrava
translated: Do not lead us to misfortune, nor let anything be wanting to us. Flow around, O Indu, for Indra.
